story:
BGOP Investments invests in companies primarily in Brazil.

We believe that Brazil’s unique emerging market opportunities offer seasoned investors significant upside and an opportunity to diversify their investment risk.

In particular, periods of economic uncertainty and stock market volatility often prove to be highly favorable for private equity investors.
story_txt: BGOP Investments invests in companies primarily in Brazil.We believe that Brazil’s unique emerging market opportunities offer seasoned investors significant upside and an opportunity to diversify their investment risk.In particular, periods of economic uncertainty and stock market volatility often prove to be highly favorable for private equity investors.

story:
WHO I AM

My name is Polo my goal is simple; beautiful pictures at a budget. Pictures are meant to capture moments in time to be shared with loved ones. Unfortunately those moments seem to be expensive and many arent able to afford it. 

I wanna start a business to capture these moments at a reasonable price and still offer free services to those who are unable to afford it.

What I Need

I'm not looking for state of the art equipment, though I don't want to cheapen the experience. My starting gear would be:

Sony Nex-5r 16.1mp Mirrorless camera with 18-55mm lens. This is the starter kit that I believe will capture these moments in stunning clarity. Below are some samples taken with the following camera.

 

The Impact

I can help those who want to capture their moments and help them share with their loved ones with my services.

story:
So, what’s this all about, then?

As the MM romance genre has grown over the past few years, so has the demand for stock imagery to be used in cover art. 

One of the main problems we all face as authors is that dreaded moment when we look at a cover spec sheet and realise our dream cover is never going to happen, because there simply isn’t any stock photography of two (or more!) men together in a romantic or intimate pose.

The project aims to plug this gap in the market and create a bank of stock photographs. We don’t want hundreds of images of buff guys with their shirts off – the plan is to have a very broad range of looks, ages, and ethnicities, in both a studio setting and “on location”.

As well as providing images to the MM romance novel industry, we think there’s a market to sell these photographs to LGBT charities, magazines, websites, newspapers internationally, non-fiction and educational books… there’s really a very broad scope that we aim to target.

Okay, I’m interested. Why should I give you my hard-earned money?

If you’ve ever looked at a cover spec sheet and sighed, knowing that the perfect image to convey the romance in your story just doesn’t exist – well, this is your chance to change that. You can choose to purchase credits which can be cashed in for actual pictures. Or, if you know what you want and have the cash to spare, you can commission photographs to your exact specifications. Tell us you want a red-headed guy kissing a dark-skinned man, and we can make that happen.

I’m not quite convinced.

No problem. Give us ten bucks and you’ll get access to a locked tumblr account, meaning you can browse the photos at your leisure and let us know if there’s an image you want to purchase.

Okay, what will that cost me?

Between $50 and $150, depending on the picture.

Bloody hell! That’s a lot more than most stock photos!

Yes. There’s a premium involved for how specific this project is, and because, frankly, there isn’t much (if any) stock photos out there of gay men in romantic poses. As we build up the bank of images we hope to be able to offer bundles and deals – you’ll be able to buy five, ten, twenty-five credits for a fixed price.

Well, how do you know what authors want?

Because I am one. Because I’ve been in that position, knowing that even though MM romance is a huge industry and growing rapidly, there isn’t any stock photography that accurately depicts my characters and their relationship.

Because I’ve talked to them, my colleagues and peers, and asked them what it is they’re looking for that they can’t get from the existing stock photography sites.

If you want to weight in and share your opinion, there's a Survey Monkey now live - please do share your thoughts! We are definitely looking to take on board as much feedback as possible. https://www.surveymonkey.com/s/ZHT2NXF

Who else is involved?

I’m working with the main Gay/LGBT romance publishers to establish their needs and to make those critical connections. I’ve got a fantastic Marketing and Social Media manager on board who I have a lot of faith in. I’m currently interviewing photographers to make sure they’re not going to turn up to a shoot and squick out when they find out what we want to do. A website is currently under design and we’re looking to launch branding, the website, and an advertising campaign in due course.

How much money are you going to be making out of this?

One of the things that is important to me in this project is that everyone gets paid. We are all aware of the horror stories in the creative sector where people are expected to work for free – this isn’t going to be one of those projects. I want to make sure the models, photographers, marketing manager and creative director all get paid for their time and work.

What happens if you make more than the target?

If we make more than the $4k at the top of the page it’ll all get re-invested back into the project. That means more models, more studio time, more variety for the end consumer (ie, you.)  We’ve got a projected breakdown of costs (see below) and we do raise over and above our target, investing in models is going to be my main priority. The more models we have, the more options we have, and more options means a more diverse bank of photographs.

Uh,  I think the covers of a lot of MM romance covers are pretty good, actually. You’re rude.

There’s MM romance covers out there that are stunning, please don’t misunderstand me. I have covers that I wouldn’t change even if you paid me. The cover artists working in this genre do amazing things with, let’s face it, not very much to work from. Nor am I trying to put the drawn cover artists out of business.

What I want is for us to have the option – if we so wish – to have the sort of covers that are considered normal, even boring, in the M/F romance world. Pictures of men interacting with each other.

Tell me more about these models, then…

To be honest, the number and quality of models we can hire on the initial shoot completely depends on how much money we raise. I’d like to start out with a minimum of six models – if they all work with each other, that means we get 20 couple combinations. If I can get ten models, we get 45 couple combinations. Add throuples in there, too, plus “secondary” imagery (think hands, feet, headless torsos, backs, arms, holding hands – basically anything that doesn’t show faces) and we’re going to start out with a massive variety of images from the first weekend of shooting alone.

In my ideal, dream world, we’d hire professional models from an agency. However, the cost of doing this is enormous, and unless we totally smash the fundraising target, that’s not going to happen. So, my plan is to scout models locally.

I live and work in Bristol, England, right in the middle of the city’s “gay district” Old Market (coincidence, I promise). I feel fairly confident I can find half a dozen or more attractive gay men who would be willing to strip off and get cosy with each other in return for a reasonable fee.

I like the sound of this but man, I’m broke.

My friend, we’ve all been there. Donations start from a dollar – everything helps! You can help by sharing this on social media – the more people that know about it, the more chance we have of succeeding. Then you win anyway, because the options I talked about earlier now exist.

Do you do this a lot? Conversations with yourself?

More than you think. More than you could ever think.

*

Breakdown of projected costs:

Models - £1,000 ($1,600) per day

Photographer - £300 - £500 ($480 - $800) per day

Studio hire - £120 ($200) per day

Post production - £200 ($320)

Webmaster - £400 - £600 ($640 - $960)

Clothes for shoot - £200 ($320)

Business cards, flyers and posters - £150 ($240)

Marketing & Social Media manager - £250 ($400)

(all conversion rates are approximate, rounded figures, correct as of October 2014)

story:
So what is this retreat? I'm glad you asked! 

After a lot of thought and prayer, I have registered to fly to Washington state this summer for something called the Delight Retreat. Let me explain a little! :) Delight is a ministry that is very dear to my heart and something i've been involved with for over 2 years. Delight is a community of young women all pursuing Jesus and the creative arts (whether it be photography, graphic design, painting, or culinary!) Delight was founded by Kristin Wall (and is now run by her and several other amazing, Godly leaders) and her goal is to help us grow in our relationship with Jesus while also growing in our skill and building relationships with other girls all over the country who have similar interests. This ministry has blessed me SO much over the past several years - I have learned so much more about photography and how to better develop my business (as well as gotten awesome feedback many times). But even more than that, I've been able to connect with some of the most amazing women all over the country and they've encouraged me, challenged me, and helped me grow in the Lord. It's been incredible. 

This retreat is an incredible opportunity to learn from others and better develop my skills (there will be 24 other girls there and many of them are photographers!!), but it will also be an amazing time to grow personally and experience Jesus in the gorgeous setting of Washington State. 

I would like to ask you to please consider supporting me in this learning opportunity! My goal is to raise $1,000 dollars by March 1st to cover the remaining expenses. If you can't support me financially, I would be so very grateful for your support in prayer. Thank you so much! xoxo Micaela 

If you want to learn more about this ministry check out their website here! http://www.delightandbe.com - God is doing amazing things through this. :)

Where the money will go:

The $1,000 will be used to cover the rest of the expenses for the retreat/travel. I need another $400 to finish paying for the retreat itself and then I will have to purchase a plane ticket to WA state and check a bag which is where the rest of the money will go. Retreat info here: http://www.delightretreat.com

story:
It's a Villainous type of year!

Euphoria's Cosplay Calendar is back with all new cosplays!

  • Hi, I'm Bridgett with Euphoria!
  • Our Cosplay Calendar features all new hand made costumes made by me and Photos by Cameko Cosplay
  • By supporting this project you can enjoy some wicked fun all year long!

This full-color 12-month cosplay calendar is 8.5"x11" closed, saddle stitched, and has a drilled hole for easy hanging.

The Diabolical Bundle also includes and Exclusive Catwoman Print, Catwoman Sticker and custom made small bag or Character themed Christmas Stocking using Scrap Fabric from the Characters in the Calendar.

Each Month features a new, never before seen cosplay that I created this past year. I personally handmade each costume with love and care. Choosing characters from all genres, you're sure to find one that you love.  We also have special guests featured in 5 of the months.

story:
Our Story

I have been running my own photography studio since 2007. In that time, I have gained extensive knowledge of everything photography. The only thing I need now is the most important: your support. 2012 is going to be the year that I truly take off and become a huge success, but I can't do that without the help of generous folks like yourself. You can help me fulfill my dreams by contributing in any way you can (even the smallest contribution makes a huge difference!)


The Impact

I have a unique and inspired vision that I can spread to the world. Through my photography, I bring to life the true beauty of our planet and the diverse people and critters that inhabit it. This coming year is the time when I am going to bring my photography to the next level and spread it on a global scale. Imagine you are looking for a photographer for a wedding or for professional photos of your first child, would you want the same old boring style or would you want a truly unique experience that you can cherish for years to come? 


What We Need & What You Get

My goal is to raise $5000. All contributions will be used solely for improving my company (purchasing more equipment and spreading the word about my photography across multiple markets). Even the smallest contribution will help in some way, so don't feel like you have to contribute a lot in order to make a difference. Even if I don't meet my monetary goal, I will still be using the donations to better my company.


For what you get, see the Perks below.


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand the situation of the world we live in today, so even if you can't contribute any money to my cause, you can still spread the word about my photography. You can post about my work on Facebook, MySpace, or Twitter. If you know someone who is in need of a skilled, professional photographer, send them my way! Again, anything helps my cause a great deal!

story:
Introducing: SHOTBOX 2.0  

The SHOTBOX is a Collapsible Tabletop Studio that uses high powered LEDs to create a perfectly lit “micro-studio” environment to get great images with any camera, including smart devices.

Last year, Kickstarter helped us take this from Prototype ...

 

 ... To the finished, basic SHOTBOX: 

 LED diffusion strips for softer light:

  LED dimmer switch for perfect light control:

 Inside support ribbing that softens the light for better results:

All of this helps you get the perfect stable shot with your smart phone or tablet!

You can use any camera you own, and the SHOTBOX is particularly optimized for iPhones, Androids and other smart devices.

 

 

 

  

 

The list of possible SHOTBOX uses is endless.
Here are some popular options:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Now, let's talk about the reason we are here ... 

The EXTENSION : PANELS

PANELS set the stage for your creativity. Pick and choose background and floor sheets that take your photos to brand new levels of expression and showmanship.

Simply insert the PANEL Base into your SHOTBOX and lift the back PANEL into place. Now choose your desired custom-sized Prints to build your scene. The base PANELS are magnetic so you can easily keep the back Print in place with the included magnets. Once the prints are in place, you're ready to stage with objects and props. This is where it gets fun. Let your imagination run wild! Impress your clients, customers, and friends with your unique creativity.

Prints are custom-sized and we'll include 8 select images in the Essential Kit.

We'll let backers choose the eight images by popular vote at the end of the campaign!

We'll also include 4 rare earth magnets so you can create backgrounds of your own!

 

 Then you can take pictures like these with just a phone camera!

 

 

 

 

 

PACKAGE OPTIONS

 

Our History

We came up with the idea when trying to figure out how to scan 12x12 scrapbook pages over 12 years ago. The concept has been stewing ever since. It's time to bring it to market.  

It isn't just for scrapbook pages, though. It's much, much broader in use. All of these samples are taken with a smartphone (Galaxy S4), but you could easily use a DSLR or digital point-and-shoot as well.

Our Founder, Aaron Johnson, co-invented the Cricut Cutter and singularly invented the Basic SHOTBOX. He is constantly asking customers for feedback to finding new possibilities to make the SHOTBOX better.

He has gathered a great team to ensure you get the best product and customer service experience possible:

 

   

Thank you for your support! 

We can't say it enough. Thanks for believing in our team and for helping us make SHOTBOX 2.0 a reality. We can't wait to finish this project and get it into your hands!

story:
Dear Supporters,

I'm a Bosnian-American photojournalist, and have been working on this documentary project following the continued search for loved ones still buried in mass graves 19 years after the Bosnian war. This is not the pretty side of Bosnia I would have liked to portray, but this is what’s been done to my country, and, for the sake of the truth a more promising future, I have pursued this project for the past year and a half to help bring some closure to the thousands who still suffer.

 

From 1992-1995 about 30,000 Bosnians disappeared. Years later, their bodies were found in mass graves, piled on top of one another. Some of the most known massacres happened in Srebrenica, Visegrad and Prijedor, but there are many others as well throughout the countryside. More than 400 mass graves have been discovered, and just in November 2010, researches found three more. Thousands of people are still missing.

 

During the war, mothers used to hope their sons and husbands would return alive. Today they move back years of piled leaves and earth, hoping to find pieces of their families for proper burials.

 

How can we help?

Making the images is only the first step. Documentary photography is meant for large audiences, and to share my work, to communicate the stories of these women and to reinforce how devastating the lingering effects of war are, I need to show my work to others.

 

For the 16th anniversary of the Srebrenica genocide, I will have an exhibition in the US Congress building on July 11, 2011. It is my hope that showing the images to members of Congress and other visitors the work will remind those in power, and those who can voice their opinions that we cannot ever allow such a tragedy to happen again anywhere in the world. For many outside of Bosnia grasping the story of a complicated war can be difficult, but seeing my images of those who suffer still today and understanding with compassion is easy.

 

As evidence of the continued saga of this sad story, last week, war criminal Ratko Mladic was arrested. He was accused for the siege of Sarajevo and responsible for the Srebrenica genocide and 8,000 lives lost there.

 

So how can we help the people directly affected by the genocide?

Many mass graves have yet to be found, and if my project makes one person to react to help speed up the process of finding the mass graves, then I will consider this a success. Tens of thousands of Bosnians live all over the world, and many still have yet to find closure to their loss.  My goal is that this project raises awareness and raises the need to find closure.

 

Your contribution?

In an effort to reach my goals, I am hoping to raise $5,500 to help put exhibitions in US, Bosnia, and Canada. The money raised from this campaign will directly support the exhibition of this project.

 

This is a big goal. But I’m a believer. And with your help it will be easier. So help me reach my goal.  Spread the word about this video. Share it with your friends.

story:
Short Summary

NEW FLESH: A Pictorial Of Wade Radford. Featuring all the Early years photography taken by Jason Impey of performance poet, filmmaker and actor Wade Radford.

Due to the expense of producing Photography books we are running pre-orders via Indie Go Go to ensure we raise the much needed funds. 

Limited ONLY to 50 Hardback Book copies EVER, please be sure to donate to not miss out on owning a First Edition that will NEVER be republished. Each book is individually numbered on the opening page. A4, 70-80 pages, colour photographs feature throughout. Forewords included at front, but after that... PURE PICCIES... We don't want to be bogged down in text for an item such as this. Including previously published and unpublished photoshoots. Including all original photographs from the first Boys Behind Bars 'Wade in Chains' promotional shoot. Most of the photographs are archival shoots between 2013-2014. Many unseen for years.

As you will see through this page you can buy an unsigned copy, signed copy or for over £50 you will get a signed copy + your name at the back of the book as a supporter of creation. 

What We Need & What You Get

- We need to raise £500 to get the ball rolling, but any extra is a bonus. Extra funds raise (in the event of) will be used to maybe print some glossy A4 photographs to send alongside the book to generous donors. 

 

Many people have enquired about a photography book over the years and we are excited to bring it to you at last. 

ALL ORDERS will be released for shipping on October 31st. If the book sells out on pre-order we won't be reissuing any more copies. Support our campaign to refuse disappointment. 

Thank you,

<3 

(Front Cover) - Hardback 2021.

story:
How did I get to be here asking for your help

For the past few years, I have been photographing small islands. The project is self-funded and over the years I have accumulated a solid body of work that now needs to see the light of day. Islands are often described as fragile and vulnerable. That is true only to a point. Islands and islanders are also very resilient, adaptive and immensely adept at finding new modes of survival in difficult circumstances. In the work I am planning to exhibit soon, I tried to capture some of those qualities in photographs of island landscapes. I will be starting work on the next phase of the project this summer. What I need your help with is the upcoming series of exhibits. 

The Impact

While magazines and on-line publications are a good way to show one's work, in photography, the actual final product of the photographic process is a print. In our visually saturated culture, there is an ever smaller number of people who get to see photographs as prints. I have been invited to exhibit at an international conference on islands in St. John's, Newfoundland, this October (http://www.naf2011.com) and at an exhibition space owned by the City of Saint John in New Brunswick. I am also hoping to arrange exhibits on Change Islands and on Fogo Island in Newfoundland, on Grand Manan Island in New Brunswick and on Vis Island in Croatia. I believe that it is very important to share my work with those who made it possible for me to create it by imagining and creating the landscapes and places I have photographed over the years. 

What I Need & What You Get

Making prints of a sufficient quality for an exhibit is a very expensive endeavour. The cost of good, fiber-based photographic paper alone is in hundreds of dollars. Renting adequate darkroom facilities is also quite expensive. And, if you ever tried to get a professional framing job done on a 16x20 or even 14x17 inch print, you know how expensive matting and simplest of frames can be. Your contributions will cover the production expenses for the exhibit. They will not cover the cost of my time, subsistence or anything along those lines. I am raising money so that I can spend some time printing in adequate facilities and with adequate supplies of photographic paper and chemicals. At the end of the day, I am hoping for a collection of professionally framed prints that you would be happy to hang on the wall of your living room. 

And that is why I am giving the prints out as incentives. They will be just as high quality as the stuff hanging at the exhibits, but also at about half the price I would usually sell them for. For example, an unframed 11x14 fiber-based, handmade silver print is normally $300. You can have it for as little as $150.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is important, but it's not the only way to help. Spread the word. Ask your friends to pitch in. Say "Hi!" if you see me on the street. 

If you live in St. John's and have darkroom facilities you'd like to share, get in touch. That would be just as valuable as any cash donation. If you own a framing business and are willing to consider a discount - that would be amazing. If you know that the company you work for would like a print in exchange for financial support, I would be happy to oblige. If you think of something I haven't thought of, send me an e-mail.

If you are an editor interested in publishing a story around this work - and paying for it ;) - that would be fantastic, too. 


How IndieGoGo works

I am totally new to this, so I am assuming that like me, you need to understand how this works. The text below is from the IndieGoGo website with some modifications. 

Unlike some other crowdfunding sites, IndieGoGo allows for partial funding. There is a 4% fee on funds raised if you meet your funding goal, and a 9% fee on funds raised if you do not. Those of you involved in fundraising know that this is pretty good as far as fee structures go. There may also be a 2-3% fee charged from the payment processor. If the payments are collected via PayPal, you will receive your money immediately, less 9%. You will automatically be sent 5% of your total money raised at the end of your campaign if you meet your goal. If the payments are collected via Direct Credit Card, you will receive your money at the end of your campaign, less either 4% or 9% depending on if you meet your goal.

story:
Discovering Wings:

Journey to discover, celebrate and share the stories of strong, inspiring women through photography.

When you look in the mirror, what do you see?

As a photographer, I am passionate about helping others to recognize the truest depths of their beauty, inside and out.

So often I have gorgeous and powerful women in front of me who are blind to their unique beauty. Sometimes they wear veils; other times masks. Yet all are carrying some distorted view of reality whereas their personal image is concerned.



I have launched this page to raise funds for Project Discovering Wings: A Journey to Discover, Celebrate and Share Stories of Strong, Inspiring Women Through Photography.

The idea behind this project was born out of watching my mother work her entire life, 2-3 jobs at a time, caring for everybody except herself. Now I want to honor her and all the women in the world who are caretakers and may not take the time to pamper themselves, self indulge or feel like they matter. 

Every photo session will be offered at zero-cost to the participants. I am seeking funding to cover the costs associated with the shoots, equipment, insurance, and related road travel from New York City to California and back. 

On the road, I will have the assistance of someone who will not only record the journey for each of you to see watch throughout the trip, but will also assist me with all aspects of the personal photo shoots.



Essentially, you will be brought on the road with us! As we encounter these beautiful souls with inspiring tales, we will also allow you to connect with some of their images and stories via the Discovering Wings blog, http://discoveringwings.com.

Other images and story details will be reserved for inclusion in the exhibition as well as a book for sale in 2014, which will share the results of the journey in four-color.

Every amount helps and ensures you can help make a difference in another’s life.

Every woman's experience can affect the future of every female in her family. This could be a catalyst transformation and it starts with just one person.

Good karma to everybody involved!




Other Ways You Can Help


Use the Indiegogo share tools!


Can’t afford to donate? Understandable. Please help my mission by posting this link on Facebook and Twitter, as well as e-mailing it to all your friends and family who you think might be interested in supporting us. Even the smallest donation will help get it closer to my goal!



My photography started from nothing, from a dream in a small town where such dreams are rarely understood and often never realized. Thank you for your time and get ready to come along with us for the journey of a lifetime!



“To come to be you must have a vision of Being, a Dream, a Purpose, a Principle. You will become what your vision is.”

~Peter Nivio Zarlenga


Special thank you to all my past, current and future clients in addition to the amazing people I got to work with below that helped make this campaign happen.

Photo FX Studio http://www.photofxstudio.com/

Aldo Ryan Entertainment http://aldoryan.com/

Shoestring Videos

https://www.facebook.com/Shoestring4Nonprofits

Rachel S. Verdell  http://rachelstarverdell.com

Dre Brown Hair/Make-up drebrown1@gmail.com 

Thank you so much for all the contributors and believers in making my vision into a reality. I am forever grateful!

story:
AMAZING!!!! We 144% DID IT!!!!!!!!!!

Thank you everybody for all your help and support!! Big update is coming soon!!!


"Waiting" photobook. The sleep of parents-to-be

During several  years I've been photographing sleeping parents-to-be in Russia to complete a project called "Waiting". Being a documentary photographer, in 2009 - 2012 I worked in a rescue division and quite often photographed a lot of horrible things: car crashes, injuries, fires, big and small catastrophes. Most of the "Waiting" series was done during these years, and although I started it because of a very different reason (see a  video and a "Fairytale" below), this project became a very important "life" parallel to my main documentary work at that time. 

"Waiting" series took part in many exhibitions worldwide, was published in a lot of magazines, spread around the internet in many countries — and finally will be published as a book! This campaign is an opportunity to support the publication and pre-order the book that you'll get by July 2015!


A fairytale about five years of "Waiting", spiderman photographer and Masha, who forgot to tell her husband

Chapter one, where you'll find out about the "end of era"

This project started from a photograph that was made almost by accident: I took a picture of my sleeping friends who at that moment were expecting their daughter to be born in one month. To make this photograph early in the morning I had to climb a ladder that was standing right near their bad, symbolizing the remodeling they were doing getting the flat ready for the child. Here I must say that 2009 was a very difficult year for me — suddenly all of my friends became involved one way or the other in the "expecting" process, and all of our conversations got this special "parent" flavour, which very often had a panic taste. But no more late night beer drinking, nor spontaneous adventures nor meaningless chit-chats.

My friends Julia and Mikhail

By that time, I worked as a photographer in different mass media and was trying to develop my own projects — I also got used to the idea that you can trust your camera with all of your problems. This is how "Waiting" started — from "the end of era", from the moment when everybody around me suddenly became adults, while staying vulnerable, hesitating and unguarded as they were before.

Chapter Two, which shows how to sleep with a stranger looking at you

After making several photographs of my friends I switched to their friends, and when there were no more pregnant people around - I started to look for expecting families in different social networks. I would say it was the most difficult part. I sent hundreds and hundreds of letters asking: "can I photograph you sleeping?" and in 99%  the reply was: "you're insane!". Very often people thought I'm going to steal something, or I want to show "Russian people from a bad perspective" (this is still a big mystery to me) or they were sure I'm going to damage their ceiling by installing a camera to it. But almost from the very beginning I had a goal to photograph 40 couples resembling 40 weeks in pregnancy and will not stop unless I make it. I was lucky to find really open minded people who would agree not only to let a stranger into a house, but also to stay asleep while this stranger is climbing the ladder, making noise, holding a camera right over their heads and — waiting.

I would say this is the most anxious part — to be in a room with sleeping people, waiting — and this is also a huge part of "Waiting" — for a couple to turn, waiting for a blanket to move from a belly, waiting for them to wake up after the shoot, when you drink coffee in the kitchen (that was thoughtfully left for you beforehand), being not really sure if they heard you, if they know it is over.

Chapter Three where Masha forgot

In spite of the fact that everything looks so easy: find a family, come to their house either at night or early in the morning, climb the ladder and shoot — the whole process includes a lot of danger.

Danger one: heaviness. Monopod, camera, remote control device — all together they weigh several kilograms. If you don't do special arm workout — which I don't do — then holding it right above someone's bed for a long time is totally not possible. You start sweating like hell, your elbows curve in unexpected directions and your legs tremble like in cartoons. If you only imagine what happens if you drop all these equipment on innocent sleeping people — the trembling goes away under the pressure of responsibility. But no longer than for one minute.

Danger two: pets. Just think about it: a lot of people have cats. You can find them in many photographs from the project — they are resting somewhere around the bed, either between legs or on someone's belly. They create this special touchy atmosphere and raise the “'Awwww!” in an occupied room. But sometimes you don't know what happens after the shot is done, or just before it. Some pets (not understanding what’s happening up there) become very protective and start fighting with the camera, with the photographer or with the ladder. I lost several times to fights with cats, dogs and even one ferret.

And danger three: bad memory. Once I made an agreement with a pregnant lady that I will come to photograph her with her husband early in the morning. She opened the door for me, showed where to find  tea and went back to sleep. After half an hour waiting I entered the room, climbed the huge ladder that lead me almost to 3,5 meter high ceiling and started to shoot. At some point, the husband, sleeping peacefully nuzzling his pillow just before I started pressing the shutter, opened one eye, then the another one. There was  real fear in his eyes. I think at this moment there was something even more terrifying on my face, because I had no idea what to do: to run or to explain. Staring at me, he touched his wife's arm, asking: "Masha, who is this?". Masha was not surprised at all, she said with a sleepy voice: "It's a photographer, darling, go back to sleep". And "darling" turned around and fell asleep. Later I found out that he never recalled this situation, being sure it was just a dream.

Chapter Four where you’re looking for greater meaning

And the main question — what is it all about? While looking at photographs that appeared as an attempt to get used to the new stage of my life, by showing them to friends and colleagues, I realized that I was looking not only at different poses people sleep in, but mostly at things that surround them: all these slippers, sofas, mobile phones, toys on pillows, laptops, "Star Wars" bedsheets — all this is telling an amazing story about the generation to which I also belong — about people who were born just before the fall of the Soviet Union, about young families in big Russian cities, about "here and now". But it also tells a story about something that will come, because all of these children who are already invisibly present on these images — they symbolize this waiting for a future, the future that will be totally different and - of course — much better than our "here and now".

The publication of the book is a way to save "Waiting" project as a document of time, a reason for nostalgia, an object for admiration and as an evidence of human beauty and openness.

Since 2009 the project was seen in many countries, took part in several festivals, was published in dozens of magazines and right now, I guess, it lives its own life on the internet.

"Waiting" at Chobi Mela Festival, Bangladesh, 2015

Together with a designer Anton Lepashov we made a book dummy and going  to publish at least 500 copies,  - but decided that we'll print as many books as requested. So now it's the best time to make a pre-order for the "Waiting" photobook — and as soon as it will be printed in June this year, we'll send it to you!

There are no risks, as soon as all necessary agreements made, the book is ready to be published, I have also my own savings to support it and except of this campaign there is also one more local crowd funding in Russia.

The first time "Waiting" was ever published, it was by "Russian Reporter" magazine in 2009. In 2013 online magazine "Slate", which audience is more than 1 million people around the world, made a post with several images from the project. Since that moment, the series became really known worldwide, the amount of re-posts and publications count in thousands, and it is very often that I get this question: where can I find the book? This campaign became possible because of this question — and we really count on your support!

About the author

My name is Jana Romanova, I'm a documentary photographer, based in Saint-Petersburg, Russia. Most of my work is dedicated to Russia and post-soviet space, I prefer to think of it through connections between people that exist in spite of any political or economical confrontations.

In 2013 I self-published two hand-made books "The Book of Savior" and "Shvilishvili", and am really big fan of photobooks, being also a collector. My projects were published in many magazines, "Russian Reporter"(Rus), "British Journal of Photography" (UK),  "Internazionale" (Italy), "Geo" (France), "Eikon" (Austria), OjodePez (Spain), "European Photography" (Germany) among others. I was also very lucky to present my works at several festivals worldwide (Russia, Portugal, Argentina, Spain, Finland, USA, the Netherlands), and also get several prizes and honorable mentions.

Find more on my website http://janaromanova.com

Thank you for supporting this book and helping it to become a reality!

Please, help to spread the information about this campaign everywhere in the internet: facebook, twitter and other social networks!
story_txt:
AMAZING!!!! We 144% DID IT!!!!!!!!!!Thank you everybody for all your help and support!! Big update is coming soon!!!"Waiting" photobook. The sleep of parents-to-be

During several  years I've been photographing sleeping parents-to-be in Russia to complete a project called "Waiting". Being a documentary photographer, in 2009 - 2012 I worked in a rescue division and quite often photographed a lot of horrible things: car crashes, injuries, fires, big and small catastrophes. Most of the "Waiting" series was done during these years, and although I started it because of a very different reason (see a  video and a "Fairytale" below), this project became a very important "life" parallel to my main documentary work at that time. 
"Waiting" series took part in many exhibitions worldwide, was published in a lot of magazines, spread around the internet in many countries — and finally will be published as a book! This campaign is an opportunity to support the publication and pre-order the book that you'll get by July 2015!




A fairytale about five years of "Waiting", spiderman photographer and Masha, who forgot to tell her husbandChapter one, where you'll find out about the "end of era"This project started from a photograph that was made almost by accident: I took a picture of my sleeping friends who at that moment were expecting their daughter to be born in one month. To make this photograph early in the morning I had to climb a ladder that was standing right near their bad, symbolizing the remodeling they were doing getting the flat ready for the child. Here I must say that 2009 was a very difficult year for me — suddenly all of my friends became involved one way or the other in the "expecting" process, and all of our conversations got this special "parent" flavour, which very often had a panic taste. But no more late night beer drinking, nor spontaneous adventures nor meaningless chit-chats.My friends Julia and Mikhail

By that time, I worked as a photographer in different mass media and was trying to develop my own projects — I also got used to the idea that you can trust your camera with all of your problems. This is how "Waiting" started — from "the end of era", from the moment when everybody around me suddenly became adults, while staying vulnerable, hesitating and unguarded as they were before.

Chapter Two, which shows how to sleep with a stranger looking at you



After making several photographs of my friends I switched to their friends, and when there were no more pregnant people around - I started to look for expecting families in different social networks. I would say it was the most difficult part. I sent hundreds and hundreds of letters asking: "can I photograph you sleeping?" and in 99%  the reply was: "you're insane!". Very often people thought I'm going to steal something, or I want to show "Russian people from a bad perspective" (this is still a big mystery to me) or they were sure I'm going to damage their ceiling by installing a camera to it. But almost from the very beginning I had a goal to photograph 40 couples resembling 40 weeks in pregnancy and will not stop unless I make it. I was lucky to find really open minded people who would agree not only to let a stranger into a house, but also to stay asleep while this stranger is climbing the ladder, making noise, holding a camera right over their heads and — waiting.

I would say this is the most anxious part — to be in a room with sleeping people, waiting — and this is also a huge part of "Waiting" — for a couple to turn, waiting for a blanket to move from a belly, waiting for them to wake up after the shoot, when you drink coffee in the kitchen (that was thoughtfully left for you beforehand), being not really sure if they heard you, if they know it is over.

Chapter Three where Masha forgot

In spite of the fact that everything looks so easy: find a family, come to their house either at night or early in the morning, climb the ladder and shoot — the whole process includes a lot of danger. 
Danger one: heaviness. Monopod, camera, remote control device — all together they weigh several kilograms. If you don't do special arm workout — which I don't do — then holding it right above someone's bed for a long time is totally not possible. You start sweating like hell, your elbows curve in unexpected directions and your legs tremble like in cartoons. If you only imagine what happens if you drop all these equipment on innocent sleeping people — the trembling goes away under the pressure of responsibility. But no longer than for one minute.


Danger two: pets. Just think about it: a lot of people have cats. You can find them in many photographs from the project — they are resting somewhere around the bed, either between legs or on someone's belly. They create this special touchy atmosphere and raise the “'Awwww!” in an occupied room. But sometimes you don't know what happens after the shot is done, or just before it. Some pets (not understanding what’s happening up there) become very protective and start fighting with the camera, with the photographer or with the ladder. I lost several times to fights with cats, dogs and even one ferret. 


And danger three: bad memory. Once I made an agreement with a pregnant lady that I will come to photograph her with her husband early in the morning. She opened the door for me, showed where to find  tea and went back to sleep. After half an hour waiting I entered the room, climbed the huge ladder that lead me almost to 3,5 meter high ceiling and started to shoot. At some point, the husband, sleeping peacefully nuzzling his pillow just before I started pressing the shutter, opened one eye, then the another one. There was  real fear in his eyes. I think at this moment there was something even more terrifying on my face, because I had no idea what to do: to run or to explain. Staring at me, he touched his wife's arm, asking: "Masha, who is this?". Masha was not surprised at all, she said with a sleepy voice: "It's a photographer, darling, go back to sleep". And "darling" turned around and fell asleep. Later I found out that he never recalled this situation, being sure it was just a dream.

Chapter Four where you’re looking for greater meaning
And the main question — what is it all about? While looking at photographs that appeared as an attempt to get used to the new stage of my life, by showing them to friends and colleagues, I realized that I was looking not only at different poses people sleep in, but mostly at things that surround them: all these slippers, sofas, mobile phones, toys on pillows, laptops, "Star Wars" bedsheets — all this is telling an amazing story about the generation to which I also belong — about people who were born just before the fall of the Soviet Union, about young families in big Russian cities, about "here and now". But it also tells a story about something that will come, because all of these children who are already invisibly present on these images — they symbolize this waiting for a future, the future that will be totally different and - of course — much better than our "here and now".


The publication of the book is a way to save "Waiting" project as a document of time, a reason for nostalgia, an object for admiration and as an evidence of human beauty and openness. 
Since 2009 the project was seen in many countries, took part in several festivals, was published in dozens of magazines and right now, I guess, it lives its own life on the internet.


"Waiting" at Chobi Mela Festival, Bangladesh, 2015

Together with a designer Anton Lepashov we made a book dummy and going  to publish at least 500 copies,  - but decided that we'll print as many books as requested. So now it's the best time to make a pre-order for the "Waiting" photobook — and as soon as it will be printed in June this year, we'll send it to you!
There are no risks, as soon as all necessary agreements made, the book is ready to be published, I have also my own savings to support it and except of this campaign there is also one more local crowd funding in Russia.



The first time "Waiting" was ever published, it was by "Russian Reporter" magazine in 2009. In 2013 online magazine "Slate", which audience is more than 1 million people around the world, made a post with several images from the project. Since that moment, the series became really known worldwide, the amount of re-posts and publications count in thousands, and it is very often that I get this question: where can I find the book? This campaign became possible because of this question — and we really count on your support!
About the author
My name is Jana Romanova, I'm a documentary photographer, based in Saint-Petersburg, Russia. Most of my work is dedicated to Russia and post-soviet space, I prefer to think of it through connections between people that exist in spite of any political or economical confrontations.
In 2013 I self-published two hand-made books "The Book of Savior" and "Shvilishvili", and am really big fan of photobooks, being also a collector. My projects were published in many magazines, "Russian Reporter"(Rus), "British Journal of Photography" (UK),  "Internazionale" (Italy), "Geo" (France), "Eikon" (Austria), OjodePez (Spain), "European Photography" (Germany) among others. I was also very lucky to present my works at several festivals worldwide (Russia, Portugal, Argentina, Spain, Finland, USA, the Netherlands), and also get several prizes and honorable mentions.
Find more on my website http://janaromanova.com
Thank you for supporting this book and helping it to become a reality!Please, help to spread the information about this campaign everywhere in the internet: facebook, twitter and other social networks!

story:
The fourth postcard set of "Pin-Up Show"!

7 photo cards +1 artwork card. 4" by 6" with a classic postcard back. Words by fabulous Santino Rice.
 
Most everyone who sees this probably knows about "Pin-Up Show".
If you don't, please click this link here for info: http://trevorwayne.com/PinUpShow.html

For those of you who want to see the images UNCENSORED 18+ please click here: http://trevorwayne.tumblr.com/


One of the perks is the mini-mag that started the postcard series. It includes a dozen photos not in the cards, and three photos by horror legend Clive Barker.

I have stock left but have taken sales down off my site. I'm using the remaining mags as perks here.
Once the mags are all gone they will not be reprinted. "Pin-Up Show" will only live on in postcard form. Fun and kitschy, the way it should be.

Also postcard set 1 will be sold out after this presale.. I will reprint, but not soon.

Everyone who orders the "complete package" perk will get the set 1 art card by Angus Oblong (creator of "The Oblongs" TV cartoon signed by Oblong himself!


Shipping worldwide is included in the presale!


Postcards are printed! All items will be sent out every Friday!

Thank you all so much!!

Please repost and spread the word!

story:
Dhaka Photo Stories

This Spring teaching artists will partner with Carlotta Center in Dhaka, Bangladesh to conduct a workshop that empowers students to develop their own voice through basic photography and storytelling.  The Carlotta Center provides education and resources for children living in slums.

By giving students the skills to become documentors of their own experience, these amateur photographers will reveal the story of Bangladesh's underprivileged people in their own words. We will help them share their stories within their community and beyond.


PROJECT GOALS:

How can we use the arts to involve Bangladesh’s poorest in the discussion on Global Poverty?

Goal 1: Provide Empowerment Workshops to students that use art as a tool.  Help them find and utilize their voice and express the stories and ideas that are important to them.

The right to speak, be heard, and listen is an essential element in human dignity.

Goal 2: Develop effective means of disseminating photos and information about the project in a way that is accessible to many people, including the extreme poor.  The means of showing the work must align with the Workshop’s inclusive, empowering philosophies.  We will host a small reading of personal works, and disseminate booklets throughout the local slums and communities explaining the project.


By experiencing the difference between first person and third person narrative we will encourage more honest, compassionate, comprehensive dialog.


WHO WE ARE:

We are artists working between Chicago USA and Dhaka Bangladesh. Juneer Kibria grew up in Dhaka, Bangladesh and witnessed poverty and its effect on identity and culture as a child before attending graduate school at the School of the Art Institute of Chicago (SAIC). Much of his recent work is concerned with creating connections between his homes in Dhaka and Chicago. Betsy Zacsek is a Teaching Artist who creates and teaches educational art programs for both adults and children. We have worked collaboratively for nearly two years.


WHAT WE NEED/WHAT YOU GET:

This is a bare bones budget for running a Photography program for a dozen participants.  We are not paying ourselves and we are not charging our students or hosts for the program.


The bulk of the funds go toward the purchase of used digital cameras, memory cards, and the equipment and supplies that we need to print images. 

Dhaka Photo Stories is one part photography workshop, one part storytelling workshop. We will be printing the images, arranging them and building a personal narrative in Story-scrapbooks, which will be completed and shared at the end of our time together.  The Story-scrapbook is for the students to keep and constitutes the second most significant part of our spending.

As an alternative to a gallery show, we will produce multi-page booklets explaining the project goals and accomplishments, showcasing our student’s stories and their proudest work.  We will distribute these booklets in the neighborhoods where our students live, local community centers and Dhaka’s cultural centers. Although, printing is less expensive in Bangladesh than in the US, we still need a significant amount of money to spread the booklets around.

We’ll also be hosting a party that is somewhere between a gallery opening and a Reading, where we’ll provide food and drinks for the students’ family and friends, and for friends of the Carlotta Center.

If we fall short of our goal, we’ll do what artist’s do well, and get by on what we have, which will mean cutting back on printing costs and quality and accommodating fewer students. However, If we exceed our goal we will purchase higher quality materials, accommodate more students, and have more resources for developing appropriate ways to share the artwork.  If we have a surplus of money, we’ll even be able to leave cameras and instruction so the program can continue at Carlotta Center without our guidance.


IMPACT:

We believe that first hand accounts of life in a developing nation will lead to real honest discussions about the challenges, joy, values, and experiences of this often overlooked demographic. And that the collaboration between funders and recipients, speakers and listeners will enliven our visual culture.

Website: http://dhakaphotostories.wordpress.com/about/

               http://carlottacentre.blogspot.com//

story:
Short Summary :

what we do: PHOTOGRAPHY WORKSHOPS AND ART SHOWS FOR / BYFORMERLY TRAFFICKED WOMEN IN ITALY

lead by two italian photographers, Ippolita Franciosi e Letizia Rossi who believe that giving creative skills in digital photography to women is a way to share tools for empowerment and freedom. 
  • In Winter 2014- 15 two workshops were held Northern Italy,   very successful.

  • At the end of each workshop, the Association organized with the cultural commission of the city of Ferrara, a photo show titled PATCHWORKS- THE FACE OF FREEDOM IS FEMALE, which opened in Ferrara on March 8th

    ,with the female artists presenting their view of the city to the Italian public and a fundraising auction to fund the next workshop 

    The city of Trieste hosted the second show  in May 2015

  • PROJECT background:

  • Instead of doing another journalistic “expose’” on trafficked women in Italy, the two photographers gave cameras to the freed women.

    Instead of seeing the trafficking victims as ‘objects’ of our visual attention, the workshop engages the immigrants women living in protected homes in Milan, Modena, Florence, Turin, creating a space for their view of the world to emerge. During the workshop the women document their point of view of the cities where they are now patching a life together after years of enslavement.

    Their subjectivity emerges strongly in the choice not to offer their faces to be consumed in a photo, but rather to choose to photograph details of life, friends and to take shots of their ‘new’ daily life in the protected houses.

  • realizzata dalle donne e non sulle donne vittime della tratta. Una parte sarà composta da immagini di reportage sulla città in cui vivono (come si rapportano con gli spazi pubblici) e una parte da ritratti di se stesse realizzati in studio, dove appaiono rivelando solo particolari senza mai essere riconoscibili. 

  • What We Need & What You Get

Each workshop cotsts $1200 approx 1000 euros

We need support to cover travel, installation costs to make the workshops and exhibits visible across the country, and internationally.  

keep in mind that only 30%  goes to  cover organizational costs, most funding raised for the trafficking victims and purchasing cameras  and organizing the exhibit

  • each workshop is three days long
  • produces  30  to 45 prints  40cmx50cm on forex 
  • some prints are property of the participants and can not be sold

  • The Impact
  • We  gave trafficked women technical skills in digital photography, thus opening opportunities to work
  • We raised awareness among Italians that trafficking happens in their own town and such violence is too often invisible
  • We used photography to heal through the women's creativity, expressing their point of view instead of being seen as passive victims.

Risks & Challenges

Coprire almeno le spese di stampa della mostra per noi sarebbe già un buon obiettivo, per il resto crediamo nel lavoro di volontariato di una bella rete di persone che già credono in questo progetto. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Condividi e aiutaci a far conoscere il nostro progetto!

Se ci credi anche tu e non puoi contribuire economicamente, condividi nei social networks la nostra campagna!

story:
Florida Colors and Poetry by Anahilda Garcia

I need your help to publish "Florida Colors and Poetry”. This book is going to make a significant contribution to one of the most provocative issues today, preservation and restoration of nature and wildlife. Florida is a State of intense colors and natural beauty. Our mission is to help conserve and protect ecosystems and biodiversity. This means not only protecting wildlife, but also the land and water sources they use in order to thrive. 

                

My poems aim to create visual imagery in the mind of the reader and combine his imagination with actual pictures. To be able to express the emotions of the words from the poems and create a moving and provoking collaboration with the photographs we need your participation and support.  


This is how you can help

The budget has to cover some of the travel expenses, as well as the production and publishing of a high quality photography book. 

  • I am raising $5,000 that will cover the cost of publishing of 500 books. 70%
  • The books are going to have a hard cover with over 250 pages Over and 250 beautiful pictures that will let us see the miracles in the life around us.                                               

  • I have many pictures, but I still have to complete the project and the budget has to cover some travel expenses, 10%

  • I will use a professional editor and proofreader, for this project. 10%.

  • 5% of my budget has to cover the beautiful perks, fees and bank charges. 

  • Distribution and marketing of the book will be 5% of the budget. 
     
  The Impact to Florida's natural beauty

  • Florida is Colorful and beautiful. One of the most rewarding gifts that we can enjoy is to see the power of colors in nature. 
  • This photography book allows you to explore amazing photos of birds going about their day and the natural beauty of flowers, sunsets and the Florida skies.          
  • The combine results of poetry with photography raises its own particular questions about the rich possibilities for incorporating linked languages and artistic expressions.
  • This book is going to display a different perspective of the preservation of the environment, with poetry and a touch of history.  
  • We are going to make a donation of the book sales to a Florida conservation or wildlife preservation organization to ensure that nature will be around for future generations to enjoy.

        

           

This project started in my heart 

Be a part of the movement to make Florida a better place. I have been a Florida resident for over 30 years, taking pictures and participating in numerous exhibitions and community base artistic organizations. When I travel around Florida, I have to take pictures of flowers, sunsets, birds and wildlife, wondering sometimes if my great grandsons will be able to see what my eyes are seeing.  

  • I love taking pictures and writing, it is my passion and I have fun with it.
  • When I shoot I have to be aware of everything if I want to capture it. You can't be thinking to much, but feeling and blend with the surroundings.
  • But I need your help, I can't make this project without you.    
     
  • Other Ways You Can Help

  • Get the word out, connect with your friends an family, rally support and tell them about this photography book project, "Florida Colors and Poetry".

        

        

        

      


        Thank you in advance for your support to this project and feel free to comment           and contact us. Blessings.  

       Gracias por colaborar, amigos.

                                                                                                                     Anahilda Garcia.

The combine results of poetry with photography raises its own particular questions about the rich possibilities for incorporating linked languages and artistic expressions.
This book is going to display a different perspective of the preservation of the environment, with poetry and a touch of history.  
We are going to make a donation of the book sales to a Florida conservation or wildlife preservation organization to ensure that nature will be around for future generations to enjoy.
 

        
           


This project started in my heart   
Be a part of the movement to make Florida a better place. I have been a Florida resident for over 30 years, taking pictures and participating in numerous exhibitions and community base artistic organizations. When I travel around Florida, I have to take pictures of flowers, sunsets, birds and wildlife, wondering sometimes if my great grandsons will be able to see what my eyes are seeing.    I love taking pictures and writing, it is my passion and I have fun with it.
When I shoot I have to be aware of everything if I want to capture it. You can't be thinking to much, but feeling and blend with the surroundings.
 But I need your help, I can't make this project without you.     

Other Ways You Can Help


 

Get the word out, connect with your friends an family, rally support and tell them about this photography book project, "Florida Colors and Poetry".                                         Thank you in advance for your support to this project and feel free to comment           and contact us. Blessings.         Gracias por colaborar, amigos.                                                                                                                     Anahilda Garcia.

story:
I am a documentary photographer and social activist - www.jonathanmoller.org. I'm trying to raise the final $8,000 needed to print 1,500 copies of upcoming book, YOUNG CUBA, and an additional 1,500 copies of the separate Spanish language edition, CUBA JOVEN. This publication is the culmination of a multi-year project focusing on the diversity and dignity of young Cubans. The book will be published by Turner Libros, Madrid (publisher of my recent Peru book and the Spanish edition of my first Guatemala book). The book will include 229 color photographs and several short essays by young Cubans and others. The books will be widely distributed in Europe, the United States, Cuba, and numerous countries in Latin America. You can see a selection some of the images on my website: https://www.jonathanmoller.org/young-cuba-1993-..., and more info and blurbs for this book here (and scroll down):  https://www.jonathanmoller.org/books/ 

PLEASE SHARE THIS CAMPAIGN AND SPREAD THE WORD! Mil gracias! A thousand thanks!

story:
Ein Kalender - Für die Tafel e.V. Esens


In Deutschland gibt es Lebensmittel im Überfluss – und dennoch herrscht bei vielen Menschen Mangel.

Nicht alle Menschen haben ihr tägliches Brot – obwohl es Lebensmittel im Überfluss gibt. Die Tafeln bemühen sich mit der Hilfe von Ehrenämtern um eine bessere Lebenssituation für die Bedürftigen ihrer Stadt. Ihr Ziel ist es, alle qualitativ makellosen Nahrungsmittel, die im Lebensmittelkreislauf nicht mehr verwendet werden dürfen, an Mittellose zu verteilen.

Das Tafel-Konzept lautet „Jeder gibt, was er kann“. Gemäß diesem Leitspruch engagieren sich örtliche Bäckereien und Wochenmärkte, Supermarktketten, Kfz-Mechaniker, Grafiker, Automobilhersteller, Beratungsunternehmen und viele andere. Viele Helfer machen sich dafür auch in ihrer Freizeit stark. Ein paar Stunden am Tag, in der Woche oder im Monat, so wie es die persönlichen Umstände ermöglichen. Dazu zählen in Deutschland bereits rund 35.000 Menschen. Die gespendeten Lebensmittel werden auf diese Weise weitergereicht: Direkt durch örtliche Ausgaben und durch die Belieferung von Einrichtungen, welche die Nahrungsmittel selbst verteilen. Die Austeilung erfolgt kostenlos oder gegen einen symbolischen Betrag.

Über mich:

Mein Name ist Malte Menken, ich bin 22 Jahre alt und komme aus Esens. Der Erlös meines Projektes „Ein Kalender- Für die Tafel e.V.“ soll der Tafel e.V. Esens zugutekommen.

Seit ca. 2 Jahren beschäftige ich mich bevorzugt mit Landschafts- und Portraitaufnahmen aller Art und setze diese durch eine individuelle Bearbeitung in Szene.

Das Projekt:

Mit Ihrer Hilfe soll ein Kalender aus einzigartigen Bildern der Samtgemeinde Esens durch meine fotografische Arbeit entstehen.

Dieser wird zu einem Preis von 15 Euro zum Verkauf stehen- der Erlös hieraus wird zu 100% an die Tafel e.V. in Esens gehen.

Um den Druck dieser Kalender zu bewerkstelligen, fiel meine Wahl auf das Unternehmen „Online-Druck.biz“.

Hierbei liegt der Preis bei 463,11 Euro für 100 Kalender der Größe DIN A3 mit jeweils 13 Blatt.

Was ich brauche:

Genau hier ist Ihre Hilfe gefragt – um das Projekt realisieren und die Kalender bestellen zu können, brauche ich Ihre Spenden! Es spielt selbstverständlich keine Rolle, um wieviel Geld es sich handelt – jeder Euro hilft! Alle Spenden gehen natürlich an die Tafel e.V. in Esens - dafür garantiere ich!

Andere Wege der Unterstützung:

Doch nicht nur Geld hilft weiter. Du kannst mich auch mit deinem Wissen unterstützen! Du arbeitest im Bereich Print/Bildbearbeitung und hast Interesse das Projekt mitzugestalten? Engagierte, ehrenamtliche Helfer sind herzlich dazu eingeladen, sich bei mir zu melden.

Und nun das Wichtigste zum Schluss:

Teilt die Kampagne, unterstützt das Projekt und erzählt allen davon!

Lasst uns gemeinsam helfen!


Falls der Betrag für die Bestellung der Kalender in Höhe von 463,11€ nicht erreicht wird, kann das Projekt in dieser Form leider nicht verwirklicht werden. Selbstverständlich erreichen die Spenden in diesem Fall dennoch in vollem Umfang die Tafel e.V. Esens.

story:
My name is Miloš, and I’m an underwater photographer. I share my passion for the ocean through photography. It’s not only the underwater world that mesmerizes me, but also people and cultures directly tied to the sea. I fell in love with one of those cultures in Thailand, where I visited one of its gorgeous tiny islands called Koh Lipe. They are mostly known as Chao Lay in Thai or sea gypsies in English. I’ll call them Urak Lawoi as this is how they refer to themselves. 

This exotic culture was so alluring and enigmatic that it made me want to delve into it. That’s how the idea of the book was born. I collected stories and photographed every aspect of their life. The beginning wasn’t easy but now I’m far away from the start after three years of work. 

Mockup image of how the book will look like

I am 90% done to be precise. Now I need your help to get that book into the printing press, and you can do that by preordering the book from one of the options. I have created carefully tailored perks so you can find the one that best fits you.  You can make the least donation amount even if you are not interested in the book but willing to help.

 

Book specs:

  • 120 pages printed 
  • high-quality paper 
  • hardcover
  • 65 high-quality photographs from land, underwater, and from the air.
  • 3 amazing map illustrations
  • portrait Format
  • dimensions 23x30cm

 

Mockup image of how the book will look like
 

On-site Risks And Challenges

Working with the Urak Lawoi hasn’t always been easy, mostly due to the language barrier. I tried to overcome this obstacle by learning Thai, which I had limited success with, but enough to get me by. I tried my luck with the Urak Lawoi language, and few sentences I knew opened quite a few doors.

Photoshoots were enjoyable, but risky sometimes. They ranged from exposing the equipment to the elements and the injury risks. The underwater shots of the fishermen divers were the most dangerous as I had to keep in mind the divers, their hoses, and the boat while trying to photograph them. That would mean adequately setting up the strobes to get the best shot possible. 

The buttons on the camera stopped working being too exposed to the saltwater. Luckily, I got it repaired. 

It’s worth mentioning that I hired the locals on all of my shoots where I needed an extra hand, while on the other shoots where I interfered with their standard working dynamics, I paid them for their time.

How You Can Help

I understand that times are difficult. Still, if you wish to support me but are unable to make a monetary donation at this time, here are other ways you can help:

  • Preorder the book by choosing one of the perks
  • Share this campaign on your social networks
  • Share on social media using the Indiegogo share tools, or you can share the posts I've created on Facebook and Instagram (@prelevic.milos)

 

About Me:

I’m a programmer, divemaster, climber, writer, and internationally awarded photographer. My passions are the ocean and the cultures tied to the ocean. I have been photographing for more than 10 years but I think the last five I got more serious about it.

I couldn’t find my home for the past 6 years, but Koh Lipe has been a perfect place to rest on my neverending search.

story:
As an artist and young mother of two, my funds are very modest at best. I have always learned to adjust and achieve the best quality with what I am given to bring the ideas in my head to life. I am at the point in my life, where I want to create a finished piece of an idea that I have dreamt about since I was a young girl.

I have always been an "Urban Explorer," starting very young in high school exploring the local abandoned buildings, tunnels, and houses that were easily accessible. To me these locations were beautiful despite others considering them eyesores. These locations were our past; our history. I wanted to capture it all eternally. So as that when they were gone, and the world had moved on, others to come after us would know what once existed in magnificence even after it was abandoned and left to decay. I want to show how there is still youth appreciation for what our forefathers had created before us; wonders that seem impossible even compared to our standards today. Visualize the beauty that is still left in the decay that was left to this generation and those that will follow us before it is demolished from existence. Each of these locations has a vivid history still left in it's remains with new memories to create. To bring this visualization to life, I want to take various models and talented artists and place/ photograph them in these locations to allow others to see the beauty and ideas that exist through our stylization of the space. I want to show the beauty of the decay such as we see beauty in the age of even ourselves. I want to evoke all feelings whether it be happiness, admiration, love, hope, or on the opposite spectrum; fear, anger, or despair. 

The funds I am seeking are to purchase a much more capable camera and lens, the cost of shooting (permits, equipment, travel, etc) as I will not be charging the subjects in these photos, and the cost of producing  the completed book.

Even if I do not raise all the specified funds I will still be pooling the money to purchasing a new camera or finding a gently used one and continuing pursuing my passion. I will still push towards the goal of completing the book of photographic imagery based on Urban Exploring by 2015. 

I want this project to become part of the legacy I leave to my children. I am a young woman that has been faced with many trials from a young age. I have undergone many surgeries and I am currently missing 6 organs in my body. I have life long incurable medical conditions that affect me daily and yet I still push myself to do more and to make the most out of the time I am given here on earth. I could have given up but instead I find my hope and my light through two beautiful little girls and the art that I am able to create. I am thankful to the higher beings who have blessed me with the gift of optimism and determination. I am asking for the support of others to make my dream a reality by helping me fund my goal to further my photography and aspirations to be the best that I can be. 

Even if you may not be able to contribute financially, I will take any assistance i can get! From information on locations that fit the criteria, to models and talented artists, to passing on this page to others who may be able to contribute or possibly even donate some of the required materiel.  Anything and everything is much appreciated!!!

I am currently in the process of performing test shoots as shown in the example below.

Featured Gallery:

http://lividexpression.zenfolio.com/urbexjulia

story:
The release of sexuality in the horror film is always presented as perverted, monstrous, and excessive (whether it take the form of vampires, giant ants, or Mrs. Bates), both the perversion and the excess being the logical outcome of repression. -- Robin Wood

About the Bonfire of the Inanities Project and its Creator

I am Michael Bugard, a Detroit based actor and artist.  I have worked on many independent horror features including 13th Sign starring Waylon Reavis and Jeff Hatrix of Mushroomhead, and can be seen as an elilte Hunt Club client in Hostel: Part III.  I have also written an article about horror film production in Michigan, published in issue X of Michigan Movie Magagzine.

I am a lifelong fan of cinema (especially horror) and comic books.  I am bringing these passions together in an upcoming photo shoot that will be controversial, bizarre, and completely original, inspired by the above quote from Robin Wood's essay, "An Introduction to the American Horror Film".

I will be bringing together much local talent, including the photographer Sean Graham, known for his work with Noir Leather,  and Donna Terwilliger and Melody Montiel of Melodonna Beayty/FX.  Most exciting of all, this will feature Tom Sullivan, creator of the iconic Book of the Dead for the Evil Dead movie franchise, as a model!

This is significant because it brings together two generations of Michigan horror artists.  It is an opportunity for horror fans to pay homage and support a person who contributed significantly to one of the most popular horror franchises in history.  We need your help to do this right.  It will mean the difference between bringing shame or glory to our horror freak community. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need about $800 to do this right.  We need nun outfits, a priest costume, and a monk outift.  We need religious props.  Most of all, we need food and gas, which acounts for over half the budget!  This shoot will be located at two points about halfway across the state from each other.  We will also have to feed about 15-18 people each day.

Depending on how much you give, you will receive a thank you in our production credits all the way to producer credit, several autographed prints and free online access to the entire shoot!

If we do not reach our goal we will still have the shoot, but unfortunately we will have to forage for food and siphon gas out of some unsuspecting farmer's tractor.

The Impact

We hope to create something truly unique.  We are creating a photographic story, very similar to a comic or graphic novel, that will be available online with a musical soundtrack.  We may also have a print version available.  With the diverse group of talent I have assembled for this project I am confident that, with your help, we can help put Detroit and Michigan back on the cultural map.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can contribute financially.  But there are other ways you can help.  We need costumes!  Can you sew a nun or priest costume?  Are you tripping over any loose Rosaries or crucifixes?  We also need things appropriate for a bonfire of the vanities (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bonfire_of_the_vanities), such as handheld mirrors, cosmetic appliances, devices, and products, old televisions, weight loss magazines, etc.  Cases of soda, water, chips, cookies, etc. are also needed.  Just keep in mind with perishables that we aren't shooting till May.  Please contact us if you believe that you have something that you can contribute.
 
Also, please share this campaign via Twitter, Facebook, etc. with your friends.  Let's make something strange!!
 
THANK YOU! THANK YOU! THANK YOU!

story:
Thank you for visiting our indiegogo page!

JNH and Beaux Mort desperately need your help. We're trying to raise $1,000 to split two ways, equally.

JNH's (Jess)  camera (nikon d2x) suffered a fall and will no longer turn on. This is pretty devastating as photography is her passion and without her camera she cannot pursue it. The camera will take $400 to fix, and one of the batteries also needs replaced so the extra $100 of her share will go towards a new battery.

http://facebook.com/jnhphoto

Beax Mort (Kat) is an incredibly talented woman with a passion and love for photography who finds herself at a standstill working with substandard, home-made equipment and a starter camera. In order to break away from the daily grind and advance in her career she needs a boost, all of her half of the funding will be put with the selling of her old starter camera and used to purchase a camera that will help her advance and really begin creating!

http://facebook.com/beauxmortfx


If we don't raise all of the money, we'll still be splitting it 50/50 and putting it towards our cameras.
 
Both of us are photographers for a group called Grotesque Burlesque. Based in Ohio, GB showcases sexy undead Zombabes and demons from hell called Legion. We'll be hosting events, performances, and so much more! It's vital that we both have functional, up to date cameras to make sure our group is the best it can be. Please take a minute to check out Grotesque Burlesque on facebook
http://facebook.com/grotesquexburlesque

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, that's ok!

You can still help out by sharing this page on facebook, telling your friends, and the like.

And don't forget about all the lovely "share tools" located right here on this page! :D

 

Thanks again for taking the time to read this! We'll keep this page updated, and we appreciate each and every one of you and all of your contributions!
