story:
ILNAMIQUI: Preserving our cultural memories

Ilnamiqui, a word from the Nahuatl language of the Aztecs, means “to remember.” It also means, “reflect upon” or to “recall” things such as songs, ancestors, revenants.

In the Maldives, there is an indigenous calendar called nakaiy, which follows the changes in weather and the rising and the setting of the stars. For centuries it has determined the best time to fish, travel, plant crops, build a house, or even get married. However, because of climate change, this traditional method is no longer reliable for the Maldivians.

In Peru, the Huacapunco dance at the foot of their lagoon. Dressed in typical costumes to the beat of a pair of flutes and drums, they thank the Pachamama (goddess) and his apus that the water will not be foreign to them during the dry months. However, their prayers and offerings seem no longer enough as the lagoon where they get water from continues to dry up.

Photo by Julio Angulo, Peru


In the Himalayan Region of Nepal, the Dhe Village has struggled with their agricultural practices like grazing. There is less snow today than in previous years, drying up other water sources as well as their grass fields. This translates to livestock such as goats and cattles dying. For centuries people of the region have been celebrating festivals called loshar and yartung. Each house contributes grains to make food and chang (local beer) for the whole village. Eating, drinking, singing and dancing used to be the part such festivals. As the food-production is decreases and livestock dwindles, villagers are finding hard to continue these traditions.

Photo by Binod Parajuli, Nepal

 

These are only some stories where climate change is dramatically changing centuries old cultures and traditions. What happens when our indigenous knowledge and ways of life can no longer adapt to climate change? What happens when we need to leave the land and the seas we used to live in and navigate? Culture is ever changing, but the need to adapt to climate change is making these changes happen faster. Before everything completely changes and vanishes because of climate change, this book wants to keep our cultural memories alive.

Photos (L-R): Daryll Griffith, Trinidad and Tobago; Brighton Kaoma, Zambia; Renee Karunungan, Cambodia

“Mā xiquilnāmiquicān ... in iuhqui ticchīuhque[h],” a variation of the word Ilnamiqui as used in a phrase, means “Remember how we did it.”  Culture is ever changing, but the need to adapt to climate change is making these changes happen faster. Before everything completely changes and vanishes because of climate change, this book wants to keep our cultural memories alive.

 

Who we are

We are Climate Tracker, a network of over 3,000 journalists around the world tracking climate change issues and the UN Climate Negotiations since 2009. In 2015, John Vidal, leading climate journalist from The Guardian UK, named 11 of our journalists as "Young Climate Campaigners to Watch Before the UN Paris Summit." We write for leading publications in our countries as well as international publications. We believe that with the right support, any young person around the world can become a powerful voice for climate change.

This year we are embarking on an exciting journey! We want to publish a photo book that will help us in documenting changing and vanishing cultures because of climate change in different parts of the world.

 

Where your money will go

By funding this project, you are funding a team of journalists and photographers to go to different communities, immerse themselves in their cultures and traditions, and document how climate change is rapidly affecting these. Funding will also go to the publication of an actual book, which we aim to finish by November 2017, in time for the next UN Climate Negotiations.

We want to fund at least 6 journalists and 6 photographers and publish at least 100 books.

 

What you get by funding us

First of all, thank you for wanting to fund us! We want to make this an enriching, meaningful, and fun experience for you as well. This is why we have chosen to partner with AKABA, a Philippine-based social enterprise who partners with indigenous communities in creating bags with indigenous weaves.

Each hoodie and each bag will have weaves handwoven by indigenous communities in the Philippines.



Ramit Weave

Traditionally used as skirts and blankets, Ramit is made by ethnic Buhid and Hanunuo Mangyans from the Island of Mindoro. Fine, geometric patterns found in these woven textiles are a testament to the artistry of our women weavers who have mastered the art of loom weaving and the use of the Harablon, the traditional Mangyan weaving apparatus.

 


Prices and perks!

  • Donate $27 and above to our project and you get a special shirt from us!

​ 

 

  • Donate $50 and above, you can get a hoodie with handwoven textile from the Buhid and Hanunuo Mangyans community from the island of Mindoro, Philippines.

​

 

  • Donate $60 and above, you will get a printed copy of the photo book.

​

 

  • Donate $90 and above, can get you a bundle of the hoodie and a printed copy of the book.

 

  • Donate $130 and above to get the special AKABA bag. Be one of the first 10 people to claim a bag and get it for only $100 donation!

​

 

  • Donate $180 and above, you get a bundle of a shirt, a printed copy of the book, a hoodie, and an A3 print of one photo of your choosing.

 

  • Donate $210 and above, you can get the special AKABA bag, also handwoven from Mindoro Island/Ilocos, Philippines and a printed copy of the book.


 

  • Donate $320 and above, you get a bundle of the printed book, the hoodie, and the AKABA bag. You also get recognition inside the book!

 

  • Donate $470 and above, you will get all our perks: the shirt, the hoodie, a printed copy of the book, an AKABA bag, an A3 print of a photo of your choosing, and a special recognition in the book!

 

  • Donate $1,000 and above, you will get all of our perks mentioned above and you will have a chance to help us choose the journalists and photographers who will travel and document different communities and will be able to give ideas and inputs for the book. You will be able to work with us and be an active participant in the creation of the book!
     

  • Donate $3,000 and have your organisational logo or personal photo and a short bio printed at the back of the book as a founding partner.


If we don't reach our target goal, we will still continue with the project with less number of journalists and photographers and less number of locations. We want to make this happen!

 

Risks & Challenges

One of the risks this project entails is ensuring that our journalists and photographers are able to deliver on their stories and photos well. To ensure that we only get the best journalists and photographers, we will have a rigorous application process where interested journalists and photographers from our network will have to propose a community they want to document, and send in samples of previous work.

 

Timeline

story:
AIUTIAMO MIRKO ZEIN

Di recente Mirko Ponzio (Zein), è stato derubato di gran parte della sua strumentazioni, ad un evento che aveva organizzato, senza essere pagato.

Un farabutto gli ha rubato la borsa con all'interno tantissimi oggetti utili per il suo lavoro, ma soprattutto con all'interno la sua fotocamera, le sue cuffie e vari caricatori molto costosi.

Questa raccolta fondi serve per raccogliere quanto più possibile, per poter ricomprare tale attrezzatura.

Speriamo in un vostro supporto.

story:
___ for english version please scroll down // also for english perk description

 

Worum geht’s hier?

Ich habe lange Zeit meines Lebens in Amerika verbracht und dort in der Musikindustrie, sowie drum herum fotografiert. Mein Fotobuch Snapshot Stories zeigt Schnappschüsse aus dieser Zeit und erzählt dabei deren Geschichte.

Wie kam es dazu, dass ich im Hotelzimmer mit Snoop Dogg stand? Wieso hab ich Kanye West fotografiert? Dieses und noch viel mehr wird auf 228 Seiten erzählt und mit Fotos, die sehr nah am Geschehen sind, dokumentiert. Neben der Ost- und Westküste Amerikas, die gezeigt werden, gibt es auch einen kleinen Ausflug in die Townships Kapstadts und in die Hauptstadt Äthiopiens.

Das Buch ist so gut wie fertig (die Texte werden noch korrigiert) und muss nur noch gedruckt werden. Hier könnt ihr mir helfen die Kosten dafür zu decken, indem ihr euer Exemplar von dem Buch vorbestellt und dabei das ein oder andere Extra einsackt.

Der Vorteil für dich, wenn du das Buch jetzt schon vorbestellst, ist, dass du es für 30 Euro bekommst – später wird es 40 Euro kosten. Außerdem werde ich alles dafür tun, dass ihr alle euer Buch noch vor Weihnachten in der Hand haltet. Der offizielle Release ist erst Mitte Februar, sprich ihr habt es 2 Monate vor allen anderen.

 

Wer bist du überhaupt?

Pascal Kerouche, Fotograf und aktuell lebe ich in Hamburg. Meine sonstigen Arbeiten könnt ihr euch auf pascalkerouche.com anschauen, oder auch einfach meinen Boy Meets World Blog besuchen – und ja, er hieß schon bevor Drake seine 2017 Tour angekündigt hat, so.

Im Juni 2016 hat außerdem das fotoMAGAZIN ein sehr schönes Interview mit mir veröffentlicht, und ich denke, dass dort ein guter Eindruck vermittelt wird, wer ich eigentlich bin. Darum halte ich mich an dieser Stelle kurz und wenn ihr möchtet, könnt ihr es euch einfach hier anschauen.

 

Preview? Klar!




Wie sehen denn die Perks aus? Also das Poster, das T-Shirt oder der Donner Eulen Hoodie?

What is this all about?

I spent a couple of years of my life in the United States and documented the life of music artists. My photo book 'Snapshot Stories' captures the stories and vibes from that time by applying the snapshots I took during that time. 

What is actually portrayed in those pictures?  What are the Stories behind them?  And how the hell did I ended up standing in the same hotel room as Snoop Dogg? How did I get to shoot Kanye West? In my book I narrate those stories on 228 pages. Since the snapshots tell the stories of the people I met throughout my life, I gave them a chronological order. With regards to content the east and west coast of the USA are the main settings. Furthermore it also covers a trip into the townships of Cape Town or to the capital of Ethiopia. 

The book is done and just needs to be printed. This is your chance to help me to cover the costs, by pre-ordering your copy of the book. Explore all the different limited packages with extra specials and find the perfekt one for yourself! 

Why should you do that? You save 10 Euros in the pre-order package (currently its 30 Euros, after Crowd funding it will be 40 Euros). In Addition to that, I will do my best to make sure you have a copy of your own before Christmas. The official release will be mid February. So you will get the book 2 month in advance.

  

Who am I?

I am Pascal Kerouche, a professional photographer currently living in Hamburg. I frequently go back and forth between Hamburg, Los Angeles and New York. You can view my other work at pascalkerouche.com or visit my blog 'Boy Meets World' – yes, I used this title way before Drake announced his international tour. 

 

Scroll up and you can see a preview of the book, as well as the different special packages I offer.

But I can’t read german so I don’t know what those Perks mean!?

 

SNAPSHOT STORIES BOOK

You get the book to an early bird price and save 10 euros.

 

SNAPSHOT STORIES x POSTER

I will sent you a signed copy of the book (with a personal dedication written by me if requested) including a 30 x 40 cm print out of the Homicide Harlem series. If you want to know how it looks, you can scroll up a bit and there they are to visualize. 

 

SCREENING PACKAGE

This Package is rather interesting for anybody who lives in Germany or is planning to visit, because the screening is in Hamburg. You will get a book and I am offering a limited screening (for max. 30 people), where I will project my photos onto a wall and just tell you the stories about the photos. 

 

BOOK x POSTER x T-SHIRT

It’s the same as the poster package, with a T-Shirt on top. You can scroll up to see how it looks like and make sure you sent your size with your order. Sizes go from S to XXL.

 

KLEINER DONNER PACKAGE

This is for all the people from Hamburg. You will get a signed book and 10x free entry into the hamburg hotspot night club “Kleiner Donner”. In Addition to that you will also get a 'Donner Eulen' Hoodie (scroll up to see it). Remember to leave your size.

 

BOOK x POSTER x T-SHIRT x NAME

Same as the Book x Poster x T-Shirt package, but I will also write your name in the thank you of the book. So you can brag in front of your friends with this one.

 

LET’S HANG OUT!

You get a signed book, 1 Poster, 1 T-Shirt and whenever you are in Hamburg we can meet up and have a few beers and talk about everything you like. Bring a friend or your date or your grandmother. 

 

I LOVE FOOD!

Same as The Lets Hang Out Package, with the difference that we'll have dinner and drinks on me...and a lot of nerd talk. 

  

NEW YORK, NEW YORK!

We'll both go to New York (your flight, Hotel, and catering is not included)and I'll show you around. We will visit a couple of spots where the photos of the book are taken. I will tell you all the stories and introduce you to a couple of people. If you have a camera with you, we can organize for you to take some photos. 

 

SHOUT OUT

Besides the book I will convince Snoop Dogg to give you a personal shout out and sent it to you.

We will visit a couple of spots where the photos of the book are taken. I will tell you all the stories and introduce you to a couple of people. If you have a camera with you, we can organize for you to take some photos.  SHOUT OUTBesides the book I will convince Snoop Dogg to give you a personal shout out and sent it to you.

story:
What is PHOTOPAPER?

PHOTOPAPER will present outstanding photographic work nominated by international experts in the field. We invite these experts as guest editors to name photographers or photographic projects which they would like to present to an international audience. PHOTOPAPER will feature this work in single 16-page-issues together with the guest editor’s statement. Published on a quarterly basis, PHOTOPAPER is available on subscription. Each quarterly shipment will contain 3 issues. Our goal is to make extraordinary photography accessible to a wide international audience. Therefore 12 issues per year cost only 24 Euro, including shipment worldwide.

The first 3 PHOTOPAPER issues will be shipped in March:

  • PHOTOPAPER 01: Graeme William »A City Refracted« nominated by David Goldblatt
  • PHOTOPAPER 02: Paul Trevor »In Your Face« nominated by Martin Parr
  • PHOTOPAPER 03: Jean-Christian Bourcart »Forbidden City« nominated by Nan Goldin



The next 3 PHOTOPAPER issues will be shipped in June:

  • PHOTOPAPER 04: Elspeth Diederix »Tulipa & Narcissus« nominated by Viviane Sassen
  • PHOTOPAPER 05: Zhang Xiao »They«  nominated by Jason Fulford
  • PHOTOPAPER 06: Sakiko Nomura »Kuroyami« nominated by Nobuyoshi Araki


Specs

To ensure that PHOTOPAPER is reasonably priced and available for as many people as possible, we are using a cost-efficient high-volume web-fed press printing technique. Each quarterly shipment will contain 3 issues of PHOTOPAPER and an A2-sized poster with one of the published photographs. The printing is climate-neutral on a matte 90 g volume paper. The paper is FSC-certificated. Each issue has 16 pages, format 21 x 29 cm.



Our Indiegogo-Goal

To get PHOTOPAPER going, we need at least 500 subscribers. Please help us by sharing this campaign and spreading the word, wherever possible!


Who we are

PHOTOPAPER will be published by the Kasseler Fotografie Festival, the non-profit organization which runs the international Fotobookfestival Kassel, Germany. 

Our Team:
Executive Editor: Dieter Neubert
Photo Editor: Frederic Lezmi
Features Editor: Eva Gravayat
Graphic Design: Steffen Kalauch


////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////


Perks

For helping us to launch PHOTOPAPER through this campaign, we are happy to offer the following exciting perks to you: 

·············································································································································

Signed Poster by Graeme Williams 

An A2 (42 x 59,4 cm) sized poster from our first PHOTOPAPER issue in a limited edition of 50. Numbered and signed by Graeme Williams.


·············································································································································


Signed Poster by Paul Trevor 

An A2 (42 x 59,4 cm) sized poster from our second PHOTOPAPER issue in a limited edition of 50. Numbered and signed by Paul Trevor.



·············································································································································

ON DAIDO

The book ON DAIDO is a photographic anthology of statements and homages to the Japanese photographer Daido Moriyama made by internationally acclaimed photographers and writers. This book was made for the 6. Fotobookfestival Kassel 2013 and is signed by Daido Moriyama.  MORE INFO


·············································································································································

KASSEL MENU by Martin Parr

A very special artist’s book assembled using Martin Parr food photographs. In this thick and heavy, artificial-leather bound original menu book, you can stick 20 A4 sized photographs out of a selection of 46 which have been specially compiled by Martin Parr for this edition; several of these have been never published before. Kassel Menu is limited to 350 copies, all signed by Martin Parr. There are only 40 left (strawberry colour) for this campaign! MORE INFO


·············································································································································


How to help?

If you don't want to subscribe or if you can’t contribute, that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Please feel free to share this campaign with your social network and your friends.

We thank you sincerely in advance.

story:
Duality Book Specs:

Size: 31,5 cm x 21cm

Cover: Hard cover

Paper: 

Out of Touch part: Magno Volume 135gsm

 In Touch part: Munken Lynx Rough 120gsm

Printing technique: Offset printing, CMYK + spot color (Rich Black)

Weight: 900g

Pages: 192

___________________________________________________________________________

>>>Share and support | If you can't support financially, don't worry, a simple share is enough.

___________________________________________________________________________

IMPORTANT NOTICE:

All the money that will be raised from the Campaign, will be used to print and distribute the book.

___________________________________________________________________________


The story

My name is Stylianos Papardelas and I am a photographer.

I was born in Greece and throughout my childhood, I was lucky enough to be able to run out of the door and play all day outside. My parents used to move a lot so I had to adapt to new environments and make new friends all the time. So from a very young age, I was basically a free range chicken running around and exploring my surroundings all the time.

When I was fifteen was diagnosed with cancer and my free range days were over. I suddenly had more time to think and less time for action. At the age of seventeen, I had the opportunity to get to know a magical place made by Paul Newman, called Barretstown. 

The day I’ve arrived, my life changed forever. For the first time, I found myself in a multicultural environment driven by a meaningful purpose.

At the same time, I was starting exploring the world of photography.

Falling in love with two things at the same time, made me incredibly happy and inspired me to explore the world. So, I started traveling to Europe and experience what the world has to offer while my photographic skills were growing day by day.

In 2010, western culture was not enough anymore and just like in my childhood years I stormed out of the “door” of Europe and found my self in Uganda. No plan, no idea, no reservations. It was the best thing that happened to me. Roaming the streets of Kampala, I realized how beautiful people from anywhere can be. Right around the corner of this realization, I took the photo of a woman with the most powerful smile I have ever seen. At that moment, I knew that I wanted to see every corner of the world and find moments of connections like this one. So “In touch” was born.

Since then I have traveled in over 40 countries around the world, with no plan, almost no money, but with a thirst to find my self and capture the world in a way that expresses how I feel and how I dream about reality. I wanted to meet people and see the world from a different perspective every single day. I slept outside and was eating leftovers most of the time but my journey through the world was a new adventure every single moment.

I gained a lot of understanding about the issues that trouble our societies, and with those realizations “Out of touch” came to life.

After 10 years of spontaneously roaming the world and expressing my self through the medium of photography, I decided to gather all the experiences and try to make sense of it all.

Duality, is basically two books, coming together in one.  It is the last 10 years of humanity from my own point of view, my own journey and my way of putting my perspective out there for anyone who wants to see.

All these years I traveled by myself, paying my own expenses, by working and saving, but most importantly with the help of “a thousand silent heroes” that I met along the way. People that opened their homes, fed me and thought me how to be a better person.

With all that said, in the final stage of this journey, I am asking for your help...

___________________________________________________________________________

Η ιστορία

To όνομα μου είναι Στυλιανός Παπαρδέλας και είμαι φωτογράφος.

Γεννήθηκα στην Ελλάδα. Στα παιδικά μου χρόνια ήμουν αρκετά τυχερός να μπορώ να ανοίγω την πόρτα και να παίζω όλη μέρα έξω.

Οι γονείς μου μετακόμιζαν συχνά, οπότε αναγκαστικά έπρεπε να αλλάζω περιβάλλοντα και να κάνω καινούριους φίλους συνέχεια. Από πολύ μικρός, έτρεχα από δω και από κει προσπαθώντας να ανακαλύψω τον κόσμο.

Στα δεκαπέντε μου διαγνώστηκα με καρκίνο, και οι μέρες της ελευθερίας μου τελείωσαν. Ξαφνικά είχα περισσότερο χρόνο να σκεφτώ και λιγότερο να εξερευνήσω.

Στα δεκαεπτά βρέθηκα σε ένα πανέμορφο μέρος στην Ιρλανδία. Από την πρώτη στιγμή που βρέθηκα στο Barretstown η ζωή μου άλλαξε για πάντα. Για πρώτη φορά βρέθηκα σε ένα πολυπολιτισμικό μέρος που λειτουργούσε με ένα μεγάλο όραμα. Ταυτόχρονα, άρχισα να εξερευνώ τον κόσμο της φωτογραφίας για πρώτη φορά.

Η αγάπη για αυτές τις δύο συνθήκες, με έκανε πολύ χαρούμενο και μου έδωσε τεράστια έμπνευση να θέλω να δω τον κόσμο.

Κάπως έτσι άρχισα να ταξιδεύω στην Ευρώπη και να απολαμβάνω τον κόσμο ενώ ταυτόχρονα οι φωτογραφικές μου ικανότητες αναπτυσσόταν μέρα με την μέρα

Το 2010, ο δυτικός πολιτισμός με είχε ήδη κουράσει και όπως στα παιδικά μου χρόνια δραπέτευσα από την “πόρτα” της Ευρώπης και βρέθηκα στην Ουγκάντα. Πήγα χωρίς πλάνο και χωρίς να έχω καμιά ιδέα για τίποτα Ήταν το καλύτερο πράγμα που μπορούσε να μου συμβεί.

Περπατώντας τους δρόμους της Καμπάλας, είδα για πρώτη φορά πόσο ομορφιά μπορεί να υπάρχει στην διαφορετικότητα. Πριν καν προλάβω να συνειδητοποιήσω τι έχει συμβεί, μπήκα σε ένα σπίτι και είδα την γυναικά με το πιο δυναμικό χαμόγελο που είχα δει στην ζωή μου. Η στιγμή αυτή με έκανε να συνειδητοποιήσω πως θέλω να γυρίσω κάθε γωνιά του πλανήτη και να βρω στιγμές σύνδεσης σαν και αυτή, και έτσι το πρότζεκτ “In touch” γεννήθηκε.

Από τότε, ταξίδεψα σε πάνω από 40 χώρες του κόσμου με τον ίδιο τρόπο. Δεν είχα κανένα πλάνο, αλλά διψούσα να βρω τον εαυτό μου και να αποτυπώσω τον κόσμο με ένα τρόπο που θα ταιριάζει στο πως βλέπω και φαντάζομαι την πραγματικότητα. Ήθελα όσους περισσότερους ανθρώπους μπορώ και να δω τον κόσμο από την δική τους οπτική γωνία. Κοιμήθηκα έξω και έτρωγα αποφάγια αλλά το ταξίδι μου ήταν μια καινούρια περιπέτεια κάθε στιγμή.

Συνειδητοποιώ αρκετά απο τα προβλήματα που ταλαιπωρούν τις σύγχρονες κοινωνίες, και μέσα απο αυτές τις συνειδητοποιήσεις γεννήθηκε το “Out of Touch”.

Μετά από δέκα χρόνια αυθόρμητης περιήγησης και έκφρασης μέσα από την φωτογραφία, αποφάσισα να μαζέψω όλες αυτές τις εμπειρίες και να προσπαθήσω να καταλάβω.

Το “Duality” αποτελείτε από δύο βιβλία που έγιναν ένα. Είναι τα τελευταία δέκα χρόνια της ανθρωπότητας, από την δική μου οπτική γωνία, είναι το ταξίδι μου και ο τρόπος μου να μοιραστώ την οπτική μου με τον κόσμο.

Όλα αυτά τα χρόνια ταξίδεψα με δικά μου έξοδα, μέσα από δουλειά και αποταμίευση, αλλά κυρίως με την βοήθεια “χιλίων σιωπηλών ηρώων” που γνώρισα μέσα από το ταξίδι μου. Άνθρωποι που με έβαλαν στα σπίτια τους, μοιράστηκανμαζί μου ένα πιάτο φαγητό και με έμαθαν να πως να γίνομαι καλύτερος άνθρωπος.

Τώρα, στο τελευταίο στάδιο αυτού του ταξιδιού, ζητώ την βοήθεια σας..

 

Thank you in advance for bringing "Duality" to the physical world.

Άνθρωποι που με έβαλαν στα σπίτια τους, μοιράστηκανμαζί μου ένα πιάτο φαγητό και με έμαθαν να πως να γίνομαι καλύτερος άνθρωπος.Τώρα, στο τελευταίο στάδιο αυτού του ταξιδιού, ζητώ την βοήθεια σας.. Thank you in advance for bringing "Duality" to the physical world.

story:
Summary

Hi guys, thank you for stopping by. The past 4 years have been a huge challenge but shortly it would be all over and I would be entering the “real world”.

As some of you know I’m taking part in the University of Westminster degree show at the Truman Brewery on the 23rd of June. I would like to show some of the work that I have produced and need your help!

Taking part in this show is the last step in my degree and anything you can give would be a push to that finish line.

If you want to know more about the project itself send me a message at: b.lopezgarzon@gmail.com

What I need

Ideally I would like to raise £500 to help with printing and framing. I have been quoted £393 for printing and framing. The rest would be use to pay for space fee £260, business cards and postcards.

This is really important to me and I want to achieve this not matter what so I have created some perks that I would ask you to check out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you may just not be able to contribute with money but you can spread the word, maybe some one you know could help out and if you are in London come to the exhibition on the 23rd of June it would be of great support.


Many thanks!

story:
Our Indiegogo campaign is over but you can still donate to the 100 Cameras Project!  The more money we raise, the more lives we can change through photography.  To donate, click HERE.  Thank you!!


The 100 Cameras Project

With anticipation, I watched Nicole lift her left elbow up and push down on the large blue button that was attached to her wheelchair with a strap of Velcro.  The sound of the camera shutter went off and an image instantly appeared in the viewfinder.  Nicole shook with excitement and yelled out to the room full of on-lookers, “My very first picture!”

Nicole (second from left, front row) is one of the 10 photographers who participated in the very first photography workshops for the 100 Cameras Project, held in Springfield, MA.  And Nicole, along with many of the other project participants, had the opportunity to take pictures for the first time that day.  She had never been able to physically do so prior to the 100 Cameras Project.
 

My name is Courtney Bent and it's been my dream, since the premiere of my award-winning documentary film, Shooting Beauty, which chronicles a photography program I developed at United Cerebral Palsy in Boston, MA, to create a national initiative to help people with intellectual and developmental disabilities express themselves through photography.  Hence, the 100 Cameras Project!  The 100 Cameras Project will put modified camera systems into the hands of 100 people with disabilities ranging from autism to down syndrome to Alzheimer's to cerebral Palsy, throughout the U.S., bringing the vision of these new photographers to life while building awareness of disability, diversity and inclusion through art.

I will travel throughout the United States and conduct photography workshops  and provide these new photographers with a life changing opportunity to explore an art-form that for many, up until this project, has not been physically or monetarily accessible.  With cameras in hand, the project photographers are given the chance to overcome invisibility and tell the stories of their lives- their struggles, their accomplishments, their loves, losses and simply what they think is beautiful- through their eyes alone.  No one else’s.


The National photography exhibitions and public events resulting from the 100 Cameras Project will help to amplify these new photographers’ voices, ultimately enabling the broader community to identify with these individuals in a way never before.  If successful, the project will not only empower and build confidence in the new photographers, but will stand as an example of the potential of art to heal, to inspire, and to prove to all of us that no matter what our ability levels or differences are, we have more in common than what meets the eye.

How it will work:

Since the film’s premiere, the Shooting Beauty team has seen an overwhelming interest in continuing the photography workshop featured in the film. Unfortunately, there are very limited resources for access to the arts for individuals with disabilities. Seeing the empowering effect of photography on the group I worked with in Shooting Beauty, let alone the effect that their work had on the broader community, I felt the need to create the 100 Cameras Project.

With this project, I will replicate the photography workshop featured in the film and work with partner organizations throughout the U.S. to identify photographers for the project.  I will then conduct physical assessments of each photographer to determine what adaptive equipment will be needed to to create a camera system that can accommodate each photographers unique abilities.  I will then travel to the new photographersʼ communities and provide a 2-3 day photography workshop that will culminate in an exhibition of photographs and a series of public events conducted in schools, universities, businesses and art venues aimed at breaking down barriers of communication and encouraging a community-wide conversation around disability, tolerance, diversity and the possibilities of what we can all do when given a camera, a voice and a chance.

How You Can Help

AND.....we need your help to make this all possible!   The cost for each photographer to participate in the workshop and receive a customized camera system is $850.  In order to successfully launch this project, the Shooting Beauty team needs to raise $85,000.  $20,000 has already been raised and we hope to raise the additional funds through Indiegogo!

The project funds will go towards the cost of all workshop expenses including cameras for each participant, adaptive equipment to allow cameras to be accessible to individuals with even the most significant disabilities,  workshop supplies, photographs for exhibitions, national travel expenses for Courtney Bent and production time for the Shooting Beauty team.  We hope you’ll consider being a part of the project!

Workshop Partners: We are excited to announce that Velcro USA, Inc. is an official product and financial sponsor of the 100 Cameras Project! They will be providing us with VELCRO® Brand products for use in all adaptations and hanging of the exhibitions.

We are also excited to announce our partnership with GoWireless!  GoWireless has supplied the project with camera phones that we'll be testing out in our next workshop. 

The Shooting Beauty team is also currently working with a group of organizations to host and identify the new photographers for the project. Our current workshop partners are: Best Buddies International, Baystate Health, Seven Hills Foundation, the Naples Art Association, United Jewish Federation of New York, SUNY Orange, The Amazing Place, Mid-Island JCC, and Creative Growth.  Project Partners: Velcro USA inc., GoWireless, Working Films, Skip Cohen University, Now or Never Media.

We hope you'll join us!

story:
Wer ist eigentlich BENHAMMER?

Hallo, das bin ich. Ihr kennt mich vielleicht aus der deutschen Internet-und-Fotoszene, wo ich seit 2010 als Blogger und Fotograf aktiv bin. Vielleicht habt ihr schon einmal was von mir gelesen oder gesehen – vielleicht aber auch nicht. In den letzten 8 Jahren habe ich unzählige Fotografen kennenlernen dürfen, viele Fotografen auf meinem Blog mit ihrer Arbeit vorgestellt und selber den Weg in die Fotografie gefunden. 2016 habe ich mit Eurer Hilfe meinen ersten eigenen Bildband mit dem Titel "DAS LEBEN UND STERBEN DES BENHAMMER" hier auf Indiegogo realisiert. Ein analoger Bildband über meine Leidenschaft zur Fotografie  und meine ganz persönliche Sicht auf meine Mitmenschen. Jetzt möchte ich den damals bereits angekündigten Nachfolger mit Eurer Hilfe ebenfalls wahr werden lassen.

Und genau dafür brauche ich jetzt Eure Hilfe!

Hier findet ihr ein paar Interviews aus den letzten Jahren, die vielleicht noch ein bisschen mehr über mich und meine Arbeit erzählen. Wenn ihr mögt, lest gerne rein. 

  • Interview mit Spielfeld-Berlin
  • Interview mit Thang von Electru
  • Interview mit Compagnon
  • PhotoWeekly Interview
  • Fotocast Interview 
  • Interview mit der Photopresse (Vollformat)
  • Steffens Rezension zu "DAS LEBEN UND STERBEN DES BENHAMMER"
  • Interview mit FM5

Wie ihr mir helfen könnt?

Ganz einfach. Ich brauche Euer Geld, damit ich dieses Buch produzieren kann. SO, wie ich es mir vorstelle und ohne Kompromisse. Dafür brauche ich nach Absprache mit Layouter und Druckerei ca. 8700 Euro. Außerdem nehmen sich Steuern, Indiegogo und Banken natürlich noch ein bisschen vom Kuchen. Je mehr Geld wir hier zusammensammeln, desto schöner und exklusiver werden wir dieses kleine Herzensprojekt gestalten und es zu etwas besonderem für jeden von Euch machen.

Und deswegen brauche ich Euer Geld. Aber ich will es nicht geschenkt haben! Nein, ich will, dass ihr für Euren Support einen Gegenwert erhaltet. Und ihr in meine Welt der Fotografie eintaucht, um danach Eure eigene Arbeit vielleicht aus einer ganz neuen Perspektive zusehen. Darum habe ich mir wieder ein paar PERKs ausgedacht, die hoffentlich für jeden von Euch irgendeinen kleinen oder großen Mehrwert. Ganz wichtig: Sollte dieses Funding aus irgendeinem Grund nicht funktionieren – was ich natürlich nicht hoffe, weil ich irgendwie auf Euch setze – bekommt ihr alle die Kohle von Indiegogo wieder!

Und was ist "DAS LEBEN UND STERBEN DES BENHAMMER - Teil 2" jetzt?

Am 13. April 2017 ist "DAS LEBEN UND STERBEN DES BENHAMMER" erschienen. Ziemlich genau vor einem Jahr. Ein komplett analoger Bildband mit Bildern aus einer Olympus Mju 2, die ich 2016 jeden Tag dabei hatte. Er zeigt einen ungeschönten und intensiven Blick auf mein ganz persönliches 2016. 

Nachdem Crowdfunding zog ich mich eine lange Zeit zurück. Arbeite mit der Designerin 4 Monate am Layout, presste die Flut an Bildern in eine Geschichte und zog mich aus dem ganzen Party- und Projektleben etwas zurück. Ich verbrachte 2017 oft in Gedanken versunken und ließ nebenher die Ideen für den Nachfolger Teil entstehen.

Da sich auch meine freien Strecken zunehmend in Schwarz-Weiß Portraits verschoben haben, entschied ich Ende letzten Jahres den Nachfolger auch in analogem Schwarzweiß zu fotografieren. Wie bei "DAS LEBEN UND STERBEN DES BENHAMMER" wollte ich mich wieder auf eine Kamera festlegen und kaufte mir Ende des Jahres eine Contax G2. Dazu schrieb ich etwas ausführlicher im Blog. Jetzt habe ich einen kleinen Objektivfuhrpark und habe schon die ersten Shootings für das neue Buch umgesetzt. Dieses Mal wird es also weniger dokumentarisch und dafür etwas konzeptioneller. Außerdem gibt es neben meinem fiktiven Ich auch einen zweiten weiblichen Hauptcharakter. Mehr kann ich jetzt noch nicht sagen, weil auch dieses Projekt wieder "in progress" während des Fundings entsteht.

Facts zum Nachfolger

  • ca. 250 Seiten
  • ausschließlich Schwarz-Weiß-Fotos aus der Contax G2 (Ilford HP5)
  • Softcover
  • 2-3 persönliche Texte (wie im Vorgänger)
  • handschriftliche Notizen im Buch
  • nummerierte und limitierte Auflage
  • 10-12 Illustrationen 
  • Es wird wieder eine Playlist zum Buch und entsprechende Songzitate geben

Was du gibst & was du bekommst

Also ich brauche für den Druck in schöner Magazinoptik mit hochwertigem Cover offenporigen Papier, Klebebindung und knapp 250 Seiten genau 7500,00 Euro dazu kommen die PAYPAL und INDIEGOGO Kosten.

Für alles, was wir hier mehr sammeln,lasse ich mir etwas einfallen. Wenn wir es wieder schaffen hier ca. 10.700 Euro zusammeln, würde ich in Köln wieder eine Releaseparty für Euch schmeißen, wo wir alle zusammenkommen, trinken und quatschen. Vielleicht spielt wieder eine Band, ein DJ oder was auch immer. Das schauen wir dann, wenn es soweit ist. Ihr seht den aktuellen Stand ja selbst.

In der eigenen Facebook-Gruppe und hier in der Historie halte ich Euch übrigens jederzeit auf dem Laufenden über das Projekt. Dessen Produktion nach dem Funding beginnt.

Und so sieht der Plan aus...

Da ich bekanntlich Optimist bin, auch wenn ich meine Zweifel nie so ganz verbergen kann, erzähle ich Euch einfach jetzt schon vom Plan.

  1. Sobald das Funding erfolgreich ist, beginne ich mit dem Layout
  2. Dann produziere ich auch die letzten Bilder für das Buch.
  3. Danach beginnt der Druck
  4. Das Buch soll dann nach der Photokina und vor Weihnachten fertig sein!
  5. Ein mögliches Releaseparty-Datum wäre aktuell der 30.11.2018

So sah die letzte Releaseparty 2017 aus

Als kleinen Anreiz und Motivation, gibt's hier jetzt noch ein paar Bilder von der Release-Party des ersten Teils hier im VeedelClub in Köln. 

Florian hatte damals einige Bilder auf der Releaseparty gemacht, hier gibt's mehr...

Fotobox von Rosen2g (damals, am 13. April 2017 im Veedelclub).

Ein visueller Vorgeschmack auf Teil 2

Anders als beim letzten Funding, kann ich Euch jetzt auch schon einen stilistischen Einblick geben. Wie bereits oben beschrieben, werden es Schwarz-Weiß-Fotos, die auf dem Ilford HP5 und mit einer Contax G2 fotografiert werden. Die folgenden Bilder werden zwar nicht im Buch sein, geben aber einen stilistischen Vorgeschmack!

 

Du hast irgendwie gar kein Geld und möchtest trotzdem Supporten?

Kein Problem. Dann freue ich mich, wenn Du einfach Deine Meinung teilst und im Web oder bei Freunden und Bekannten für diese Kampagne wirbst und so dieses Projekt ebenfalls realisierbar machst. Egal, ob es Tweets, Snaps, Facebook oder Blogposts sind! Alles trägt seinen Teil dazu bei und ich wäre dir ewig dankbar. Das nächste Kölsch geht dann definitiv auf mich! Zum Teilen kannst Du auch gerne die Indiegogo-Tools hier unten verwenden. 

_____________________________________________________________

Ansonsten fettes Danke für Euren Support, Eure Zeit und Eure Hilfe. Wenn es irgendwelche Fragen gibt, ich stehe per Mail unter studio@benhammer.de und in der Facebook-Gruppe jederzeit Rede und Antwort. 24/7 !

www.benhammer.de
www.instagram.com/benhammer_
www.fb.com/benhammer.blog
www.benventures.de

Egal, ob es Tweets, Snaps, Facebook oder Blogposts sind! Alles trägt seinen Teil dazu bei und ich wäre dir ewig dankbar. Das nächste Kölsch geht dann definitiv auf mich! Zum Teilen kannst Du auch gerne die Indiegogo-Tools hier unten verwenden. _____________________________________________________________Ansonsten fettes Danke für Euren Support, Eure Zeit und Eure Hilfe. Wenn es irgendwelche Fragen gibt, ich stehe per Mail unter studio@benhammer.de und in der Facebook-Gruppe jederzeit Rede und Antwort. 24/7 !www.benhammer.dewww.instagram.com/benhammer_www.fb.com/benhammer.blogwww.benventures.de

story:
Hi. My name is Lisa Reilly. I'm a photographer based in Los Angeles, CA. and I need your help to photograph cancer survivors throughout Southern CA. With the help of my Glam Squad we will provide 12 cancer survivors with a transformative underwater experience.

This project was inspired by my connection with Sarah Amento, a stage 4 breast cancer survivor, who contacted me for underwater portraits after recovering from her double mastectomy. Shortly before our session was scheduled Sarah found out she was inoperable stage 4. This did not stop her. Sarah wanted to have a portrait made that would empower other women who have struggled with body image issues to feel beautiful about themselves and to get the word out that cancer does not define you. My session with Sarah taught me a lot! I learned to REALLY live and appreciate life... I learned that health is wealth...and to slow down and appreciate the little things...I also learned that through my art I can make a difference in someone's life. Sarah's session was THE day this project started.

The main objective of The Survivor Campaign is to promote healing through underwater photography sessions. Whether you are suffering from body issues, pain associated with certain types of cancer or you just want to dive in and show your warrior spirit, this is a great way for these survivors to rediscover the beauty within.

I started my career in photography in 1996 after graduating from The Atlanta College of Art. While I enjoy all forms of photography, underwater has become my passion and I've been shooting underwater portraits for 4 years. There's something very special about underwater photography. The quiet beauty of it  can take you to such magical places and the resulting photos are so ethereal and beautiful. I love seeing the smiles on my subject's face when they see their images.

I am crowd funding through IndieGoGo in the hopes of raising $8,000. This money will go towards transportation, gear rental and maintenance, assistance, make up, clothing, and props. I will also be donating 25% to Sarah Amento and her family to help with their medical expenses.You can read more about Sarah's story here: www.FightLikeSarah.com Please choose a donation level you are comfortable with and as a thank you I have some cool goodies for you. Perks include shout outs on my social media, thank you cards, photo prints, books, and underwater photo sessions in the Los Angeles area! I'll be updating soon and adding even more perks, so stay tuned.

I thank you for your time! And please, spread the word. Let's celebrate beating cancer one AMAZING portrait at a time :))))

xoxoxo,
Lisa

story:
***Now available for purchase at :

Etsy :

www.etsy.com/shop/JulieSimone  and

Amazon : 

http://www.amazon.com/Gagged-Julie-Simone/dp/1936882787/ref=cm_cr_pr_pb_i

Julie Simone's 1st self-published book "Gagged' featuring 38 models shot between 2001-2014, with all subjects wearing gags.  100 pages.

"Julie is one of the true original inventive artists in the bondage world. Her work has inspired and has been "borrowed" upon throughout the industry. Whether you are a professional rigger or need new knowledge in your own personal life, these pictures will show you how to control, use and humiliate (if that's your intention) your subject in a way that is exciting and beautiful." - a long time fan


Foreword by Bella Vendetta :
The type of gag a person chooses says a lot about them.  The culture of BDSM is rich and varied and the subculture of gags in particular is a very particular niche fetish that is not very widely studied.


Gagging someone, taking away their ability to speak, use words and communicate efficiently brings about a psychological power trip and surrender of control that differs from any other sort of bondage or restraint.  Even on its own with no physical bondage holding a person back, a gag identifies a person's status.  With history tied to punishments in ancient cultures, underworlds and fantasy it is easy to use a gag to convey a multitude of feelings depending on the parties involved, the intention and, of course, the type of gag used.


In this case: these photographs are all about gags that Julie Simone herself chose.  Though we never get to see her in these photos we are left to imagine the look she must have on her face, we are left to guess what her intent must have been.  She uses a variety of gags and methods of gagging from ball gags, over the mouth gags, cleaves, stuffing, dental gags and some of My personal favorites clothespins and even needles.


The images are powerful, at times shocking and a testament to the multi-layered artist Julie is.  From choosing the gag and method, to choosing the correct model, expression she wanted them to convey, camera and lighting she has painstakingly created images that are not sexual in  nature, and has sexualized them.  Has she though?  Has she taken something artistic and made it sexual or vice versa?  
In finding which images resonate with us are we finding what parts of control we are longing to give up?


Pain, humiliation, having the truth stuffed into our mouths, our lips sewn shut, our mouth made into tools for another’s amusement. Gags have a way of bringing someone deeper into submissive mind space, without the blathering sound of our own voices we’re left in our own head to reflect and give up trust to someone else.  Not just someone else,  Mistress Julie Simone,  who is going to use our bodies as a canvas to make perverse art.


Models : 

Adena, Allanah Rhodes, Alsana Sin, Ashley Renee, Bee Tran, Bella Vendetta, Carrie Ann, Crystal Frost, Deanna Deadly, Desiree, Dorothy Laine, Eden Alexander, Eden Wells, Elena DeLuca, Elkie Cooper, Felix the Lucky Slave, GoGo FukMe, Greta, Jewell Marceau, Kobe Lee, Krissy Kage, Lori Adorable, Lydia Vengeance, Madison Young, Nicole Grey, Nikki Sebastian, Paige Richards, Paris Kennedy, Persephone, Rubber Necro, Samantha Grace, Scar,  Talia Monet, The Filet Hunter, TigerLily, Vasara, Vito, Zoe Minx

story:
The Project

After growing up in the countryside I have a passion for the outdoors. I am in my final year of my photography degree. My project will be exhibited in both Surrey and London.

The project explores a persons connection to the land. A landscape is often a place of escapism from everyday life. I have photographed my sitters in their the comfort of their own home then I ask them to choose an outdoor location that is personal to them in some way. This photographs are then merged together to create a space individual to each sitter.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding reasied will be put towards the presentation of my work. I am shooting medium format film on my beautiful Hassleblad camera. Please note that the photo preview is a digital test as it is a long process shooting on film. I aim to present the work on acrylic and light them with back lit led display panels. This will ight up the photographs as if lit by daylight beautifully to bring out the layers and locations with in the photograph. 

Even if I do not reach the entire goal I will be grateful for everything I recieve as it will still go towards my exhibitions. 

In return for your generosity I can offer:

- A shout out via social media site as a huge thank you :) If you have your own creative projects this may help to get some others to take a look at your work. 

- A postcard from the series plus a shout out.

- An A4 print from my website, postcard from the current series and a shout out.

- An A3 print from my website and a postcard from the current series. 

- Or if you have contributed £100 I will offer a free photoshoot for you and your family or a portraiture/ fashion photoshoot with inmages on a cd as well. 

The Impact

I want to capture peoples imagination and get others to consider what environments are important to them. What scene would you choose if I asked what location was important to you? Unfortunately the British weather can put dampener on going out into the country but lets get out there and enjoy it :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't offer any money follow me on twitter to find updates on the exhibitions and come along and take a look at the work for your self!

You can also take a look at my website where more work is constaly being added.

story:
AN EXHIBITION TO COINCIDE WITH THE 20TH ANNIVERSARY OF THE RWANDAN GENOCIDE

'' I feel that many people have a misconstrued concept of what Rwanda and its people are like. People fear Rwanda and believe it is a place of violence, terror and devastation, but this is not true. Capturing images of people who are not very different from you or me, I present portraits of Rwandans as part of the plurality of our common human identity. We all have similar aspirations for shelter, food, employment, health care, education, happiness, and stable relationships. Exposure to other cultures enriches understanding of who we are, expands gratitude for what we have, and connects us to our common humanity’’. 

- Harrison Thane Photographer

-Granddad & Grandson, Kigali

Earlier this year Harrison Thane spent three months in Rwanda. The purpose of  his visit was to mentor girls aged between 12 –18 within the ‘Girl Effect'' project(www.girleffect.org) . This organisation aims to empower girls to end poverty for themselves. They produced their own radio show and magazine. He taught them photographic techniques and post-production skills.


-Ni Nyampinga Magazine

THE GIRL EFFECT

"Ni Nyampinga", Part of the Girl Effect a locally produced Rwandan youth brand, aims at inspiring adolescent girls to reach their full potential and enable them to have self belief and make good decisions for themselves in pleasurable, interesting and interactive ways.

Harrison worked on the magazine as as Lead photographer, production management and communication between regional and international creative hubs in Rwanda and the uk.

-Ni Nyampinga Magazine


-Ni Nyampinga Magazine

While on that assignment he took the opportunity to capture everyday life and beautiful landscapes that contradict the horrific images of a country that only twenty years ago experienced a massive genocide – one million people died iin 100 days.


-Drummer Girl, Kimonyi

-Kigali Boys

-Coolest Lady Ever, Outside kigali

-HI!, Ruhengeri Lake

For this exhibition, Rwandans have challenged this gaze and now showus their country through their own eyes. Harrison Thane,whilst working
for DFID and the girl effect took photo's of people working in the farm land smiling, thebeautiful landscape , children in schools and local community in their homes and on the streets getting on with everyday life.

-F U! Kigali Boys

-The Blue Door, Ruhengeri
The images reveal a nation that has experienced a profound change
that has been created by the people themselves. We want to show the
Rwanda of today through the exhibition and show to outsiders who may
not know how the country has been transformed under the leadership of
President Kagame.

-Head Check, Kigali

-Young girl on her way to get water, Kimonyi

Whilst much has been written and documented about the genocide, 2014 marks the 20 year anniversary of its end. Photographer Harrison Thane will attempt to bring the modern and post war Rwanda to our artistic attention with this exhibition at the end of April which himself and Salon Africa a contemporary art project space plan to fund through your kind donations.

-The Gang, Ruhengeri

What is Salon Africa?

Salon Africa is a new contemporary art project space with Africa at the heart of it's program. It's principally based on contemporary artist based in Africa,from it's diaspora or other artist who engage in a dialogue related to Africa. Salon presents a dynamic and innovative series of activities including talks,  Educational programs, panel discussions,curated projects and events within the gallery space.

-Mud Hut, Southern Provence

Why do we need your funding and where it's going!

  • To Print and frame the images to a museum level standard in order to do these images justice and offer the viewer an immersive and dynamic experience.

  • To hire and staff a gallery space with a great footfall within a central London location so everyone can experience these images of Rwanda within the context of the 20th Anniversary of the genocide which will last 100 days.

  • To facilitate and staff our educational program. Its main aims are to engage young people through a combination of educational activity’s using a range of delivery formats and mediums- The projects is aimed at:  secondary schools, young offenders and the wider community. Our main target group is at risk 15-24 years olds: opening up this opportunity to young offenders,  young people that have been excluded from schools or are at risk of exclusion  and young people in the wider community from disadvantaged backgrounds, but it will not be completely exclusive. Most of these groups will be sourced from specific youth projects, alternative schools, PRU’s, Mainstream schools and youth clubs, using the strong connections and experience our staff have in this sector. These programs will aim to encourage creativity and provide engaging avenues for learning through experience and inspiration.

-Kigali Guard, Kigali

The Impact Of your Support goes beyond the Exhibition

  • This exhibition Promotes, increased tourism and investment into Rwanda through the positive images presented.

  • It reaches out through a cutting edge cultural event and educational program to a younger more diverse demographic who would not otherwise necessarily access information about Rwanda or Photography.

  • The showing of these images open up a new dialogue related to Rwanda and allows for positive interventions highlighting Rwanda's achievements on the occasion of this Anniversary.

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help the campaign and let people know how the their contribution will make a difference

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much for your support, we hope to see you all at the Exhibition and if you can’t make it we hope you enjoy the perks for giving. Salon Africa and Harrison Thane look forward to making this exhibition a reality and to share these beautiful images with the world during a time of commemoration.


Harrison and Benjamin x

Interested in the story above or these images ?

Contact:

Founder and director of Salon Africa –  Benjamin@salon-africa.com

Press and Media officer – Mimi@salon-africa.com

story:
Short Summary

Hi, I'm currently raising funds to replace my camera that recently broke. It was getting old and used so much -- it actually stopped functioning *while* I was on a shoot. Most embarrassing moment as a photographer ever. Luckily, my client had a backup camera that I was able to use to finish the job. Alas, that backup camera isn't always there for all the work I have to do/finish.

I'm an internationally exhibited photographer, my work's been featured in Vice, Out Magazine, Urb, etc, and I'm currently producing two human rights documentaries.

Having a camera is essential to my livelihood. Without one, I can't finish my films or even commission work to pay my bills/survive. Due to recent financial hardships, I'm not able to afford a replacement. I've started this campaign in hopes that I can raise enough money to replace my camera and continue working.

If you're a fan of my work, please consider donating towards my fund -- any amount helps!

If you'd like to learn more about me, here are some links to my work. CV, and social media:

http://www.threat.tv
http://linkedin.com/in/threat
http://instagram.com/raethreat
http://twitter.com/raethreat

THANK YOU SO MUCH!! <3 <3 <3
 

What I Need To Raise & Perks

I need to raise $3500. Funds from this campaign will go towards:

  • Purchasing a new camera (with a warranty this time!)
  • Paying the IGG processing fees
  • Any excess will go towards the helping fund the current projects I'm working on

SELECT PERKS:



 



 


**** NEW PERK ADDED!!!!! ****

 

The Impact

This is my livelihood. I need to continue to create art and finish working on my documentaries. Please help?

 

Risks & Challenges

Without a camera, I'm not able to work nor will I be able to finish filming my documentary projects. There are risks relying on this platform, but any amount absolutely helps!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you're able to help contribute towards the fund or not, please help spread the word! A share on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media platform all helps!

Thank you so much! <3 <3 <3

This is my livelihood. I need to continue to create art and finish working on my documentaries. Please help?
 

Risks & Challenges
Without a camera, I'm not able to work nor will I be able to finish filming my documentary projects. There are risks relying on this platform, but any amount absolutely helps!
 

Other Ways You Can Help
Whether you're able to help contribute towards the fund or not, please help spread the word! A share on Facebook, Twitter, or any other social media platform all helps!Thank you so much! <3 <3 <3

story:
Courtney Slade will be loading up her camera bag and hitting the roads of North America to document, explore, experience and share life along the water's edge.


The Project

About the Photographer

Hi, I'm Courtney Slade, a photographer living in Austin, Texas. My entire life I have surrounded myself with water. Growing up in the Texas Hill Country I always found one lake beginning to cross my path as another had just ended. Moving an hour east to study photojournalism at The University of Texas at Austin, I was still captured by water’s presence. Lake Austin became my escape. 

After graduating from UT I started my photography business centered around travel and water sports. Shortly after, I launched a website called Slades Wake, a one-stop-shop lake resource for Lake Austin, Lake Travis and Lady Bird Lake.

The Campaign

This fall I will be leaving for a photographic road trip. Combining my love for documenting water and those who build and enjoy their lives around it, I'll hit the road. Loading up my Land Cruiser and preparing it to be my home, I'll begin my travels and documentation of different bodies of water throughout the western part of the United States.

I'll be traveling to various lakes, both those well known and others not so known. Camping at state and national parks, my purpose will be to document and share all that I come across while on the trip. Taking boards along with me I'll SUP, surf and explore life along the water's edge. My travel route will consist of Texas, New Mexico, Arizona, California, Nevada, Utah, and Colorado. The end result will be a self-published photography book filled with images and text from what I see to who I meet along the way.

It's Importance and Impact

Do you ever feel like you just need to go? There is a pull. Your heart is on one end while the unknown is on the other. It's the people you've never met, the places you've never been, an experience you'll have forever.

Life is an adventure. It's leaving all comfort and routine in the rear view mirror. It's finding your passion and running straight towards it, not looking back.

Just like every other person, I've searched for a purpose. Something that puts a smile on my face every day, something that makes me want to be a better person, something I can give back to this world.

I believe photography is my key to the answer. It's what makes me tick. It's what makes me feel alive.

To me, life is about the moments, the experience.

With your help and belief I'll be able to turn this dream, this passion into a reality to share with the rest of the world. Your contribution will bring more knowledge of the natural beauty we are surrounded by each day to others.

What I Need

My funding goal is $12,000. This money will go towards the costs for the road trip and self-publication of the photography book.

The Breakdown:

The Road Trip

  • Gas
  • Food
  • Roof Top Tent for Ruby Redbird (my Land Cruiser)
  • Mini Fridge for Ruby
  • Conversion building materials to make the Land Cruiser my home
  • Vehicle maintenance
  • AAA
  • Emergency Vehicle Funds
  • National Parks & Federal Recreational Lands Pass Series
  • State Parks Passes
  • First Aid Materials
  • Emergency Car Kit: jumper cables, flares, blanket bottled H20
  • Camping Gear: flashlight, batteries, compass, multitool, sleeping bag, etc.

The Book

  • Self-publishing
  • Cover Design
  • ISBN
  • Book Printing & Shipping using Blurb
  • Marketing and PR

What You Get

Check out all of the perks listed to the right that you'll receive in return for your support! From a personalized postcard and Instagram photo from the road to your name printed in the dedication of the signed photography book, there are many levels to choose from.

Support

The easiest and quickest way for me to receive funding is through the PayPal option.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute right now? No worries! You can still support:

  • Spread the word. Share this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues.
  • Email them this link or use the Indiegogo share tools.
  • Follow along on my website, Slades Wake
  • Stay super current on social media: Slades Wake Facebook, @SladesWake on Twitter, and @sladeswake on Instagram

Self-publishing

Book Printing & Shipping using Blurb

What You Get

Support
The easiest and quickest way for me to receive funding is through the PayPal option.






Other Ways You Can Help
Can't contribute right now? No worries! You can still support:

Spread the word. Share this campaign with your family, friends, and colleagues.
Email them this link or use the Indiegogo share tools.
Follow along on my website, Slades Wake

Stay super current on social media: Slades Wake Facebook, @SladesWake on Twitter, and @sladeswake on Instagram

story:
COLD INSTINCT is the first book released by the world renowned amphibian and reptile photographer, Matthijs Kuijpers. This publication is a photographic nature book of unparalleled quality, featuring shots of bizarre, rare and endangered reptiles and amphibians. Through Matthijs’ enigmatic photographs, you will witness the savage and breathtaking beauty of these animals. 

 

 

This book is an incomparable collection of some of the most peculiar species that have ever crawled or slithered on the Earth; some of which are carefully dwelling in the most hidden crevices of the Planet!

 

 

Fierce but fragile, this book allows you to see these animals in their true form: explore the shocking diversity of the herpetofauna through more than 70 captivating portraits of cold blooded species.  

 

 

THE GOAL 

Our vision: we want to publish an art book on nature of the highest quality, a collectable coffee table book with dramatic and captivating photography. 

Support us so you can release the sought after book by Matthijs. All Indiegogo pledges are introduction prices to The Cold Instinct Series, so you can be sure that you will get an exceptional deal in the funding phase.

 

 

Matthijs is an award-winning photographer who has been published worldwide on National Geographic, BBC wildlife magazine, Netflix, The Guardian, Time Magazine and Discovery Channel - just to name a few.

 

Fuelled by his childhood passion, Matthijs left school to go to Madagascar and work with reptiles and amphibians; 27 years on Matthijs has become an expert photographer in his field. He is relentless, never failing to pick up his camera despite the number of dangerous encounters he has incurred.  

 

 

Armoured giants, venomous toads and other crawling creatures: Matthijs owns a vast collection of reptile and amphibian photographs; and by vast... we mean really immense: he has photographed an impressive 1500 species and counting. He’s one of the few people owning such a powerful compilation of coldblooded fauna. 

 

 

Incredibly diverse and rarely seen: In COLD INSTINCT, Matthijs has selected his greatest shots and the most extraordinary species he came across, to showcase a comprehensive selection of his body of work. His aim is to capture the pure essence of the animals, and he does that by completely removing the environment and habitat.

 

 

 

Matthijs creates a close relationship with his subjects when photographing  - but you will be astonished rather than fearful, and you might just find yourself feeling intrigued.

Matthijs is the Dutch Crocodile Dundee. He is one of the most passionate herpers out there. He has traveled the world through mountains and deserts to capture the rarest and most endangered cold blooded specimens, from the rain forests of Cameroon to the Dragon island of Komodo. He’s been on the trail of the most venomous and poisonous reptiles on the planet.

 

 

This snake charmer’s lifestyle needs special equipment, so Kuijpers has two portable studios for different situations. One is for extreme locations without electricity and one is for travelling light. The other studio is a little bigger, (still portable), equipped with studio lights and used for conservation parks.

Matthijs and his wife and two daughters also care for a number of diverse animals at home and they share his passion by fully supporting him on his endeavors.

 

Did you know that about 86% of species on Earth are still waiting to be found? Most of those creatures could become extinct before we get a chance to discover them. Every year, approximately 18,000 new species are discovered and classified. We believe that about 20,000 species go extinct annually. 

 

Amphibians might look scary at first, but they are much more vulnerable than they appear. Their survival is challenged daily by threats of climate change, pollution and poaching. Habitat loss is the greatest threat to cold species in Europe. 

Some reptiles and amphibians have cleverly adapted to the threatening conditions, but they are in constant need of protection. Our hope is to create awareness of just how much these little guys need our attention. We need to know how we can help protect them; but for that, we must learn more about them.

 

 

We wanted to give you the kind of book that we would want to buy for ourselves; that’s why we chose to print and produce it 100% in Italy. We worked side by side with our Italian supplier to test different paper and printing samples with a unique binding technique to ensure we deliver the best product possible.   

 

 

HERE ARE ALL THE COLD FACTS ABOUT THE BOOK

  • Portrait Format - Dimension 300x240 mm 
  • 200 gr finest Italian paper of highest quality and brilliance
  • 152 edge printed pages
  • 5 color offset prints, with every text printed in silver Pantone
  • 72 beautiful images of rare and endangered species
  • 8 colourful index pages of the species with all the classifications
  • 2 gatefold spreads with 4 snake and 4 lizard portraits
  • Animal print embossed hard cover
  • Flat-opening Swiss binding 

 

The COLD INSTINCT photography book is bound using a traditional Swiss method. It's a perfect binding technique, which will allow your book to lay flat when open on a table. 

 

 

With this sleek technique, the spine is not attached to the cover and the cloth lining is intentionally exposed. This is a high quality binding that makes our books more durable: you can flip through it as many times as you want, your book cover won't get worn-out or damaged! 

 

 

We've got some COOL wall art for you!

Have a look at this colorful series featuring Matt's photography. Choose from a wide variety of art prints and dazzle your herper friends with the vibrant colors and cute little mugs. 

Let's face it: these little guys know how to show their true colors.

 

This reward comes with the Reptaholic bundle. Get your hands on one of our mesmerising posters, available in 5 different iconic images; perfect for decorating your reptile room, classroom, office or home!  

 

This reward comes with the Reptaholic bundle. 1 calendar, 12 colourful species! Our desktop calendar comes with a beautiful all-black heavy cardboard stand. Every month features a different animal from the book.  

 

These rewards include a copy of the Cold Instinct book and your art print of choice!

Incredible colours and details, dramatic light effects: our high quality photographic papers will make these nature portraits come alive. 

You can choose from two high quality options: 

  • Museum-grade matte art paper
  • Silver metallic matte print that produces dazzling 3d effects.

The prints are available in two different sizes:

Small Limited Edition Print [A3 - 297 x 420 mm - 11.7 x 16.5 in]
Large Limited Edition Print [A1 - 594 x 841 mm - 23.4 x 33.1 in]

Each copy is signed and numbered by Matthijs.

All art prints will be shipped in a protective cardboard tube. You will receive your copy of Cold Instinct in a separate shipment.   

 

 

This giant art print combines a 12-color printing process with an innovative hanging system and it has a beautiful satin finish with incredibly vivid colours. The artwork comes with an invisible wall mount: this unique hanging system will let you enjoy your artwork to the max!

 

 

Our stretch goal - COLD INSTINCT Deluxe version

This premium case will have a beautiful embossed cover and the title will be printed in golden hot foil to match the hard cover of the book. The inner sleeve of the case features a snake photograph in the lining; a magnet flap provides a secure and pleasant closure and the black satin ribbon helps you remove the book from the cover with care. 

 

All our books produced here on Indiegogo are limited editions, but the deluxe edition will include an exclusive, numbered and signed copy of the book in an elegant case of which as few as 100 copies will be produced. 100% Made in Italy.

  • book case
  • numbered and signed by Matthijs

Funding required to unlock this stretch goal: $30 000

 

For centuries Italian bookbinders have been world famous for being the best in their field. From monastic scriptures to encyclopedia they produced masterpieces through attention to quality and details.

Despite heritage, one of the many reasons we chose an Italian supplier, rather than a cheaper one abroad, was the ability to verify the quality of the product itself.

We have a  lot of trust in our producer, Kappadue. They followed us all the way through our first book campaign, CHICken!. Thanks to their great support and collaboration during the book's design process, we have made a book that we are truly proud of and that inspired us to experiment with book publishing again. 

We chose certified paper, produced exclusively with cellulose fibers from sustainably managed forests. Our suppliers guarantee the usage of 100% FSC® wood. All our rewards are printed, bound and packaged in Italy, for an optimum quality of the final product. We don't compromise.

 

Follow the book and Matthijs on Instagram @thecoldinstinct @mgkuypers  

Like Reptiles4All on Facebook

Video credits:

Snakes Interaction - Miron Bilski http://www.mironfilms.com 

Studio footage and editing - Paolo Piantadosi

story:
Hi!  My name is Dianna Ippolito the writer, director and one of the producers of "Robb's Problem." Emmy and Imagen nominated producers Bridget Chun and Juliet Lopez have also come on board.  Our goal is to bring you a really smart, beautiful and thought-provoking horror film, produced, written and directed by women. As a writer and director, I was attracted to the idea of telling a story about a mannequin who comes to life, and the strange love story that ensues.  I love making films that take hold of you emotionally, have elements of melancholy, and that surprise you. “Robb’s Problem” definitely has that, but also it jumps head first into horror.

“Robb’s Problem” tells the story of a lonely factory worker whose 9 to 5 job doesn’t hold many surprises. Robb is used to his dull routine, and the sameness of it all -- until one extraordinary day when his world gets turned upside down. The day he meets Mia. But Mia isn’t your typical woman. She is a mannequin who comes to life. A strange, bittersweet romance begins and Robb's melancholy life is seemingly in his past.

We need your support to bring "Robb's Problem" to life!  We've worked up a budget and feel that $16,000 will cover items like location rental, insurance, VFX makeup, mannequins, props, equipment rentals, food, editing, sound design, colorist, graphic design, an original score, hair and makeup, production design, film festival entry fees and paying our talented cast and crew  something for their participation in this passion project.  

Danny Boushebel a veteran TV and film actor, will play the lonely factory worker Robb. You may recognize Danny from his varied roles on television including Netflix's Stranger Things. Watch his reel to see how talented he is!  https://vimeo.com/143953744

Actress Aimee Stolte and I have worked with before on a short film I wrote and directed about a grim reaper. She was amazing and knocked it out of the park. I love working with people with such stellar acting chops. View her reel here. https://vimeo.com/192098572

Shooting the film will be a DP I have worked with on six films by the name of Dante Yore. Dante loves to think outside the box in terms of how to create interesting camera angles and really understands the nuances of how to evoke tone and  emotion. Plus he's so much fun on set. We laugh all the time which is the kind of set I love. We will be shooting on the Red camera and using some cool Russian lenses for a cinematic look. Watch his DP reel here. https://vimeo.com/192223848

This film will have a color pallet inspired by Blade Runner - I love the cool, solitary feeling of that film.

This is a mood reel that gives you an idea of the tone. https://youtu.be/-4weiD-NLYU

-- Even if you can't contribute with a monetary donation - there's TONS of other ways to support "Robb's Problem"!
 

-- Share the hashtag - #RobbsProblem

-- Follow us on twitter - @RobbsProblem

-- Follow us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/robbsproblem

-- Follow us on Instagram - @RobbsProblem

-- Tell your friends!!
