She was amazing and knocked it out of the park. I love working with people with such stellar acting chops. View her reel here. https://vimeo.com/192098572Shooting the film will be a DP I have worked with on six films by the name of Dante Yore. Dante loves to think outside the box in terms of how to create interesting camera angles and really understands the nuances of how to evoke tone and  emotion. Plus he's so much fun on set. We laugh all the time which is the kind of set I love. We will be shooting on the Red camera and using some cool Russian lenses for a cinematic look. Watch his DP reel here. https://vimeo.com/192223848This film will have a color pallet inspired by Blade Runner - I love the cool, solitary feeling of that film.This is a mood reel that gives you an idea of the tone. https://youtu.be/-4weiD-NLYU-- Even if you can't contribute with a monetary donation - there's TONS of other ways to support "Robb's Problem"! -- Share the hashtag - #RobbsProblem-- Follow us on twitter - @RobbsProblem-- Follow us on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/robbsproblem-- Follow us on Instagram - @RobbsProblem-- Tell your friends!!

story:
Please note that the book will now be an extra 60-70 pages longer and expected delivery date is not until the middle of November. Apologies for the added delay but the added pages is taking a while to finish off.


Please visit http://www.alpineexposures.com/pages/book for pre-orders


What is the Alpine Exposures Photo Book?

The Alpine Exposures Photo book is a coffee table book that will showcase Jon Griffith's work over the last ten years in the mountain sports industry. True to Jon's work ethic the book only shows photos taken in real situations in order to offer readers an in-depth experience of the world of extreme mountain sports. Featuring shots from around the European Alps from the Eiger North Face to Mont Blanc, there are detailed captions accompanying every shot- there is a real focus here on inspirational photography not just eye candy.
Scattered throughout the book are longer photo essays that showcase certain big or classic climbs and that we feel deserve more than just one photo to describe the climb. In a way the book is a photographic guide to what we feel are the Alps's most beautiful climbs, ski descents, and flying terrains, and will hopefully inspire the reader to add a few more climbs/descents to their tick list.

Excerpt from the Foreword by Ueli Steck: 

The one thing that will always be hard for me to accept is when we pack our bags and Jon puts in his heavy camera – I’m quite a stickler when it comes to keeping weight to a minimum, and my consolation for that now is in this book. Life in the present moment is what counts. Experiences and encounters are what we keep and what shapes us. Jon’s photography conveys these experiences. He captures the authenticity and spirit of these moments in time and I’m glad that he at least is keeping a record of them.

Please click here to view a 60 page sample of the book


The Man Behind the Camera


Based in Chamonix, France, Jonathan has climbed the world over and established himself as one of the world’s leading mountain sports photographers. A highly accomplished Alpinist himself, Jonathan continues to push himself to shoot what has never been shot before. This approach has taken his climbing to a level that sees him regularly tie in with climbers such as Ueli Steck and embarking on cutting edge ascents to visually document expeditions in the Alps, Patagonia, Alaska and the Himalayas. It’s a method that puts authentic climbing at its heart: an increasingly rare but refreshing approach to adventure photography in a climate where style is valued more than substance.


What can you expect to see in the Alpine Exposures Photo Book?


The book will cover the European Alps with a main focus on the Mont Blanc Massif. Whilst Jon is predominantly an Alpine Climbing Photographer there are also large parts devoted to other sports he has shot such as skiing, BASE, rock climbing, ice climbing, paragliding, and speed riding. The book aims to cover all the great classic Alpine Climbs from the Eiger North Face to more mellow classic ridge climbs like the Rochefort arete. In a sense there will be something in there for everyone, whether you are operating at the top end of your sport or are just starting out.



Layout and Content


The text will be printed in English, French and German within the same edition
As already mentioned the content is real-life driven. There are no setup or faked shots in this book: I wanted to keep true to the values of Alpinism and to the people that I’ve climbed with. To that end all the images contained are real- these aren’t posed shots but honest moments captured that show a fleeting glimpse of a greater climb. The extended captions are there to help set the scene because sometimes it’s easy to forget that behind a split second snap shot in time there may have been days of hard climbing just for that single moment through the lens, and for me that’s important. 
Classic, popular, or major climbs are highlighted in longer photo essays to help add variation to the book. The idea is to tell the stories of hard climbs, the people behind them, and the work behind ground breaking ascents in a visual and caption driven manner. It's not just a set of mind numbing images but ones that have real context and story behind them and that is what we hope will keep the reader delving in to this book for hours at a time.




      Further Details

      Book Pages: 288 pages
      Book Size: 250mmx300mm (Landscape)
      Price: £35 RRP (+ £12 international Postage and Packaging)
      The book will ship middle November 2014

  Further Details
Book Pages: 288 pages
Book Size: 250mmx300mm (Landscape)
Price: £35 RRP (+ £12 international Postage and Packaging)
The book will ship middle November 2014

story:
Lebensgefühl Island

So wird der neue Bildband genannt, in dem man neben grandiosen Bildern auch tolle Texte zu lesen bekommt, und so sein Wissen über das Land, die Leute und vieles mehr erweitern kann. 

Das Buch birgt in seinen 144 Seiten die verschiedensten Themen, die für wirklich jeden interessant sind, egal wie viel er bis jetzt mit der Insel zu tun hatte. Die Texte sind leicht leserlich und sehr unterhaltsam. Es gibt klare Fakten, viele Geschichten und auch den ein oder anderen Spruch - und die Bilder, verzaubernd schön!

In den insgesamt 43 Kapiteln gibt es Bilder und Texte zu den verschiedensten Themen wie z.B.

  • das Land und die Leute: Island, Wikinger, Mentalität, Arbeiten, Abstammung, Sprache, typische Speisen, Wirtschaft
  • die Natur: Freiheit, Wind, Schnee, Weihnachten, Nordlichter, Gletscher, Sonne, Gletscherzunge und Gletschersee, Nationalpark, Wasserfälle, Geysire, Hot Pot
  • die Tiere: Pferde, Farbe, Gangarten, Zuchtgebiete, Herden, Pferdefleisch, Hunde, Rentiere
  • Poetisches: Glück, Trolle und Elfen, Fotografie


About

Hinter dem ganzen Buch - angefangen von der Grundidee über die Fotografien, Texte, Layout und Grafik bis zu der Vermarktung - stehe ich, Eva Frischling, selbstständige Fotografin und Islandnarr aus Salzburg / Österreich.
Angefangen hat alles mit einem harmlosen Islandaufenthalt, der dann so viel mehr war als ich mir vorstellte. Also konnte ich nicht anders als die wunderbaren Momente festhalten und die Geschichten dazu in der ganzen Welt verteilen.


Erstauflage

Das Buch wird mit einer Erstauflage von 500 Stück auf Deutsch erscheinen - hochwertig hergestellt wie ein Bildband auch sein soll. So etwas kostet aber auch, und deshalb bin ich auf euch angewiesen.

Kosten

Ihr alle könnt mir helfen, einen Teil der Druckkosten abzudecken und so meinenTraum von Island zu verwirklichen.

Die Druckkosten für die erste Auflage beziehen sich auf ca. 7.000 Euro, also rund 9.400 USD.

Wird das finanzielle Ziel bei Indiegogo erreicht, dann sind ca. 4.000 Euro, also 5.400 USD, in der Tasche, und der Druck kann sofort beginnen.

Wird das Funding-Ziel von den 5.400 USD nicht erreicht, dann wird das Projekt trotzdem umgesetzt. Es ist zwar schwieriger, aber nicht unmöglich. Die Finanzmittel die bis dahin eingelangt sind, gehen selbstverständlich direkt in die Druckkosten-Sparkasse über.

Als Gegenzug für euer Geld bekommt ihr sogenannte "Perks". Die Perks für "Lebensgefühl Island" gehen von Postkarten und Kunstdrucke über ein auf Glas geprintetes  Panoramabild bis hin zu den Bildbänden.

Einblick in das Buch

Um eine bessere Vorstellung von dem Buch zu bekommen, gibt es hier das Buchcover und zwei Texte inkl. Layout:


  • Der erste Text nennt sich Hreindýr - also Rentiere:

" Wie bekannt, gibt es in Island 13 Weihnachtsmänner. Ob es jetzt purer Zufall ist oder eine arrangierte Sache, dass im Jahre 1771 genau 13 Rentiere aus Skandinavien importiert wurden, wird wohl unbeantwortet bleiben.

Fakt ist jedoch, dass diese Rentiere nach Island geholt wurden, um vermehrt zu werden und als zusätzliche Nahrungsquelle zu dienen.

Erst nach 87 Jahren war die Population dieser Tiere so hoch, dass sie durch ein Jagdgesetz zum Abschuss freigegeben werden konnten.

Weil diese Tiere jedoch keinen großen Beitrag zur Nahrungsversorgung darstellten, eher schon eine Belastung waren, da sie immer in großen Herden ankamen und alles niedertrampelten, wurden alle Rentiere in den östlichen Teil der Insel verjagt. Dort sind heute noch ca. 3000 Exemplare zu Hause. Den Sommer verbringen sie in den Bergen und sind für kaum jemanden zu Gesicht zu bekommen. Im Winter jedoch, wenn das Futter auf der hohen Lage wenig wird, kommen sie ins Tal und treiben dort ihr Unwesen: sie springen über alle Zäune und reißen diese auch teilweise nieder, zertrampeln die Wiesen und Acker und fressen die übrig gebliebene Ernte bis zur Wurzel ab.

Nichts desto trotz ist es ein einmaliges Erlebnis auf der Ringstraße zu fahren und neben sich Hunderte von diesen stolzen, riesengroßen Tieren mit atemberaubenden Geweihen zu sichten." 


  • Der zweite Text nennt sich Hestar í Hornafirði und berichtet über die Zuchtlinie des Islandpferdes im Südosten Islands, in Gebiet Hornafjörður.
" Hornafjörður ist wie bereits bekannt eine Gemeinde im Südosten Islands, aus der auch eine Zuchtlinie entsprungen ist.

Das Gebiet rund um und im Hornafjörður ist vom Gletscher Vatnajökull und dessen Gletscherzungen geprägt. Durch die unzähligen Schmelzwasserflüsse ist dieses Gebiet regelrecht vom Rest Islands abgeschnitten. Erst seit es Brücken gibt, kommt man problemlos von A nach B.

Bevor es Brücken, Autos und andere moderne Fortbewegungsmittel gab, war man auf die Pferde angewiesen, um über die Flüsse zu gelangen.

Schon als Fohlen wurde den Hornafjörður-Pferden das Schwimmen beigebracht. Man ging mit den Muttertieren und den Jungtieren in Gewässer und schwamm immer wieder ein Stück. So lange, bis das Schwimmen so etwas Natürliches wie Laufen war.

Somit konnte man, wenn man zu einem Gebiet außerhalb des Hornafjörður wollte, über das Land reiten und über die Flüsse auf dem Pferderücken schwimmen.

Der Körper der Pferde war kräftig und hochgewachsen. Dies ist auf die Bewältigung der schwierigen Hindernisse zurückzuführen. Denn war ein Pferd groß, dann musste es möglicherweise gar nicht durch den Fluss schwimmen, sondern konnte durchgehen.

Die Pferde aus dem Hornafjörður waren regelrechte Wasserratten.

Eine Stute aus dem Gebiet des Hornafjörðurs wurde verkauft und sollte mit dem Schiff in die neue Heimat gebracht werden.

Nach einer langen Autoreise von über 500 Kilometern von Hornafjörður bis Reykjavik wurde diese Stute mit vielen anderen Pferden, die exportiert werden sollten, auf ein Schiff gebracht.

Das Schiff legte vom Hafen ab und fuhr auf die offene See hinaus. Nach einigen Kilometern Fahrt geschah etwas, das eigentlich kein Problem darstellen sollte: die Stute riss aus dem Container, in dem sie unterbracht war, aus und lief auf dem Schiff umher. So etwas geschah schon mal und war nichts Dramatisches, denn das Pferd wurde einfach wieder eingefangen. Auf einem begrenzten Raum wie auf einem Schiff war dies eine einfache Angelegenheit.

Die Stute fand es jedoch nicht so toll, dass Menschen auf sie zukamen und sie in die Ecke trieben. Panisch suchte sie einen Ausweg, um sich nicht von den Angst einjagenden Personen gefangen nehmen zu lassen.

Plötzlich lief die Stute flink zwischen den Menschen hindurch, nahm Anlauf und sprang über die Reling ins offene Meer – viele Kilometer entfernt vom Land.

Weil die Hornafjörður-Stute keine Scheu vor dem Wasser und dem damit verbundenen Schwimmen hatte, schwamm sie ganz gemütlich zurück – in Richtung Land.

Als sie kurz vor der Küste war, schwamm sie nicht bis zu dieser und ging auf das Land, sondern schlug in Richtung Osten (also Richtung Hornafjörður) ein und schwamm entlang der Küste viele Kilometer weiter. Erst als sie keine Lust mehr zum Schwimmen hatte, ging sie auf das Festland, um zu fressen und schlafen. Nach einer Weile setzte sie dann ihre Reise fort.

Manchmal ging sie auf dem Land, manchmal schwamm sie entlang der Küste, bis sie nach vielen Tagen wieder bei ihrem Besitzer ankam – dem die Kinnlade hinunter fiel, als er sein als ertrunken geltendes Pferd vor sich stehen sah. "



Herausforderungen, Augenmerke und weitere Aktivitäten

Dieses Projekt hat eine enorm große Herausforderung an mich gestellt. Es gehört so viel mehr dazu als nur fotografieren und schreiben, um ein erfolgreiches Buch heraus zu bringen. Irgendwann kam der Punkt, an dem ich realisierte, wie viel Arbeit das alles war und stand somit am Scheidepunkt von zwei Entscheidungen: mache ich das Buch so wie ich gerade Lust darauf habe und bringe ein gute Buch heraus, das sicher den meisten gefällt, oder hole ich das Beste aus allem heraus, so dass es nicht nur gut oder perfekt ist, sondern perfektioniert in allen Arbeitsrichtungen ist?

Ich hab mich für die zweite Möglichkeit entschieden.  Von da an war keine Nacht zu kurz und keine Arbeit zu viel. 

Das Hauptaugenmerk wurden darauf gelegt, dass das Buch für wirklich jeden interessant ist. Egal wie gut er sich bis jetzt mit Island auskennt, ob er überhaupt einen Bezug zu der Insel hat oder schon sein ganzes Leben dort lebt. Die Texte sind einfach geschrieben und sehr unterhaltsam. Da das Buch in viele Kapitel aufgeteilt ist, kann man die Texte nach und nach lesen - so wie man Zeit hat - oder alles auf einmal in sich saugen.

Der nächste Schritt, wenn das Buch in der Erstausgabe aufgelegt ist, wird das Übersetzen auf Englisch und Isländisch sein.


    Nicht nur Geld hilft.

    Vermutlich werden sich viele angesprochen fühlen, und dieses Projekt unterstützen wollen, aber es wird nicht jeder das nötige Kleingeld parat haben, um dies auch in diesem Sinne zu tun.
    Es muss aber nicht immer Geld sein um zu helfen, denn ein wichtiger Teil um zu dem Endergebnis zu kommen, ist, das Projekt unter so vielen Leuten wie nur möglich zu verbreiten.

    • Sprich über das Projekt,
    • Teile es auf sozialen Netzwerken,
    • Versende es per Mail und andere Nachrichten,
    • Zeige es in deinem Umfeld her.


    Ich bedanke mich vielmals bei euch!

    Denn ohne euch wäre dieses Projekt niemals das, was es jetzt ist und was noch daraus werden kann.

Manchmal ging sie auf dem Land, manchmal schwamm sie entlang der Küste, bis sie nach vielen Tagen wieder bei ihrem Besitzer ankam – dem die Kinnlade hinunter fiel, als er sein als ertrunken geltendes Pferd vor sich stehen sah. "




Herausforderungen, Augenmerke und weitere Aktivitäten
 Dieses Projekt hat eine enorm große Herausforderung an mich gestellt. Es gehört so viel mehr dazu als nur fotografieren und schreiben, um ein erfolgreiches Buch heraus zu bringen. Irgendwann kam der Punkt, an dem ich realisierte, wie viel Arbeit das alles war und stand somit am Scheidepunkt von zwei Entscheidungen: mache ich das Buch so wie ich gerade Lust darauf habe und bringe ein gute Buch heraus, das sicher den meisten gefällt, oder hole ich das Beste aus allem heraus, so dass es nicht nur gut oder perfekt ist, sondern perfektioniert in allen Arbeitsrichtungen ist?
Ich hab mich für die zweite Möglichkeit entschieden.  Von da an war keine Nacht zu kurz und keine Arbeit zu viel. 
Das Hauptaugenmerk wurden darauf gelegt, dass das Buch für wirklich jeden interessant ist. Egal wie gut er sich bis jetzt mit Island auskennt, ob er überhaupt einen Bezug zu der Insel hat oder schon sein ganzes Leben dort lebt. Die Texte sind einfach geschrieben und sehr unterhaltsam. Da das Buch in viele Kapitel aufgeteilt ist, kann man die Texte nach und nach lesen - so wie man Zeit hat - oder alles auf einmal in sich saugen.
Der nächste Schritt, wenn das Buch in der Erstausgabe aufgelegt ist, wird das Übersetzen auf Englisch und Isländisch sein.


  Nicht nur Geld hilft. Vermutlich werden sich viele angesprochen fühlen, und dieses Projekt unterstützen wollen, aber es wird nicht jeder das nötige Kleingeld parat haben, um dies auch in diesem Sinne zu tun.Es muss aber nicht immer Geld sein um zu helfen, denn ein wichtiger Teil um zu dem Endergebnis zu kommen, ist, das Projekt unter so vielen Leuten wie nur möglich zu verbreiten.


Sprich über das Projekt,

Teile es auf sozialen Netzwerken,

Versende es per Mail und andere Nachrichten,

Zeige es in deinem Umfeld her.




Ich bedanke mich vielmals bei euch!Denn ohne euch wäre dieses Projekt niemals das, was es jetzt ist und was noch daraus werden kann.

story:
Even though the campaign has ended, still you can order your copy by                                                            selecting a perk below. 

        Order your own collage, gift it during the festive season, and follow our                                                     journey through cultures!

    Update:-  All the books have been delivered to their happy contributors. 


Though cultures differ, the humanity across the world is still bound by a common thread of kindness, helpfulness, love, and various such qualities.

Though natural and manmade beauties such as bodies of water, forests, mountains, institutes of learning, architectures change across different geographical boundaries, similarities can still be found in their abstract forms.  

The world is like a large collage connected through the threads binding the humanity, the natural and the manmade schemes in their different manifestations. 

Having witnessed these amazing stories across the world, I feel a strong urge to share the experience with a larger audience. A photo-book depicting a collage of these stories with different progressive themes feels like the right step. While the stories progress, I crave for similarities and contrasts between them. 


             

I am a Computer Scientist with an artistic passion. I have had the privilege to have my education across three continents (BE- India, MS- USA, PhD - Netherlands). Being a researcher, I get to travel across the world for various professional activities. I consider myself fortunate to have witnessed different cultures during these travels. Being a scientist, I am a keen observer of the world around me, and always try to reason my observations. Photography allows me to capture my observations through the precise moments.

Photography credentials - Being an avid painter (all India level gold medalist) during school days, I have a great eye for photo composition. I am a self taught photographer. I have contributed my photographs to exhibition in Istanbul, front covers of a UK based book publisher, coffee table book editorials in India, Getty image invitations for stock photography, friend's wedding albums in Netherlands and India, my scientific institute's magazine and library archives in Amsterdam. 

                   

                               What do you get?

My ultimate aim is to share my experiences of witnessing the beauty across various cultures, through my photographic journeys, in the form of a beautiful photo-book.  Each book is printed individually from the individual contributor's contribution, so the funding goal is just to make sure that the book reaches as many people as possible.

The book conveys a strong socio-economic message comparing different cultures, to create public awareness. I have been actively involved in related work in the past, and want my photos to narrate these stories. 1% of the amount raised after all the expenditure deductions will be donated to this campaign on Indiegogo to improve the Indian farmer's crisis. 

1 farmer commits suicide in India every 30 minutes. 250,000+ farmer  suicides in 15 years.

https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/save-indian-farmers-yes-you-can/x/11621885#/  

The photo-book is an ideal gift for socio-economic-thinkers, cultural explorers, travel lovers, and architecture lovers, as the festive season approaches. It could be also used as a coffee-table book. Some of the photo-stories could be very intriguing and will definitely leave you pondering, and question the way societies across the world function, especially from socio-economic perspective. So essentially, you get some food for thought. The stories might also inspire you to visit these new places, or might bring back those fond memories, if been there already. 

Costs - Book publishing through crowdfunding is a tremendous collaborative effort from the conception of the idea until it reaches its audience in its final form. After meticulous planning I have managed to keep various costs involved such as DTP, proof-reading, printing, marketing, distributing, shipping, the Indiegogo platform  fees and credit / debit card fees, to their minimum. 

However, I can not do the publication process without your valuable contributions. By pledging your support, you are going to become a part of this unique experience, to create such a unique document covering diverse locations with their cultural and natural world juxtapositions. 

In return for your help you get to choose from the photo-book, the e-book, and other form of rewards (perks) as listed on the right section of this web-page. 

Expect the best- While the snapshots from the book's first draft copy are showcased below, an almost final proof copy of the book is getting ready.  The book incorporates feedback from artists, designers, writers, and researchers. It has gone through multiple design revisions, and proof-reads. The sample images showcased below (and in the Gallery tab) offer a glimpse into the quality of the photographs. So expect the best. Be ready to be intrigued.  

My sincere thanks that you are reading this. Please pledge your support, contribute, share and let the word spread amongst your friends on the social media, so that the campaign turns out to be a huge success. Be a part of this success. 

The rest of the section provides more details about the photo-book and its contents.

                        Photo-book specifications 


The book has a soft cover with matte finish. It contains 146 pages in 8.5 x 11 inches (almost A4) calendar  style landscape format, with 1 photo per page, printed on 60-pound smooth white offset paper. Each photo has a descriptive caption that gives a unique perspective of the story being told in a concise manner. 

  Some preview snapshots from the book's draft copy under revision are here.  

In the final book copy the captions will appear below the images, have a different font, size, color, alignment, and are more descriptive.


                          The photo-book theme 

The photo-book exhibits the juxtaposed collection of photos from my travels across selected places from the four continents (Australia, Asia, Europe, and North America). The images below offer a glimpse into the offering, as the theme progresses. 

Humanity in its various forms across different cultures as could be witnessed with daily activities of people doing business, prayers, policing, protesting, entertaining, having fun.  

The power of people- The awareness march at Marine Drive in Mumbai, India after 26/11 terrorist attacks that killed 164 people. India has been witnessing many civic movements targeting corruption, violence against women, in recent years, lead by its strong civil society organizations.
Cities host the majority of the world population where its inhabitants live and work. The look and feel of the cities symbolizes the quality of life on the offer to its citizens. 

Monaco- The richest city state, sandwiched between Italy and France, with an area of around 2.02 square km. It has the highest density of world's millionaires and billionaires.  

Architecture- Since centuries cities have served as a platform to exhibit the craftsmanship of its inhibitors.  Most cities tend to have architectural marvels that define their identity on the global map. 


Gopuram - The monumental tower entrance to the South Indian temples. The wall carvings portray the Hindu mythological stories. 

Oceans occupy 71% of the earth's surface area and form one of the most important links in the survival of life on the earth. The book covers the life around the beaches across the three main oceans, the Pacific, the Atlantic, and the Indian ocean. It also covers the beaches across the Mediterranean sea, the Arabian sea, and other water bodies such as the Bosphorous in Istanbul, Lake Tahoe in California, Kerala backwaters in India, etc.   

               The sea fountain at Santa Cruz, California. 
The roads act as culture connectors and symbolize the societal progress, allowing the seamless movements of people and goods across geographical boundaries.  This section of the book depicts roads in various shapes, sizes, and forms, as they span across cultural and geographical boundaries. 

       The long road to India’s remote places, in the greens. India has less                     than 3.8 kilometers of roads per 1000 people. For context, United States           has 21 kilometers of roads, while France has 15 kilometers of  roads per               1000 people.


Transportation- The ability to move across the geographical boundaries using different modes of transportation made numerous explorations possible. The book portrays different such possible modes of transportation in different contexts.

The agility matters - Ferry boat vs police patrol boat in Bosphorous, Istanbul.  Bosphorous is a strait that separates Europe and Asia in Istanbul. It is amazingly beautiful.
   

                       Photographic instrument  

          

All photos are framed using a Canon Rebel XSI DSLR (2009 model) with 3 sets of lenses (18-55, 55-250, 50). 

              How can you contribute?                          

                                   

                            I thank you for your generous encouragement and support. 

If you are new to crowdfunding concept please read this paragraph. In order to support my cause, you contribute an amount worth the perk displayed on the right side of this web-page. As an acknowledgement of your contribution, you will get this perk (reward) in return. So for example, if you want photo-book as the reward, you contribute $30, and follow the instructions for payment using your credit / debit card.  You can use your credit / debit card in any currency, and it will automatically charge the equivalent amount in $. In case of any problems, please contact me at mrunal.gawade@gmail.com

Depending on the amount you want to contribute you can choose a corresponding perk. I have arranged multiple forms of photographic perks (Select a Perk) in different price ranges as an acknowledgement of your contribution. 


  • The star perk is of course the photo-book itself ($30). The photo-book will be delivered to your address worldwide (shipping fees are included). The standard shipping time for US addresses is 5 days, and outside US addresses is 1 month, and might vary a bit. If you live in Europe, and want an expedited delivery in 3 days (after the book is printed),  you pay an extra $20 for the shipping. 

                      Other ways you can help

The most critical risk is not reaching out to enough contributors to be able to get fully funded. I would appeal to all of you, to be a part of this campaign and spread the word, to make it a grand success. 

A lot of people have helped to make this campaign come alive.  My sincere thanks to all of them. We are a team. We are looking for even more possible team members like you to join us to progress faster :) So please come aboard, and be a part of this unique experience. Join us on this exciting adventure and the thrill it offers as it unfolds in coming days. 


                        The photojournalism impact 

                                       

"An image is worth a thousand words".  A well timed photo has the stirring ability to create an everlasting impact on its viewers and galvanize the people.

I believe in the power of the photojournalism, and would like my photographs to question the socio-economic issues facing humanity. Your motivation, support, and contribution will go a long way in progressing me towards a mature photographer, to create better stories.  

Being a researcher, I am highly interested in the use of technology for betterment of humanity and would like my photographs to act as a catalyst in driving that transformation. 
My professional lineage at Linkedin is
https://in.linkedin.com/pub/mrunal-gawade/8/58/807                       

                         Risks and challenges


Worldwide delivery- Publication and delivery of the book will start after the campaign deadline. All contributors will get the book delivered worldwide, irrespective of the funds raised during this campaign.  The book will be printed in the USA, so the deliveries outside USA, will take a bit longer (around 1 month). I would sincerely appreciate your patience during this period.  The book should be available as a gift for the festive season towards the year end. 

If you choose to support by opting for the perks with the digital content, then they will be delivered within a month, through email, during the campaign period itself. 

Credit / debit card issues- Some people might face a risk of not having credit / debit card or other payment related issues. In that case, please let me know me at mrunal.gawade@gmail.com what perk interests you and I will provide you a way to get it. 
 
         A big thank you, and let's make it happen.

story:
THE PROGRAM

We are the Dawson College Commercial Photography Graduates of Winter 2012. The goal of this program is to give graduating students the technical, visual & business skills to perform commercial tasks typically done by self-employed or staff photographers in a manner that meets industry & professional standards. We have been instructed in various aspects of professional photography including advertising & editorial illustration, portraiture, catalogue photography, architectural photography, fashion photography, industrial photography & digital imaging. In courses designed to cover both theory & practice, we learned to use small & large format cameras, tungsten & electronic flash for studio or location lighting, & computer imaging software for output & media applications. Throughout the program, a mature & disciplined approach to commercial photography was emphasized & at the same time, we were encouraged to develop a personal creative vision of the world.

 

THE VERNISSAGE

We have finally reached the culmination of all of our work – it is time to graduate, & exhibit our work to friends, fans, potential clients & buyers. Right around Christmas we will be holding a Vernissage in the Warren G. Flowers gallery at Dawson College, & we are in need of contributions to further our potential for success as we head into the workforce. That is where you come in -- your money will be helping to fund our Vernissage in order to make it the most impressive visual presentation possible.

 

THE GOAL

We have 1500$ granted to us by the college, but that only goes so far with nearly 20 graduates. We are hoping to raise a total of 6000$. This money will go to the matting & potential framing of portfolios, producing our promo book, refreshments for the exhibition, printing of posters & so on. Regardless of whether we reach our entire goal or not, the money will be going straight to the Vernissage – we will produce our exhibition in the most economical & visually inspiring manner with the funding we have. The more funding we have, the more effective our exhibit will be.

 

THE IMPORTANCE

Some of us will soon be off to find employment in the field as assistants or employees, whereas others will be diving head first into opening their own studios & businesses. This is not the only portfolio we will ever produce, but for many of us this Vernissage is a golden opportunity to get a head start in the industry here in Montreal. The reason this Vernissage is so important is due to the fact that industry professionals will be viewing our work --  these guests may provide possible business ventures for us in the future, & we want to impress. We understand that not everyone can contribute a monetary value to our campaign -- however, you can still help by spreading the word or donating goods & services to our exhibition. We really appreciate your help!

story:
Limited-edition Hawaii landscape print sale benefiting Aloha Harvest

100% of net proceeds will be donated to Aloha Harvest.


The COVID-19 crisis has deeply affected Hawaii. Due to our tourism industry shutdown, our state has a 22% unemployment rate — the second highest in the nation. Aloha Harvest is one of the many amazing nonprofits who have stepped up to support Hawaii's needy and hungry families.


The Project

I created this project as a way to support Aloha Harvest. I’m selling a limited edition of 100 prints, featuring twelve of my favorite Hawaii landscape photographs.

The photographs are richly detailed and of the highest quality, taken with a medium format Fujifilm GFX 50s camera. I'm printing these images on 17 X 22” archival paper with a Canon imagePROGRAF PRO-1000. The total number of prints will be limited to 100.

Individual prints are priced at $75, with a set of two for $140.

100% of net proceeds will be donated to Aloha Harvest.

At the end of the campaign, I'll send out a survey and you may choose any of the images below.


Yokohama Bay, Oahu


Pololu Valley, Hawaii Island​


Kiholo State Park Reserve, Hawaii Island


Grassy Cinder Cone, Hawaii Island


Pu'ukohola Heiau, Hawaii Island


Waimea Pier, Kauai


Stand Up Paddle, Waikiki Beach


Kahala Beach, Oahu


City of Refuge, Hawaii Island


Haleakala Sunrise, Maui


Waikiki Beach Sunrise, Oahu


Fort DeRussy Beach, Oahu


Aloha Harvest

Now in its 21st year, Aloha Harvest is the largest food rescue and redistribution organization in Hawaii. A 501c3 nonprofit, Aloha Harvest picks up excess food from more than 250 donors and delivers it to more than 175 agencies that feed the hungry per year. All of their services are provided free of charge to both donors and recipients. Food donors include grocery stores, wholesale distributors, and restaurants. Food recipients include social service agencies, nonprofits, rehabilitation shelters, and food pantries. COVID-19 has intensified food insecurity in our state, making their work especially critical. So far in 2020, they've rescued and redistributed more 1.6 million pounds of food that would have been wasted.





Ordering and delivery

You'll receive a beautiful, limited-edition, large-format print mailed to you by September 2020.

ALL INCLUSIVE. Shipping is included for orders. Your print will arrive in a heavyweight cardboard mailing tube.


Timeline

  • This campaign begins on July 22, 2020. We have 30 days to reach $1700. This is the base cost for production, materials, and shipping to make 100 prints. If we don't reach $1700 in 30 days, we will not print and you will be refunded.
  • You are charged now, at the time you support the campaign.
  • Shipping prints are scheduled for September 2020.
  • Our donation to Aloha Harvest will be in September 2020, after all prints have been shipped.


Updates

I'll post updates in Indiegogo when I start printing. You'll be notified after prints have been shipped with an accounting of all expenses for the project, and the final amount that will be donated to Aloha harvest.


After the campaign ends and communication with me

You can contact me through my website davidmurphey.com for more information about the campaign, shipping inquiries, and media requests.


Risks and challenges

The minimum goal for this campaign is $1700. This is the base cost for 100 large-format prints. Expenses include archival paper, ink pigment cartridges, mailing tubes, and USPS Priority Mail shipping cost. If we don't meet this funding goal, you'll be refunded 5-7 days after the end of the campaign.   

I'm committed to printing this project and have created successful crowdsourcing campaigns in the past. I'm ready for the work involved in completing and delivering a project like this.


Photographer David Murphey

I’m a Honolulu based commercial photographer who specializes in creating imagery for travel and hospitality brands. My assignments cover a range of resort, restaurant, and lifestyle photography. My work takes me amazing locations in Hawaii and the West Coast, where I can make exceptional landscape photographs.


Thank you for supporting this project and supporting Aloha Harvest!

story:
NW Cosplay was founded by me, Dea, back in late spring 2010. It started as a way to showcase cosplay as an art with photography. I also wanted to give other cosplayers a chance to shine while pushing myself to be a better photographer. The first book was published in April 2011 and sold at Sakura Con 2011. You can now purchase it at http://www.blurb.com/bookstore/detail/2078686. All of it was funded by me.

The 2nd book is now in the works, which I will be using MagCloud so that it can have 70-100pages! It will also have tutorials, convention lists, articles, photography and other cosplay related stuff. We hope that it will be ready by Sakura Con 2013. Then we will be selling it every convention we go to, which is about 4-6 cons a year.

This time I do not have to funds to print the book and so I’ve turned to Indiegogo to get some help. Your contribution goes towards printing the book which will also help keep my costs down for the resale and I need funds to be able to sell the book at a convention.

To see my photography work visit:

http://deastar.smugmug.com/NW-Cosplay

 

To get updates go to my facebook page at

www.facebook.com/NWCosplay

 

What is Cosplay:

Cosplay is short for "costume play" it is a type of performance art in which participants wear costumes and accessories to represent a specific character or idea.

Some Questions you might have:

1)    What does my contribution pay for:

You contribution pays for the book to be printed and also helps me keep costs of the book down. I will be selling this book at many conventions for the year while working on a 3rd book, so your contribution will help me attend more conventions in which I can sell the book at.

2)    How do I submit a photo?

Please email your photo to nwcosplay@hotmail.com, send me both a portrait and landscape type shot and I will put one in the book, please make sure it’s a high resolution shot, I can resize it smaller but I can not make it bigger so it needs to be around 2550pixel by 3300pixel. Also make sure you have the photographer permission to submit it.

3)    Where do you book personal shoots?

I live in the Seattle/Lynnwood area so anyone within 30miles of that may book me for a personal shoot, sometimes I do go to Olympia so I can do shoots around there and once in awhile I do like to go to Portland. Just email me at nwcosplay@hotmail.com and we can work something out!

 

Not sure what other questions to cover so if you have any please send me an email to nwcosplay@hotmail.com and I’ll try my best to answer them!

 

About Me:

My name is Danielle but I always introduce myself as Dea since that is what my friends call me and that is the name I love. I’ve been a casual cosplayer for 10years (only one costume and con a year) only in the last 3years have I been doing 4-6 costumes and cons a year. I first stated out with being in front of my camera but then I wasn’t too happy with the sets my photographer was doing so I decided to be the photographer and I loved it more. So in order to help me be a better photographer and get my name out there I created NW Cosplay and started to do personal photo shoots and photo shoots at conventions. My greatest joy in life is to cosplay, to take photos of cosplayers and going to conventions and I want to share that with the world. You may also add me on fb at www.facebook.com/deastar83

 

Thank You, Dea

story:
CAST IRON FAMILY

Cast Iron Families is a heart-felt, home-grown project brought to you by me, Rebecca Egger, of Cast Iron Photography.  

We each have the funniest, most ornery, most one-of-a-kind kids in the world, and in the midst of the struggle to actually raise them well, we're faced with additional challenges, including two of the biggest: laughably impossible standards of "perfection," alongside the never-ending mission of documenting the story of our families through photographs. It can feel like an uphill battle.

After watching too many of my friends buy expensive cameras and then grow weary over the actual task of using them (and worry over the quality of their smart-phone photos), I decided to do something to help.  With almost ten years of portrait photography experience, I realized I had some insight to offer. And so Cast Iron Families was born--a simple, beautiful resource filled with straightforward instruction and real-life photographs (taken with a regular ol' camera--no professional gear allowed).

We cover privacy, candid moments, planned sessions, basic editing, and plenty more.  Best of all, the journey is punctuated with laughter and humility rather than expectations for immaculate results.

With this book, you can gain the practical and emotional storytelling skills you have been wanting, and, at the same time, laugh at yourself as well as impossible standards, and permit yourself to enjoy both the charm and chaos of your family.

 

What I Need & What You Get

Obviously, if I'm at the crowd funding stage, we're at a place filled with mutually beneficial opportunities.  Here's the skinny:

THE BOOK IS READY.  Written, edited, designed, and published.  READY.  Cast Iron Families is a genuinely valuable resource, and I don't want to keep it out of anyone's hands.  So, we use crowd funding. Indie Go Go is a irreplaceable resource when it comes to sharing the word.

Bonus, I am chock-full of super-fun perks!  A sweet accessory to keep me on your mind, a pen-pal kit, THE BOOK ITSELF, and, as they say, a lot more. BOOM.  Things just got real!!

My Resume

Be sure, I know what I'm doing.  Your trust is safe in me.

I've been working with cameras and portraiture casually since 2003, and seriously since 2007.  I've owned and operated my own business for over four years, and pay my taxes like a grown up.

I have two kids.  They are snotty and move too quickly and make me so tired and say CHEEEEESE and are generally a challenge to photograph.  I also have younger siblings who run when I pull out my camera.  I know your struggles.  I've learned to dominate said struggles.  Get on my team.

We don't live on a rainbow cloud of unicorns and powdered donuts.  Our family struggles and does not always look (or feel or act) cute.  We're regular people.  I do not write from the perspective of perfection.  Ain't nobody got time for that.

Lastly, I am financially responsible.  I've operated my business with zero debt.  I don't have credit cards.  I am not rich, but I am patient and I have a husband who is even more patient and gives me great advice when I do get ahead of myself. Your investment is safe in my hands.

Challenges

2016 was a huge year for my little family.  My husband started a new job, I picked up a new temporary job, we had Baby #2, we just rebranded my business, and who knows what else...it's hard to remember.  And we had a lot of commitments and stuff anyways.  So, let's throw MY FIRST BOOK on top of all of this, right?!

Here's the deal, though.

I have full faith that all of these new "excitements" are GOOD and RIGHT.

Slow and steady has been the process so far, and a little momentum right now to speed us through crowd-funding sounds perfecto.

Also, my temporary job is no more, and I've found a couple good babysitters, so there's just more time in the day.  Anything is possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If a financial contribution isn't in the cards right now, but you believe in my project and believe people will benefit from this effort, please consider the incredible, huge, irreplaceable impact you can have by:

TELLING PEOPLE ABOUT THIS CAMPAIGN.  With your mouth.  Your beautiful words.  Then sending them an email, or blasting their Facebook, or texting with a link, or whatever works for you.  Your friends and family trust you more than they trust me, a stranger--so your word will go a LONG way.

Use the IndieGoGo tools to share too!!  They're good at what they do, and those little Facebook and Twitter and Email buttons are terribly easy to use.
 

Bueno.  Thank you all so much.  Let's get this party started.

story:
Each year students from UCA Rochester produce bodies of work worthy of international recognition and so are given the opportunity to showcase their work at one of the biggest festivals and celebrations of graduate artwork in London: Free Range Photography Festival.

Following the dedication of time and money to the realisation of their final major projects, many students find it difficult to fund their participation in this degree show, which is why we have decided to launch a crowdfunding platform to help alleviate some of the financial implications of producing such a show.



Who are we?

The UCA Rochester Photography department has long had a reputation for producing some of the most intricately skilled and conscientious practitioners within the field, thanks to our industry-spec facilities and core of research-active academic staff. Our courses tend to produce work that sits more comfortably toward the fine art end of the creative spectrum while still embedding the vocational skills integral to the independent fulfillment of such creative endeavours. 

Alumni have gone on to win the Bar Tur photobook award, the Leica newcommer photography award and many more, as well as exhibiting in the Folkestone Triennial, 


Why Free Range?

Free Range has become an integral aspect of the photography course at UCA Rochester, offering new graduates the celebration and recognition their work deserves. Comprised of 18 universities from across the country, the atmosphere of creative talent and potential acts as a strong draw for many figureheads within the photographic and creative arts world. 

Past exhibitors from UCA Rochester have gone on to exhibit in shows in China, New Zealand and across the UK; others have been published in i-D, The British Journal of Photography and Portrait Salon; others have even gone on to sign contracts with galleries and leading agencies - all as a direct result of showcasing their work at Free Range.


Blind Book Sale

For the first time in our history of fundraising, we have decided to offer backers the opportunity to own some fabulous photobooks for a fraction of their value. We have received donations of bumped, returned, signed and rare books from photobookstore, MACK books and Mörel books, many of which are out of print. 

With so much choice we thought it'd be kind of us to assist with the decision making by introducing an element of chance. We have grouped the books into clusters, which you may pledge towards. You will then receive a book from this cluster, selected at random by us. Once a cluster sells out that's it! We have relied on the generosity of some of the biggest names in the photobook world in order to make this opportunity come to life, don't let it slip by!


Blind Book Cluster #1

Black Country Women by Martin Parr

St Mary Redcliffe and Temple School by Martin Parr

The Academic Year by Rut Blees Luxemburg

Kronos - Estate of 1 by Victor Boullet


Blind Book Cluster #2

Far Away by Ahmet Unver

Deadline by Will Steacy

In History by Susan Meiselas

Chapalingas by Rosalind Solomon

Sea Change by Chrsitine Redmond

I'm Freezing by Michel Pretterklieber

DODO by Adam Broomberg & Oliver Chanarin


Blind Book Cluster #3

El Porque de las Naranjas by Ricardo Cases

Dusk Steals the Daylight by Sam Berkson

Pueblos sin Retrato by Francois Mouries

Bangkok Struggle by Peter Truschner


Blind Book Cluster #4

Retrospecting the Sandy Hill Estate by Chris Shaw

Songbook by Alec Soth

Out There by Bruno Augsburger



Student Work

On top of offering some of the most interesting titles in recent photobook publishing, we are offering the chance to own work that will be making its debut in Free Range this year. Our students have come together to produce stunning postcards of their work, worthy more of the frame than the postbox, at very affordable prices. Backers here may hand select exactly what work they want to own, or may opt for random choice. 

You may choose from any of the following images to have printed as a postcard:

Image #1


Image #2


Image #3


Image #4


Image #5


Image #6


Image #7


Image #8


Image #9


Image #10


Image #11


Image #12


Image #13


Image #14


Image #15

story:
Introduction

Since the dawn of photography and its evolution, photography has come a long way. The time of going into the darkroom to process and print our image has passed (although that was fun and we still do it from time to time). Today the ability to do all of that is now in something as small and as powerful as a smart phone.

To celebrate this new technology, five photographers with very different cultural backgrounds  - Asian, European, Latin American have organized the “#BMP Exhibition” by Bangkok Mobile Photographers as a part of the “Siam Project”.

One city connects us, these five photographers: Bangkok. We will present our version of what we see in Bangkok under the following hash tags: #abstract, the #comical, or the #strange.

The exhibition will take place at the Neilson Hays Library, Suriwong Road in Bangkok from January 6- 25, 2015, Opening reception on January 8, 2015.

What we seek for funding

The exhibition will present 50 pictures (10 by each photographer), that have been taken and mostly edited on a smartphone or a mobile device. For the exhibition, they will be printed on high quality paper at the size of 20 cm x 20 cm (8 inch x 8 inch) and framed in 40 cm x 40 cm frames for display.

Press, Public Relations material and Information material will be produced and sent out to news outlets. The materials will include a pamphlet about us and the exhibition, postcards, posters and a catalog. They need to be designed, printed in high quality and sent out to newspapers and magazines.

And there will be an opening reception on January 8, 2015, which needs support for food, drinks and (live?) music.

Right now, our budget consists of our own private money, so any funding we can raise through Indiegogo will help us not only alleviate the cost for ourselves, but also to make the exhibition a bigger event, especially the opening reception.

All money that we raise above our goal will be invested into opening reception, and possibly into the next exhibition by #BMP and the Siam Project.

What will be on display

One photo by each photographer as an example. There will be ten images by each photographer in the exhibition.

by Alejandro Briones

by Aunnop Suthumno

by Duangkamon Khattiya

by Phaisal Guladee

by Timo Kozlowski

The Siam Project

The Siam Project is an umbrella for photographic activities of the Bangkok Photographers Group, a community of photo enthusiasts based in the Thai capital. The exhibition #BMP Bangkok Mobile Photographers is the first event released under the label of The Siam Project.

Helping Out (Apart From Funding)

Any help during the set up of the exhibition and the opening reception is highly welcome, e.g.

  • assisting us to hang the pictures at Neilson Hays Library

  • catering at the reception

  • organise the registration desk at the reception

  • ...

We think that mobile photography has started already to change the face of photography - how it's done and how it pervades all aspects of everyday life. Join us on our journey of discovery by supporting our first exhibition - and join our group Bangkok Mobile Photographers on Facebook!

story:
SUPERIMPORTANT: I got all the funds I needed to pay her vet bill now and want to say THANK YOU to all who've helped me! You can still, of course, order prints as long as the campaign is up if you want one. Will not sell prints after this until I have time for it (which might take a while) and the price will increase after the campaign's end.

Old text: Since my cat has become ill I'm more interested in contributions to pay her vet bill than the previous purpose of the campaign... I don't know how much it will be yet, but I think her health is more important than anything else. I will use the money from the campaign to pay the bill since I'm a student and the bill will most likely be a bit hard on my economy. =\ I've changed the goal for this Indiegogo campaign due to my new situation. 

My cat, Nefertiti (or Neffie) started bleeding from her right ear the other night and so I visited the veterinary with her today 7/11 - 14. Her ear is heavily infected and they also found an outgrowth in her ear, which might be a tumour. So she will be put on medication for 2 weeks and then we will revisit the vet. First visit cost about 230$
Update: She was put on medication for 2 weeks and the infection is now gone, but the outgrowth is still there. This outgrowth is blocking he ear canal which means they need to remove it... Surgery is expensive so any help is appreciated. I have no idea exactly what the final bill will be at, but I do know that surgery on animals is very expensive. If we're lucky they can simply remove it, if we're unlucky it might be rooted inside of her (cancer) :/
Update 3/12: We have visited the animal hospital twice now. First for a biopsy and CT and since they had a time slot available for surgery the day after (cheaper for me) they have now also performed the surgery. They think the outgrowth in her ear is a polyp, which is removable, and it was rooted only in the outer ear which lead to an easier procedure than if it had been rooted further in. She will now eat pills for 20 days and next week we will do a check up on her wound. Final cost seems to be around 730$ 
Update 15/12: Nefertiti's wound from the surgery is healing up perfectly and everything is paid and done. We still don't know exactly what it was in her ear and hope to get specific answers any day now. THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!
Pic from our visit at the veterinary before they investigated her:

 After the veterinary, she is very very close all the time because the cone makes her feel weak :P

All prints are ordered once a payment is received and will be dispatched asap.

To check all available prints, you can go to: http://kyawolfwritten.deviantart.com/ or https://www.facebook.com/KyaWolfwritten

Some of all available prints are seen in the gallery here on Indiegogo too.

Thank you in advance!

All Love

Kya

story:
Summary / Kurzbeschreibung

This is about the second Hot Rod Yearbook. 

In 2001, Flying Piston Studios Berlin created Smokin´ Shutdown Magazine. At the time, the Hot Rod and Kustom Kulture scene were non-existent - much less a magazine.

But there were plenty of enthusiasts, handy-men who devoted their time transforming cars into Hot Rod and Kustom Cars. Over the past 14 years, more than 35 editions of our magazine have captured the fascination that these folks exude.

Last year, the first Hot Rod Yearbook was published. As a steady part of the scene, we are not writing about it - we are writing from its core. We are in love with old engines with carburators, cars that are 70 to 80 years old - yet state of the art.
Whether their owners fix up the speed of a car or appearance for the show, they all have one thing in common: they want it to be as unique, and as personal as possible.

Our times are of constant change, of inconstancy, the internet, and superficiality. With our publication, we have been trying to counteract this trend. To enjoy our book, you need no USB-slot - and not even power! We simply love the high-quality paper, the breathtaking shots by photographers from all over Europe, and the stories that come with each car.

With its 1,6 kg, the first Hot Rod Yearbook felt great in your hand. A limited edition of 666 pieces, it is NOT available forever and in abundance - analog qualities that we long for…

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Es geht um das zweite Hot Rod Yearbook.
2001 wurde von den Flying Piston Studios Berlin das Magazin Smokin’ Shutdown ins Leben gerufen. Zu dieser Zeit gab es keine Hot Rod Szene, keine Kustom Kulture Szene, ein Magazin schon gar nicht. Allerdings gab es genug Enthusiasten, die sich mit handwerklichem Geschick daran machten, Autos zu Hot Rod und Kustom Cars umzubauen. In den letzten 14 Jahren haben wir in über 35 Ausgaben des Magazins die Faszination, die von diesen Leuten ausgeht, eingefangen.

Letztes Jahr entschlossen wir uns, das erste Hot Rod Yearbook herauszugeben. Wir berichten nicht über eine Szene, sondern – weil wir fester Bestandteil dieser Szene sind – aus ihr heraus. Wir lieben alte Motoren mit Vergasern, Autos die teilweise 70-80 Jahre alt sind und dennoch State of the Art. Ob die Besitzer nun ihre Energie in die Geschwindigkeit ihres Autos stecken oder in den Showzustand, alle haben gemeinsam, daß sie es so individuell und persönlich wie nur möglich haben wollen.

Wir leben in einer Zeit schneller Veränderungen, des Inkonstanten, des Internets, des Oberflächlichen. Unsere Publikation trat von Anfang an diesem Trend entgegen. Wir benötigen weder einen USB-Anschluß noch Strom, um uns unser Buch anzusehen. Wir lieben das bedruckte Papier, die unglaublich schönen Fotos von Fotografen aus ganz Europa und die Geschichten, die zu den Autos erzählt werden.

Das erste Hot Rod Yearbook wog 1,6 kg und lag außerordentlich gut in der Hand. Entgegen den Gewohnheiten unserer Zeit steht es mit einer limitierten Auflage von 666 Stück nicht immer und überall zur Verfügung. Eigenschaften, die unseren analogen Sehnsüchten ganz nahe sind.

What you can give - and what you get for it /

Was du uns gibst & was du bekommst 

Berlin is the centre of our work and life, and will be where we would like to print the book. 

In the last one-and-a-half decades, Flying Piston Studios has pre-financed each single run of the magazine. This requires further distribution, ads and bookkeeping and raises the final prize of the publication.

Those costs can be and will be lowered through crowd funding. We provide merely 10 pages of the magazine out of pocket, which equals 4% at a total of 249 pages.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Da wir in Berlin arbeiten und leben, möchten wir das Buch, wie das vorige auch, in Berlin drucken. Mit sehr wenig Werbung im Magazin finanzierten die Flying Piston Studios Berlin in den letzten anderthalb Jahrzehnten jedes Smokin‘ Shutdown vor. Das bedarf im Nachgang Vertrieb, Werbung und Buchhaltung, was wiederum den Endpreis der Publikation anhebt.

Mit Crowdfunding wollen und können wir diese Kosten senken. Wir stellen lediglich 10 Seiten des Magazins für Werbung zur Verfügung, was bei 249 Seiten nur ca. 4% ausmacht.

The Results / Die Folgen

We believe we´re not the only ones who appreciate high-quality print publications. Just like the first one, the Second Hot Rod Yearbook is being produced by aficionados, Hot Rodders, photographers and Kustomizers from all over Europe.
We posses the know-how, the experience and technical means - but most of all: we love the product.

Up until the pre-pressing, everything comes from one hand.

Crowd-funding involves many people. At the end, not everyone may be the proud owner of a book - but your involvement in the production process will remain unique!

The second year book, exceptional in its own way, promises wonderful photos of Hot Rods, Hot Rod races and their stories.

Maybe there are enough folks that simply want to pour a drink, light a cigar, lean back and lose themselves in another world with our book in their hands? Others are simply looking for an Easter present - who knows? Right here, we have the opportunity to make it happen together!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Wir glauben daran, daß nicht nur wir auf qualitativ hochwertige Druckerzeugnisse stehen. Auch das zweite Hot Rod Yearbook wird wieder von Enthusiasten, Fotografen, Hot Roddern und Kustomizern aus ganz Europa gemacht werden. Wir haben die Erfahrung, die technischen Mittel und vor allem Freude an diesem Produkt. Bis zur Druckvorstufe kommt alles aus einer Hand.

Crowdfunding heißt auch, viele Leute zu bewegen, wahrscheinlich werden nicht alle Menschen, die uns unterstützen, am Ende eines der Bücher besitzen. Aber daß es da ein Buch gibt, das man mitfinanziert hat, in dieser Qualität, das bleibt einzigartig.
Auch das zweite Hot Rod Yearbook wird wieder wundervolle Fotostrecken von Hot Rods, Hot Rod Rennen und die dazugehörigen Geschichten beinhalten. Gedruckt in dieser Form außergewöhnlich.

Vielleicht gibt es auch genug Leute, die sich einfach ‘n Drink einschenken und ‘ne Zigarette anzünden wollen, die sich zurücklehnen, das Buch in die Hand nehmen und in einer anderen Welt versinken wollen. Andere suchen möglicherweise nur ein Ostergeschenk, wer weiß das schon. Hier haben wir die Möglichkeit dieses Projekt gemeinsam zu realisieren!

Risks and Challenges / 

Risiken & Herausforderungen

Print of the second Hot Rod Yearbook. Hardcover, Landscape (A4), 249 pages or more. Texts in German and English. One book is prized at 49 €. Release date is early March 2015.

The current costs to produce a run of 666 p are at 15500 €. If we raise more money, there won´t be more books, but more pages! At a sum of 17000 €, we can print 280 pages. At 18500 €, we´re talking 312 pages - beyond the 18500 € mark, the yearbook will have an incredible 344 pages!

The idea of publishing a book with 344 pages makes me tear up from joy! The mail man will probably break into a sweat upon delivery.

In case we can not reach out crowd-funding goals, each supporter will naturally get his or her money back.

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wir drucken das zweite Hot Rod Yearbook. Hardcover, Landscape (A4 Querformat). 249 Seiten oder mehr. Texte in Deutsch und Englisch.  Der Kostenpunkt für ein Exemplar liegt bei 49 Euro.
Veröffentlichungstermin ist Anfang März 2015.

Aktuell liegen die Herstellungskosten bei 15500€.  Wird das Buch überfinanziert, steigt nicht etwa die Anzahl der Bücher, sondern die der Seiten:  Bei einer Summe von 17000€ können wir 280 Seiten drucken. Erreichen wir 18500€ werden es 312 Seiten. Sollten wir die 18500€ Marke knacken, gibt es ein Yearbook mit unglaublichen 344 Seiten. 

Die Vorstellung, ein Buch mit 344 Seiten zu veröffentlichen, treibt mir vor Freude die Tränen in die Augen. Dem Postboten wahrscheinlich den Angstschweiß auf die Stirn - bei der Auslieferung.

Sollten wir unser Crowdfundingziel nicht erreichen können, bekommt natürlich jeder Unterstützer sein Geld zurück. 

Other ways in wich you could help / 

Andere Wege, wie man helfen kann

If crowd-funding is not a possibility for you, you could still help by promoting us: tell your friends and acquaintances about us, use the links on the website, share and like the campaign on Facebook.

Spread the word!

A BIG THANK YOU TO ALL SUPPORTERS!

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Wer dieses Crowdfunding finanziell nicht unterstützen kann, aber für uns die Werbetrommel rühren möchte - erzählt Euren Freunden und Bekannten von uns, nutzt die Links auf der Webseite und Liked - teilt auf Facebook.

Spread the word!

VIELEN DANK AN ALLE UNTERSTÜTZER!

story:
I am an avid photographer trying to build a career, i am currently starting out with Cemeteries which is my passion. 

I am creating a 3 photo book series.  20 Pages each.  Each book will have a different theme.  Pure Black and White, Full Color and Horror Edition (Heavily edited graveyard photos).  Funding will go mainly to photography equipment, making the book and prints.   All Books and Prints will be signed.  
We are now also using this campaign to fund our webshow which will essentially be a Road show were we film the drive up to each location and do a walkthrough of the cemeteries!
Perks that offer prints or merchandise will be shipped out first, book will take a couple months to ship.
- Visit me at http://www.facebook.com/cemeteryshots

story:
Welcome!

Thanks for taking a look at my project. Let me tell you a little bit about me first.

  • I'm a stay at home mom, working on expanding my photography career.
  • Photography has always been in my life, and is my true artistic passion.
  • Telling a story with pictures is what I love
  • I am a recent addition to the RAW artists showcase!

This book showcases the remains of trees that have stood tall for decades but are now nothing more than decaying skeletons of their past selves. 

I am passionate about my photography, particularly in landscapes. This book is just a sample of the work I do. By creating this campaign, I aim to grow as an artist and business woman. Ideally, not only will this help me, but it will also give you, the contributor, something tangible to enjoy for many years. I take pride in my art, and I want to be able to expand and share it in a much larger way.

What I'm hoping for.

Here's what I am wanting to accomplish with this campaign.

  • Gather funds to upgrade my gear and publish an 11" x 8.5" hard cover coffee table book as well as an e-book.
  • Provide each person who contributes at minimum a signed print.
  • Fans to help me build my career and make my dreams come true!

More

A portion of the proceeds of this campaign will be donated to the Arbor Day Foundation. 

Please share on your social media sites. I am a driven, goal oriented gal who just needs a boost. 

For current news, make sure to check the updates!

story:
• My name is Dan and I started The Red Stapler Cosplay Project in April of 2014 at WonderCon. Since then I (and a few close friends) have been at 13 different conventions this year.
  • The goal of this fundraiser is to raise money so we can get better camera equipment and bring the project to a convention near you. 
  • The money we raise will go to getting better camera equipment, and to afford the conventions in 2015. 
  • We understand that not everyone can donate or help, but by sharing this, or sharing our page(s) is help as well. 
  • We aren't asking for a lot, any amount (even $5) helps.

story:
Short Summary

I’m Joe, a filmmaker & photographer and I’m fascinated by the intersection of colour and culture. My photography is rooted in travel and the spontaneity of the open road.

By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping to support my work as an independent artist, enabling me to produce a run of prints. All the profits from this campaign will help fund a short documentary about a unique organisation empowering young refugees.

 

What You Get

The Prints: These are professionally produced real photographic archival prints on fuji crystal archive paper in a matt finish. Each print will be signed on the white border beneath the image or on the photograph if desired. *Please email joe@almondvisuals.com with the name of your chosen print / digital download  after backing.*

The Frames: These are 16 x 21.5” glass fronted, wooden frames (made from responsibly sourced, Forest Friendly timber.) Prints will be framed in a custom cut smooth white mount with corner inserts allowing for damage-free removal of the original print.

Each framed print will be signed on the white border beneath the image (concealed by the mount) Or, If desired, the mount can be signed so that the signature is visible, once framed.

*Please note frames can only be delivered in the London and Surrey area*

The Digital Files: These are high resolution images, enabling backers to self print the photograph. All digital files are copyright-protected and are for the sole use of the backer to print a copy for themselves only. It is illegal to produce or distribute unauthorised copies without my written consent.

 

Why you should support me

By backing this campaign, you will be helping to support my work as an independent artist. All of the profits from this campaign will help fund a short documentary about an organisation empowering young refugees. I will keep backers updated with details and announcements about the documentary shortly after all the prints have been received.

As a backer you will of course receive some new artwork for your house / apartment / room !

 

Risks & Challenges

The most secure option for international backers, is to opt for the digital file, however 8x10" signed prints can be shipped worldwide.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to support this campaign as a backer, your help would be greatly appreciated by sharing this with friends, family, work colleagues etc. Thank you ! 

 

Print names for reference

When choosing a perk, please state the name of the print / file you would like using the names below for reference ( the names are shown beneath each print ). Names can also be seen in the second video at the top of the page - 'Print names'. *Please email joe@almondvisuals.com with the name of your chosen print / digital download  after backing the campaign.*

story:
Chicago, Philly, Portland, LA & Kansas City Dates are now open!

The 4th Trimester Bodies Project is an ongoing photo documentary created by Chicago photographer and mother of three, Ashlee Wells Jackson. This project is dedicated to embracing the beauty inherent in the changes brought to our bodies by motherhood, childbirth and breastfeeding.

What started as a passion project for Ashlee to learn to accept the physical aftermath of a traumatic pregnancy and birth experience has become a platform to encourage all mothers to love and accept the stretches, scars and stripes that come from bearing and raising our little loves. 

We are currently photographing women in and around the Chicago area and hope to soon travel to additional cities in order to include a larger and more diverse group of women. The end goal of this project is a community website, gallery show and ultimately, a published book of collected stories and captured photographs. 

We hope to change the way women look at their physical selves postpartum and by supporting this project you're helping us do just that. 

We need to raise a bare minimum of $35k to make this whole project a reality.We will be traveling across the country to capture women in their best light (with no post processing other than color adjustments). Here is a brief breakdown of costs:

1. Travel, studio rentals, assistants, hair and make up artists and transporting gear all require funding.

2. We will be self publishing the final product which requires a significant budget.

3. It costs money to edit, copyedit, typeset, and design a book—even before you actually print and ship the copies—and photography books require the right kind of paperstock and printing expertise to show the photos in their best light.

By asking you to buy your copy or copies before they're printed, we not only make sure we don't waste paper by printing exactly the number we need, but we save money.

If we don't meet our funding we will have to cancel the travel portion of this project. However, if we meet or exceed our budget any additional funding will allow us to expand our travel schedule including even more women in the project. We will be able to print more books and invest even more money in our beautiful community. 

We’re offering many ways in which you can invest in this project. Have a look and thanks so much for taking part!

Not able to fund this project at the moment but want to help anyway? Please share this campaign widely. Let every parent, woman, grandmother, aunt and compassionate person you know about this exciting project. Help us make some noise!

If you'd like to participate please email us! 4thTrimesterBodies@gmail.com

story:
All perks was send. Thank You for supporting!


Photobooks and postcards are printed

All photobooks and postcards were printed last week. Now shipping from Ukraine is impossible, but we think that few days later situation will changed.


Short summary

There left a few days to finish of the campaign and likely I will not reach my entire goal. That’s why less copies will be printed. All funders will receive their books and postcards by the end of February 2014. Thank You all for your contributions.

About Revolution

Peaceful protests in Ukraine started on Nov. 21 when government backed away from a political agreement with the European Union. Protests against the government’s decision were held in several Ukrainian cities. After a violent crackdown by security forces on peaceful rally in Independence Square, the central plaza in Kiev, on Nov. 30 hundreds of thousands ukrainians joined a rally and occupied Independence Square, setting up barricades and established a tent city. Now people demand impeachment of the president and dismissal of the government.

On Dec. 11 security forces again stormed Independence Square, but the demonstrators faced down armored officers. Now peaceful revolution in Ukraine continued for 4th week and the demonstrators ready to protest as long as necessary.


About Project

I am Maria Donenko, a Kiev based photographer. From the beginning of the Revolution I spent 24 days in Independence Square and took more than 4000 photos. I like to accomplish the photography book "Ukraine: Revolutionary Chronicle" and need your help. 

I hope to raise 7000$ by crowdfunding for excellent color correction, professional printing and binding of 100 copies. Anything raised over this amount will go into expanding the edition. If I don't reach my entire goal, less copies will be printed. 

The book and postcards will be shipped by the end of February 2014. Shipping is included world wide.


Other Ways You Can Help

If You can't contribute "Ukraine: Revolutionary Chronicle", that doesn't mean you still can't help. It would be just as helpful to share this project with friends or family. You can share this project through Facebook, Twitter, emails and phone calls.

Dec. 10, evening. 14 °F. Security forces and protesters warm themselves near a fire. A few hours later security forces stormed Independence Square.


Evening in the protest camp. 12 °F. 


Field kitchen in the protest camp. Volunteers prepare meals for the protesters.


Protesters toppled a statue of Soviet state founder Vladimir Lenin.


Armored special forces near the Presidential Administration building.

story:
The Important Story

Get published without any money is not so easy in these days. In Czech Republic does not exist publishers or organisations supporting young (and not so well-known) photographers in making books. Also to get a grant to self-publish a book is almost impossible without back up of any big organisation. Due to this I decided to self-publish the Disturbation photos.


The Disturbation is shot on middle format analogue camera so the whole project is quite expensive. The amount of money I was able to give to the project is a half of full price. I need your help with another half to realised the remaining photos and to make a book.


More about my plans and visions available in MULL IT OVER interview.


Artist statement for Disturbation

In the recent series I retell in pictures several stories that should never be seen. The photos capture different people during various intimate situations in a "caught in the act" way. It made us unwanted spectators of strange rituals and obscure moments as simply everyday routine. Because it is. But 'disturbation' is not artless opening of locked or semi-closed doors to children's rooms, toilets or massage salons. Forget voyeurism and fetishism cliché. These photos aspire to reflect not just actual social issues. Politics, pop icons, pope... Therefore to speak only about intimacy as an act is deficient. It is also about what people hide inside themselves. In their inner space full of opinions, attitudes, thoughts, dreams and taste. It represent a study of privacy. Because privacy is where the most of the global problems rise from. Undercover, unobtrusively. That's why 'disturbation' is here. To think about this fact. 

Although most of the visual stories are mockumentary or reconstruction of true and sometimes false memories, the rest remains truly authentic.

The final collection will be presented as a book and exhibition in the first half of 2012.


View the already published photos of Disturbation on MY SITE. 


The Impact

With your help I'm going to complete the collection of photos and make a serious photo publication that will support the exhibition in the first half of 2012. It will help to spread the concept in physicl way to the wide audience and represent the state of contemporary photography in photo/book fairs and shops. The money earned from retail will help to finance the other projects of mine.


What We Need

I need 8900$ to finish the project. Yea, it's a lot. But I want to make it the best I can. The best for you all who help me make it happened. I need to create shots that are still only in my mind and then bind it all together in a beautiful book. To get the world know about it. I already have printing works which will produce the book only for printing expenses what make me convinced that I we can do it.


Different Ways of Help

If you know any publishers, photo associations or competitions (suiting the project) that may help us in this difficult journey, please let us know and get the word out. Thank you! Thank you! Thank you!
