story:
Project Background

Photography is an avenue for learning about the planet around you.
For as long as I have been a photographer, I have made the study and photography of liquids my passion.
This type of photography has taught me more than I could have imagined about light, fluid physics, water and how we see the world infront of us.
This book is the culmination of all my liquid photography projects. I want to share the beauty of these rare moments, in a book that will last a lifetime.

 

Details

The book is currently set to the following:

Product: Coil Bound Book
Coil colour: Black
Number of pages: 60
Size: A4
Colour/BW: Colour
Inside Pages: 115gsm Gloss
Cover thickness: 300gsm
Cover finish: Gloss
Portrait/landscape: Landscape

The book will contain the finest specimens of my liquid photographs, and will have some beautiful quotes to go along with them.
 

Why Water?

Water: Natures Miracle, life giving, makes up over 50% of our bodies, and stunning to look at under these circumstances.

Using a studio setup, an old paint tray, and some fresh water, you can produce an image which sparks your imagination and seems so magical.

Sitting in an uncomfortable position, waiting to capture that moment might make some of you think I am a little crazy.
Personally I think it all pays off in the end, when you can produce something so awesome to look at.

Quality

The book will be created by one of the UK's leading book printers, on high quality paper to really make my images pop.
 

The Impact

I need the funds to publish the book, and without your support it simply can't happen.
By purchasing a copy of the book through this IndieGoGo campaign, you will help in the book's creation, and helping an aspiring artist to get his work out there!
I will need to apply for an ISBN (so I can retail them in shops) and get a barcode created, that runs at around £75-100, so I really do need every penny.

Without your help, all I can do is offer scattered images throughout the internet, this will make it possible to show it to a whole new audience.
I would love to have this published and in every library out there, on every coffee table, having people enjoy the work I strive so hard to create. 

Extra Perks

1080p Resolution Desktop Wallpapers: A selection of some of my favourite images, processed into a 1080p format ready for any monitor or desktop.

A signed print of one of my photos: Never know, it could be worth alot of money in the future :P.
 

Stretch Goals

If I receive more than the £750 in funding for my project, there are a few enhancements I'd like to do to the final product.

Perhaps hire a layout designer to improve the composition on each page, aswell as additional pages to host even more content and images.
I would LOVE to produce more copies as well, the more funding I get, the more I can order, getting an even bigger discount.
It would allow me to offer the book at major retail locations, and give copies away to libraries.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out! Share this campaign with everyone - at the very least they'll enjoy the liquid images.
Spreading the message for this campaign is integral to its success, and I appreciate every little bit of help you can offer!

This book is the culmination of all my liquid photography projects. I want to share the beauty of these rare moments, in a book that will last a lifetime.

story:
Capturing an image through the viewfinder isn't always easy as there are technical details that you have to take notice of, for example shutter speed, ISO and etc. This is the problem to many new photographers out there who are eager to press the shutter button and not sure where to start.


The book titled "Snap Fig" will be a full 100 over colour pages featuring many figurines such as Senjougahara, Miku and many more.

This book will provide all the technical details of a photo, see how individual photographer treat their shots with mood and tone. It is also to showcase their hard work and commitment that they have put into every single photos that they have taken.

Combining the love of anime and Japanese pop culture, this book will mainly focus on taking miniature stuff, which in this case, anime figurines.

In this book, there will be detailed explanation on how photographers light up their subjects in the most creative way possible. How the background of each photo blend in with the figurine characters. 

There are also some crazy yet experimental shots in this book too!

Other than providing technical details and detailed explanation, there is also behind the scene shot of how the picture is taken. This is to give an idea to reader and description where they can relate to. 

Sakura Doujin has been around as a blogging website about anime and Japanese pop culture since 2012. Based in Singapore, we have slowly grown over the past two years. Recently, we have start up publishing book like these to engage our audience both anime and non-anime enthusiast  

The money will go to printing the book, posters and photos. We ensure the best and highest book quality since it will be printed in Singapore, where we are based. Remaining amount of money will go into shipping charges,  

For $20, you will get.




For $40, you will get.


For $60, you will get.


For $70, you will get.


For $250, you will get.

This project isn't easy. We have to collaborate with photographers around the world. So the logistic are hard to handle. Along the way, we made quite a lot of mishap and since this is our first project, we take this as a learning point. Is there any profit gain from this project?

  • No. There is not a single profit gain from this project. Due to copyright issue of the figurines, we should not gain a single cent on this project. After all, we are doing it as a cause. To engage new and young photographer who loves Anime and Japanese culture together.  In fact, we have to fork out additional cost for shipping charges and taxes.

Are there any shipping charges apply and how long will it take for it to arrive?

  • Shipping charges are already included into the perks. Please do note that the shipping cost in Singapore is very expensive and therefore, we subside some cost of it. Your product may take between 2 to 3 weeks to arrive.
  • The items will be wrapped around in thick bubble wrap to ensure that there will be protection and no damage in the process of shipping.

Do you ship everywhere?

  • Yes. We ship everywhere around the world. Except for Antarctica and Greenland.

What will happen if the goal isn't reached?

  • As since this is a flexible funding, if the goal isn't reached, we will then used whatever funding that we have. All contributors will get their goods based on the selected perks. 

What are the T-shirt size available?

A = Length of the shirt. B = Height of the shirt. C = Length of the shirt from Shoulder to Neck.

How will the book quality be like?

  • The book binding will be perfect bound cover where it is always scored on back and front, for ease of opening and less stress on spine. The book pages will be around 150gsm and above. Do also take note that the book is soft cover and the dimension is around 210mm by 210mm

Will you be releasing this book elsewhere after this crowd funding project?

  • No. The book will not be released elsewhere. 

If you have any question, do feel free to contact us at sakura.doujin@gmail.com and we will get back to you shortly.

story:
The University of Massachusetts Dartmouth class of 2015 BFA photography majors welcome you and wish for your support! Over the past four to five years, the 13 of us have been hard at work with various different projects and learning the craft of photography. On May 14, we will be hanging each of our senior thesis' in Gallery X of New Bedford, MA, and we would appreaciate all the help we can get!

There's a lot that goes into preparing and curating a photography exhibit, and that's where we are asking for your help. We have held a handful of bake sales in the hopes of raising enough money to rent the space for the show, and now need to begin thinking about what we can do for ourselves and our guests. Not only do we need to print advertisements for the show and mount and/or frame our work, we would also enjoy having refreshments for all of you. That's right, we're inviting any and all of you to our show! 

Any donation amount would be of great service to us, and we hope that you will help contribute to our diverse group of students who are working their hardest to prepare an amazing show for all of us to enjoy. So please, help us with our cause, and don't forget to share our Indiegogo to your friends and family as well!

story:
I have worked in senior living for 11 years working with families and their loved ones with dementia/Alzheimer's.  I think that all this experience was preparing me to care for my mom during her dementia journey.

By supporting my campaign, I can take my passion (photography) and turn it into a business designing t-shirts.  Not only will this allow me to have time to care for my mom, and provide an income for me, but my long-term goal is to create designs and themes so I can donate a portion to worthy causes, such as animal rescues and the environment.  

The funds will go to purchasing t-shirts for my first 3 designs, creative software, and website for the order processing, payment, and fulfillment.  And this is very recent, but now I have to buy a new camera because mine was broken three days ago!

If I don't reach my goal, I will just start with one design initially instead of the three.

This goes much deeper than just a way to make money.  I know most people don't have the luxury to spend the twilight years with their parent(s) so to be able to have this time with my mom, will be a blessing.  And then if the sales of my t-shirts can benefit other causes, what a gift!

story:
Short Summary

I will be organizing a photographic workshop for a group of young local people involved in digital and internet media distribution focusing on political and social aspect of Saharawi people living in refugee camps in Algeria. 

This project is a continuation of the previous one which was photographing and creating my first photographic book “40/the place which does not exist” about situation in the refugee camps in Algeria. Saharawi people have waited 40 years to return to their homeland of Western Sahara. A land occupied by Moroccans. Here is the latest BBC report: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-africa-38717078

This project for me is the next step. The idea of making photographic workshop was in my mind from the time when I left camps while taking photos for the book. I want to support these young people and share all the knowledge I’ve got about photography because I believe that communicating about the situation of Saharawi people is extremely important especially for a young generation --  gives them hope that their voice still can be heard. If not the only solution for them to would be to go for a war. By organising this workshop I want to support non war solution.  

The group of young local people I will be working with is already very seriously engaged with information distribution about the situation of the Saharawi people. They focus on english speaking audience as the situation from that region (Western Sahara) is relatively unknown among english speaking countries. 

The workshop will take place in Smara refugee camp close to Tindouf from 28 of February to 8 of March 2017. 

What I Need & What You Get

This is non profit project and I am looking for people who could contribute to the costs of return flights from London to Tindouf in Algeria and also could help me to cover costs of accommodation when living in the camps. I need approximately £500 for the tickets and transportation and £300 to cover costs of living and accommodation.   In return I can offer prints and may photo book from the last trip to the camps. I enclose the selection of the images as well as the link to on line presentation of the book. http://www.tomasz-laczny.com/3126755-publications#1

The Impact

My aim is to trigger the development of the photographic skills of the participants which are already involved in digital distribution of the visual and written information about the situation in the camps and occupied territories of Western Sahara to the world.  I would like to develop their following skills: shooting, editing, storytelling using visual language, post production as well as more abstract understanding of the of the visual language eg composition, framing, negative space. I believe that the participants will use gained knowledge in real life shooting situation.

The outcome of the workshop will be shown as a slideshow during opening exhibition The Best German Photobook 2016 on 11 of March at Forum fur Fotografie Gallery in Cologne. The opening will start at 16.00 the address of the gallery:  

Forum für Fotografie

Schönhauser Str. 8
50968 Köln

http://www.forum-fotografie.info

I will also post the slideshow on my webpage. http://www.tomasz-laczny.com

Other Ways You Can Help

If you think that this project is important but cannot contribute financially I would really aprecieate if you could tell your friends about it.

story:
Rough Edits - https://www.facebook.com/media/set/?set=a.51899...

Video - http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r_fJjBkSpYI

Tears


My name is Jackson Cox, and I own Coffee Boy Photography. I've been doing photography and film for 6 years, since I was 14, and professionally for around a year now. The Tears project started with a Facebook message to Karen Lis, the owner of Icon makeup school asking whether her students might be interested in participating in a creative project. The response was overwhelming. 7 make up artists and over 30 models later, 'Tears' was finally finished... but I don't plan to stop here.


I want to get this project onto canvas and into an art gallery for public exhibition, but being the epitome of the starving artist, I cannot afford to do this and eat as well. If all goes well, this will be my first exhibition and definitely not the last.


We are based in Newcastle and would love to see more projects like this here, it is often the hurdle of funding that many fall over and I don't wish to be one of those people this time. So I'm coming to you guys asking for $2000 to get them printed onto canvas, and to hire a space in a gallery.


If you can't help out with pledges, please share amongst your friends and let them know what's going on. The more publicity we can get for this project the better.


You can check out the rough edits of the project here, it will be updated daily with new photos. Once they are all up, the finished versions will come out followed by the finalised compilation. 


There will be 5 canvases with 6 portraits on each, just to clarify.


Thankyou everyone for your support.

Jackson Cox - Coffee Boy Photography

story:
Short Summary

It took me almost 25 years to discover my passion in life: Photography.  It took a couple of thieves 2 minutes to take that all away from me:

  • My name is Garret Ward.  I am an up and coming photographer in the greater Hartford area specializing in weddings and real estate.  In my free time I enjoy shooting landscapes.
  • This campaign is to help re-fund my passion after I had all of my camera gear stolen after a break in to my hotel room on 8/29/14 (2 camera body's, 6 lenses, 2 flashes, multiple memory cards/filters/etc).  With insurance not covering "professional" gear, and the hotel showing absolutely no sign of helping I am looking for assistance from my community.  A couple bad eggs tried to knock me down.  Now I am looking for the good ones to help pick me back up.
  • It's taken me two years of working hard and saving to get here.  Now I'm faced with having to start over.
  • Not only will this provide me the means to replenish the gear that was stolen from me, it will also stand to show that good triumphs over evil.

What We Need & What You Get

  • My goal is to raise $6,755.  If we meet this goal, Indiegogo takes 4% which leaves me with roughly $6,485 (the total amount of gear stolen was over $6,500).
  • To show my appreciation for your donations you'll receive photo prints, canvas prints, and even your very own photo session!
  • If you want to choose which landscape print(s) you receive, check out the gallery tab (You can see a small sample of my wedding and engagement work there too) and send me an email at gward2588@gmail.com or send me a facebook message after selecting your perk and let me know which one(s) you'd like.
  • All perks will be distributed once the campaign is completed.
  • If we don't reach the goal of $6,755, Indiegogo will take 9% (as opposed to 4%) of the total contribution.  Whatever amount is raised will still go towards replenishing my photography gear.

The Impact

  • Not only will this help me bounce back after the horrendous violation that occurred, it will also leave me forever grateful to all of you who contribute.
  • I have never done a crowd sourcing campaign like this before.  Those of you who know me know that I'm not one to ask for money but this is no ordinary situation.  I need your help.

Risks & Challenges

I've set the bar pretty high and there's only 45 days to reach the goal.  This, in and of itself, will be a huge challenge.

  • Making sure people stay engaged will also be a challenge.
  • I'm hoping that my incentives and your knowledge that you're helping a local small business battle through adversity will be enough to overcome these challenges.  If not, I'll have to step my game up!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Share my story with your friends on social media.
  • Check out my facebook page at www.facebook.com/garretwardphotography
  • Spread the word!

Not only will this help me bounce back after the horrendous violation that occurred, it will also leave me forever grateful to all of you who contribute. I have never done a crowd sourcing campaign like this before.  Those of you who know me know that I'm not one to ask for money but this is no ordinary situation.  I need your help.
 
  Risks & Challenges  I've set the bar pretty high and there's only 45 days to reach the goal.  This, in and of itself, will be a huge challenge. 
Making sure people stay engaged will also be a challenge. I'm hoping that my incentives and your knowledge that you're helping a local small business battle through adversity will be enough to overcome these challenges.  If not, I'll have to step my game up! 
  Other Ways You Can Help I understand some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help: 
Please get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
Share my story with your friends on social media.
Check out my facebook page at www.facebook.com/garretwardphotography
 Spread the word!

story:
What we're doing

My friend and I are travling the country for one month during the summer. We plan on going down the east coast, across the south, up the west, and across the north. We have a lot of driving to do, and there's so much of the country that I want to artistically capture with my camera.

 

Who we are

My name is Casey Robertson, and I am a photography student at SUNY New Paltz. I am currently concentrating in photographing Upstate New York. My idea with this trip is to take what I've learned from photographing this smaller area, and using it to my advantage while I photograph the country. You can find my work at www.caseyrobertsonphoto.com

My friend who will be traveling with me is Anthony Raucci. He is a music major, and an amazing assitant who comes with me all the time while I work on my current project: Middle of Nowhere, New York

 

What We Need & What You Get

The money you donate will be going towards:

// 85% of the funds will be going towards the creation and publishing of a book that summarizes the photos I took during our trip. 

// The remainder of the money will help us in our traveling; Gas, food, a place to stay for a night. We plan to keep our expenses to a minumum, which is why we are only using a small portion of the funds to help us personally.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

// While we plan on sleeping in our car at national parks and what not, a place to stay would be more appreciated than we can describe.

// If you can't afford to help with our project, let others know who might be interested!

// Follow our blog as we update the trip in real time via instagram and journal entries! 8000mi.tumblr.com

Short Summary

My name is Carolyne Jackson and I am a photographer.

My campaign aims to help a fellow photographer called Andrew Follows. He has a condition he was born with called retinitis pigmentosa , he is blind and uses his photography to see what sighted people take for granted. 

His website and project details can be found at 


  • http://blinkiephotography.com.au/

He is holding and exhibition at the Edinburgh Arts Festival but will also be in London for the last few days of his trip. He will be giving talks and photowalks to help inspire others.

By giving as much or as little as you can to allow Andrew to stay in London and get assistance. You will be helping those with fragile eyes see the world is not all darkness but can be full of light too.

What We Need 

  • Firstly we need to find Andrew guide dog friendly London Accomodation and help whilst here.
  • We need to sponsor him as much or as little as you can spare
  • If the fund does not reach it's goal the money by Andrew's choice will go to http://www.streetwiseopera.org/

 

Even if you cannot afford to give, please spread the word - thank you :)

story:
Long story short... ;) We are Peter and Anna and we are married for almost 9 years... We live in Slovakia (formerly part of Czechoslovakia) in the heart of Europe. We are common family with 3 children (aged 8, 4 and 2) and we both love travelling and exploring new countries. But it's not easy to take long car trips with small babies ;) After some years we are finally able to take some time for each other, leaving kids at holiday for 2 weeks with their grandma and grandpa. We are going to pack some survival stuff, cameras, good mood and fine music to our car, and hurray ! 

Because of care for children and also for their age, we were not able to go to this kind of trip for a long time. But with time we were also able to save money for our trip, which we both see as another bright point in our lives ;) And we think it is worth to share our experience with the world ;)

Our primary target is to see, and of course to show to you, the France from the point of countryside, smaller towns and villages. We believe, that we can discover different face of France, which is not usually seen in most travelguides. Paris, Versailles, Lourdes, Marseille are crowded by tourists who look for well known sightseeings. We want to explore different values... ;) We look for quiet and peace, not the crowded streets and squares. We want to know people out there, living outside the urbanized areas, listen to them and catch all that beauty by camera in the natural environment.

We start on Monday, 16th of July. We will drive through Austria and Italy to the south-eastern coast of France. From there we will explore southern France from the east coast to the west coast. Then we plan to cross the France from near the Bordeaux (south-west) to the Dijon (north-east) and depending on remaining time, head to the National Park at Lorraine. We don't have exact plan, it will make up itself during our journey. All we want is to have a good time, enjoy the country and see and catch all that beauty by our cameras.

After our return we would like to review photos, select the best and run a website dedicated to photos and stories from the trip to France.

The funds will be used to create and maintain the website with photos and stories from the trip. Of course, you, funders, will recieve valuable art photos and even more.

The amount will be used for:

  • the domain and hosting
  • design 
  • programming the site itself
The rest are the fees (paypal, etc) and for your rewards. All work related to the trip itself, phptographing, managing and editing photos will be done by myself and my wife.

Even with $1 fund, you will receive access to full resolution digital photos, taken during our trip. Every fund contains small part of whole cost which will be used to create and maintain the site, the rest will be used for your reward, starting with the nice postcard and ending with customized photo calendar or even photo puzzle of your choice. We also welcome any suggestion to further forms of rewards ;)

All items for funders, will be delivered to you during August, except of photocards, sent directly from France, which will, I believe, delivered earlier ;)

Shipping worldwide is included. There is no need to pay any extra funds for non-EU funders. The differences between postal fees to EU and the rest of the world, when sending light-weight items like postcards or photos, including calendar or puzzle, is negligible from Europe.

Thank you in advance  for your support, in any amount! We would also like to thank indiegogo.com for realizing such a great idea of supporting art projects!

Peter&Anna

story:
Hello! My name is Laura Cobb. I received a Bachelors of Fine art in photography from the Kansas City Art Institute in 2013.  Since then I have been applying to various juried shows and residencies, as well as other photographic opportunities. 

Recently, I was awarded my first artist in residence at the Ucross Foundation in Wyoming!! I will be photographing the ranch lands and nature, the serene and the quiet qualities of the land, while exploring the connection and discord between humanity and the natural world. I believe if you are willing to listen the land can speak.

 The residency will be about a month long. Lodging will be covered by the foundation, however supplies and travel are not. This is such an amazing opportunity! Being given the time and freedom to focus solely on art is a gift I cannot refuse. However, in order to attend, I had to make some tough decisions, including quitting my job. So, I am trying to raise money to cover expenses relating to attending, such as: gas, 4x5 and 8x10 film and other necessities, like rent and bills while I am gone and until I am working again.

As my way to thank everyone that donates and to show how very much I appreciate every little bit, I am going to be gifting some of my favorite photographs I make at the residency.

For $5, you will have with my gratitude.

For $10, I will mail a postcard sized photograph of my work thanking you for your support.

For $25, I will mail a hand written thank you letter with a series of three postcard-sized photographs of my work.

For $50, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of seven postcard-sized photographs of my work.

For $75, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of five postcard-sized photographs of my work and (1) 8”x10” signed print.

For $100, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of five postcard-sized photographs of my work and (2) 8”x10” signed prints of my work.

For $150, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of five postcard-sized photographs of my work and (1) 11”x14” signed print of my work.

For $300, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of five postcard-sized photographs of my work and a (1) 8”x10” and (2) 11”x14” signed prints of my work.

For $500, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of five postcard-sized photographs of my work and (1) 11”x14” and (1) 16”x20” signed prints of my work.

For $750, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of seven postcard-sized photographs of my work and (2) 11”x14” and (2) 16”x20” signed prints of my work.

­

For $1,000, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of seven postcard-sized photographs of my work and (2) 8”x10”, (2) 11”x14”, (2) 16”x20” signed limited edition prints of my work.

For $2,000, I will mail a handwritten thank you letter, a series of 15 postcard-sized photographs of my work and (4) 8”x10”, (4) 11”x14”, (5) 16x20 signed limited edition prints of my work. I will also drive up to 200 miles to meet you in person to tell you how much I appreciate your support and answer any questions you have about my art.

Gifts will be sent out in December. Your support will allow me to take advantage of this opportunity and follow my dreams. I am familiar with taking risks for my art. In 2015, I traveled over 2 months exploring national parks and other monuments, photographing my surroundings with my large format camera, similar to photographers in the 19th century. It was such a transformative experience and I know this could be as well. Viewing the American landscape through the ground glass of my large format camera gives me a sense of purpose. I know my art can make a difference and influence others to take more interest in the state of our planet. Please help me in my goal to do so.

I know donating is not possible for everyone, however just sharing my campaign on Facebook or other media sites would make the world of difference for me! With your support, we can do it. You can view my past work at laura-cobb.com

Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!

story:
Who we are:

At Staffordshire University, we are preparing to put on our first exhibition in London, to showcase our work in both photography and photojournalism. 

Including such a broad array of subject matter, from documentary and fine art, to high fashion and photo essays, the 22 of us represent such a diverse spectrum of photography.

Graduating in 2014, we hope this work will speak out to the broad creative world, and also to those who may not have seen anything like this before.


What We Need & What You Get:

We need donations towards the running of the photo space in London, as well as transporting the work down from the university in Stoke-On-Trent. Any donation is welcomed, and we hugely appreciate it. 


The Impact

This is such a huge opportunity for many of us, as newly graduated photographers, a chance to exhibit in London is one many professionals dream of. All we need now, is for you just pledge as much as you like to us, to make it real.


Spread the word - Make it loud!

story:
Why Don't You Smile More?

It's a question everyone who experiences depression has probably heard at some point in their lives. We've come a long way in how we treat mental health issues, however either through ignorance or naivety, these hurtful questions can still be asked from time to time.

This is what this project wishes to address. We recruited some models, and told them that they have to smile for five minutes in a darkened room. The results are the images that you see in this series.

With your backing, we will be able to cover the material costs of putting on an exhibition, such as the mounting and printing of the photos, and we appreciate any pennies that we can get. 

The focus of this project is education. We hope to encourage those who live or work with people with mental health to think about the impact of what they say, and to think of more constructive conversations that they can have.

What Your Money Goes Towards

Your donations will go towards the printing costs and cost of hardware necessary for the exhibition. This includes the price of printing fine art prints, a projector for the video installation, and the cost of entertainment and additional costs of the opening night. All money received past our target will be passed onto My Discombobulated Brain as a charitable donation. 

Who Are My Discombobulated Brain?

My Discombobulated Brain are a Cardiff-based charity, who aim to tackle the stigma associated with mental health head on, whilst offering a source of support and education to those who are affected by these issues.

Their aims are :

  • To support young people, their friends and families in their mental health conversation; to help them learn how to speak about how they feel and to provide tools to recognise and approach the topic of mental health
  • To raise awareness about mental health issues, and to help society overcome the stigma attached to mental health
  • To provide insight and GUIDANCE to public and private organisations on their approach to mental health
  • To work with like minded people, charities and businesses to achieve these goals.

A link to their website can be found here.

Risks & Challenges

If we do not reach our goal, we will find cheaper alternatives to ensure that the project will still continue, however it is important to us that the project is executed to the highest standard possible, with the prints being used for other events in the future.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute at this point, please share our campaign, and spread the message on social media and in person so that 'Why don't you smile more?' is a question that no longer needs to be asked.

story:
How are we different?

We are a team of outdoor photographers and professional explorers who believe that photography workshops shouldn't be lame. Our primary aim is to deviate from the well-trodden touristic paths and experience the authentic wilderness. Our groups are limited to 6 participants, as outstanding photography is rarely created in a crowd.

With the support of our professional mountain guides & sailors we travel by yachts, kayaks, ski, dogsleds, horses and small airplanes. But we don't drive vans packed with tripods from one scenic parking lot to another: there are enough people doing that.

Our photo expeditions are already listed and you can join us!


Why do we run this campaign?

At the moment we are preparing two massive expeditions to really distant Polar locations but the expensive field research is still in progress. Hopefully with your support we will be able to complete it in time for the next season and bring photographers to places where no artists have ever photographed before.

Dare to take part in changing the definition of photography workshops forever? Welcome on board!


The Team:

Vlad Donkov – a Polar-obsessed outdoor photographer and climber, known for his several months long expeditions the Arctic wilderness. Armed only with his cameras and a fishing rod, he shoots for clients like HASSELBLAD, Outdoor Photography mag, Berghaus and many others.

Click to check out Vlad's portfolio.

Wojtek Jarosinski – a sailor, kayaker and mountaineer, who happened to be a shrewd lawyer. A rare bird whose day lasts 28 hours. Able to brew coffee in all kinds of conditions. A specialist in expedition planning.

Dominik Bac – an Arctic skipper who has successfully circumnavigated the Northwest Passage, Patagonia, Antarctica and the Americas. His expeditions have been reported in details by National Geographic magazine and numerous other outdoor publications.

Damian Kirilov “Demo” - a professional kayak guide 'haunted' by paddling down whitewater rivers and leading sea kayak expeditions. Raised on the shores of the Danube river, he specialises in bringing people close to wildlife and islands that are inaccessible to the masses.

Jaakko Heikka – an Arctic wilderness guide from Finland, known for his ski and dogsled expeditions to all corners of Scandinavia, Iceland and Greenland. Jaakko is our specialist in terrains that require a wealth of technical knowledge and vast experience to cross safely.

Read more about our constantly growing team here: http://www.verticalshotexpeditions.com/team/


Our Current Expeditions




For more info please visit www.verticalshotexpeditions.com


Prints - Limited & Open Editions

To see all images from this series please visit the 'Stranded Icebergs' gallery


To see all images from this series please visit the "A 'Casual' Inuit Story" gallery


Support & Spread the Word

'Share' is support!

Just scroll up and find the social media buttons below the video and back us up.

Thank you for being brave enough to ignite this workshop revolution by supporting us.

If you have any questions, please message us!

To see all images from this series please visit the "A 'Casual' Inuit Story" gallerySupport & Spread the Word

'Share' is support!Just scroll up and find the social media buttons below the video and back us up.Thank you for being brave enough to ignite this workshop revolution by supporting us.If you have any questions, please message us!

story:
Kehoe Beach


San Luis Reservoir 

Adam Donnelly and I met at the San Francisco Art Institute while pursuing our master’s degrees. Adam was studying photography and I was focusing on sculpture. Our work overlapped in our desire to reimagine the core processes and materials of photography, specifically the method of light refraction and the “container” in which this happens. Adam was building 4X5 pinhole cameras out of books and I was making camera lenses out of salvaged lens elements and surplus optics. We both wanted to do more work outdoors so decided to photograph the beach with a camera made of the beach.


Pescadero Creek


In 2012 we built our first site specific camera in Bodega Head on the California coast out of rocks, mud, seaweed, grass, and a mussel shell that had a small hole in it for the lens. It was just big enough for Adam to fit his arms into and we managed to photograph that looks like a horizon and numerous light leaks. Since then we have built about 20 cameras in many different landscapes and they have grown in size and complexity. Our latest cameras are big enough to crawl into and often multiple chambers to reduce diffracted light from the entrance.

Bodega Head

Diablo Range


In January of 2014 Adam and I were awarded an Artist in Residence at Rayko Photo Center in San Francisco. During this residency we will be making large silver gelatin mural prints from our site specific camera negatives, experimenting with different types of film and building more cameras. The money we raise here will go towards funding a week long trip to the California Coast to build cameras and photograph with them over a few days while they slowly fall apart. Even in the time it takes to photograph we are fighting then cameras disintegration. Capturing this disintegration will show  the process of the camera returning to a pile a rubble and add the dimension of time to our photographs. We will be using a variety of films on this trip, black and white and color 4X5 film, 14x17 x-ray film,  paper negatives, positive paper and instant film. While we have all the film we need for the trip, we don’t have  the enlarging paper for printing the final mural sized images. In order to maximize our time and materials we will be traveling with a mobile darkroom trailer loaned to us from Rayko Photo center. In order to use it we will need to rent a truck to tow the trailer.  This darkroom on wheels will allow us to get the best negatives possible and see the results of the cameras falling apart, since we will have the ability to get instant feedback on our exposures - instead of having to leave the site and return home to develop in a darkroom

Tunitas Beach

www.janeskodavid.com

Adam's Website

story:
The Story

My name is Petra Sith, and I am a photographer from Northern Illinois, in the outskirt suburbs of Chicago. I have been a full time - professional photographer for the past three years, although I have always loved doing it on the side since I was a teenager. Outside of my books, I am a freelance photographer for hire. This project, will be my third book. Like the other projects, "For Unlawful Carnie Knowledge", is a human interest piece, something I really hope others can connect to. The goal of this book, is to see those behind the fun at the fair in a different light. They are often people who we see on the fringe of society, living lives on the road, maybe we even have this romantic idea that they are running form something. I've always had a preconceived notion about them, so I decided I wanted to document the human beings behind the not so average job, that bring joy to so many people across the country.

With your help, I can make this book a reality. The goal is to raise money for travel and expenses to cover the cost of putting this project together. My goal is to travel the American south and southwest over the fall and winter months, and to document different individuals in raw black and white photos, and then ask them how they would like to be heard, what are their hopes and dreams, or what have they experienced on the road.


What We Need & What You Get

The $3000 will cover the cost of gas, lodging, road expenses for myself and an assistant that will be traveling with me, chronicling the journey. This will cover a two to three week time span, either in one session, or broken into two. The pricing will also cover the initial to print set-up for the book, and help for more travel to reach investors, and publishers. If there is any money left over after travel and expense, it will be put toward bulk ordering of the book. Self publishing works best when books are ordered in bulk, due to printing costs. I am working with a small digital publisher on the digital versions of all of my projects.

If the entire goal isn't met, any funds raised will be put towards the trip in the fall, and to cover as much as I can to get the project off the ground.

The Impact

Your donation, will help me achieve another part of my goal and dreams. I hope one day for the world to see my human interest work, and to feel a connection. I want to continue to make people see the world in a different way. We too often forget about others, and to look into the eyes of another human being, and in some way feel their story, especially when we've never thought of them in a certain way, that is what really matters in the world, and brings about more understanding.

I successfully funded my first book, "One Person Rally: I Have Something to Say" through another crowd funding platform, and it truly was an amazing journey. My second project will soon be complete, and chronicles individuals over the age of 60, holding a photo of themselves when they were younger - and then offer advice to that person. I hope for that project to be completed by the end of 2014, and in print. This project, which you will be funding, should be done within the first few months of 2014.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk for this project is how open and receptive my subjects will be, and the corporate back lash of what is now a real corporate industry, the carnival game and ride business. Upon taking these test shots, I had run into some issues with management regarding asking employees any questions, which needed to be approved before hand. I plan on being in contact with several companies to clear this project, and to show them that in no way will this book hurt their industry. It is not about naming companies, it is about the individuals that help their corporation thrive. This may take meetings in person, and some convincing, but I am ready to take on the challenge.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please share this project with your friends and family! I appreciate any help or contribution you can share. It's all another rung on the ladder to help this project take off, and I promise I will make you all proud!


    If this fundraiser is over-funded, and we reach over $5,000, all those contributing over $50.00 will receive a signed copy of the book.

story:
INTRODUCTION

My name is Karolina Gembara, I am a photographer, researcher and an educator. 

I want to introduce you to my photobook which I am planning to publish this year together with GOST Books. This work is a result of my decade long difficult relationship with Delhi. 

In 2009 I went to India to learn photography and stayed there for a long time. It was a fascinating journey and I gained a lot of experience but at the same time I felt homesick. At times it was very challenging. My relationship with Delhi was simply one of love and hate. 

I never felt comfortable taking pictures on the street. So I needed to find a visual language - a language that would reflect my abilities but prevent me from simply being an onlooker. I turned to my friends, people I could identify myself with, with whom I could talk. With them I looked for quiet, isolated moments. These moments we shared were precious as the city doesn't offer much peace. 

I moved around a lot, and found it hard to establish a home, a place I would feel comfortable in. Many people I met shared the same feelings. Our houses were temporary and even our romantic relationships were somehow superficial. The word that could describe that state of mind and life was “makeshift”.

The pictures I took during those years speak about that craving for comfort in the big city, and the loneliness that accompanied us every day. They also reveal my own need for a home and an attempt to create one. 

MAKING A PHOTOBOOK

After all these years in India, I am back in Poland and putting the story together. I call it 'When we lie down, grasses grow from us' – which is a verse from an Indian poem. 

I have a great opportunity to work with my favorite artists on this book - Rafal Milach, Jörg Colberg who edited the story, and Ania Nałęcka-Milach who designed the book. Finally, GOST Books from London offered to publish my book this year. 

We chose 45 images. Most of the work - scanning and retouching - is already done. The design is subtle and beautiful, like all Ania’s works. 

The book is going to be printed in Italy this July. We need at least 13.000 dollars to produce 500 copies and be able to take the book to all photobook related places, fairs, exhibitions etc. 

SEE DIFFERENT INDIA

This book will not happen without your support. I’m asking you to help me, by buying a copy and seeing India in a way you haven’t seen it before. Quiet, personal and intimate. I hope you can identify yourself with the feelings I am portraying in this book because I believe they accompany us in our everyday life, in every city, wherever we migrate, whenever we try to build comfort around us. 

Please consider purchasing the PERKS I prepared. One tenth of the profit from books will help to build a shelter - a home for animals run by an Indian NGO GPRS where I volunteered. 

JÖRG COLBERG ABOUT THE BOOK

"Photographed over the course of seven years during her stay in India, Karolina Gembara's 'When we lie down…' is a tender meditation on the absence of a home and the desire to find one, possibly in the company of a loved one. Through the combination of quietly beautiful photographs, the book thus hints at one of the largest themes of our lives. With each repeated exposure, new layers are being unveiled as the viewer is invited to partake in the book's quest".

RISKS

We may not be able to raise the full amount of funding required to produce the book. In this case I will not be able to produce the book immediately and risk postponing the project.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP 

If you can't make the contribution, please share this campaign, use social media and help me spread the word about this unique book. 

ABOUT ME

Photographer living and working in Warsaw, based in Delhi in 2009-2016. Member of Sputnik Photos since 2018. 

My interests revolve around issues of home, belonging, migration, changing lands and identities. Recently I also focused on political situation in my home country. I run photography workshops for migrants and refugees in Warsaw. 

Please visit my website for more info: karolinagembara.com

ABOUT GOST BOOKS

Founded in 2013, GOST Books is an independent visual arts and photography publisher based in London. We pride ourselves on an uncategorisable output of diverse subject matter and design: from a chronicle of seven men claiming to be the Messiah; a study of Turkish soap operas; art works inspired by the largest breeding grounds for flamingos in the Southern Hemisphere; archive photographs from the Mexico City police department; to portraits of winners of state-run competitions in Belarus. GOST aims to not only provide a platform for the work of emerging artists but contribute to print legacies of masters in the medium.

story:
7MilaMigliaLontano – Around the world

7milamiglialontano è un viaggio unico, suddiviso in sette tappe diverse per itinerario, partecipanti, tempi e luoghi, ma riunite in un unico intento, un unico scopo: ritrarre l'umanità.
L'idea di questo progetto è di Giuliano Radici, fotografo che da anni organizza sfide nel mondo per dare un aiuto concreto ed originale ad associazioni che sposano cause sociali.

Questo tour supporterà infatti 7 diverse associazioni, una per ogni tappa: Emergency, Cesvi, Centro aiuti per l'Etiopia, Amici della Zizzi, Fondazione Ant, Casa delle donne, Coopi

50 professionisti (fotografi, giornalisti, videomaker) hanno creduto nell'idea e deciso di mettere passione, tempo e impegno per metterla in pratica.

Lo scopo è fornire una mappa unica ed originale dell'umanità concentrandosi in particolare sulle abitudini alimentari dei vari paesi. Alla fine del viaggio verrà realizzato un cofanetto con libro e dvd dove sarà possibile, attraverso immagini e i testi, vedere tutto il mondo.

 “Un viaggio di mille miglia comincia sempre con il primo passo” Lao Tze

 Il viaggio è iniziato a giugno e le prime due tappe sono già andate a buon fine.

Italia – Kazakisthan – team under 25



Kazakisthan-Cina 


Alaska - Panama

Le macchine sono ora arrivate in Alaska e il nostro terzo team sta percorrendo la terza tappa

Potete seguire il viaggio leggendo gli articoli e guardando foto e video sul Facebook 7mml

Sud Africa-Etiopia Etiopia-Milano, due tappe che hanno bisogno di supporto 



“Ciò che non hai mai visto lo trovi dove non sei mai stato” (Detto Africano)

Grazie alla fiducia dei nostri sponsor e all'aiuto di diverse persone siamo riusciti a programmare la maggior parte delle tappe ma le ultime due hanno bisogno del vostro aiuto.

Il viaggio arriverà comunque a Milano, la campagna infatti è Flexible Founding (comunque avrete quello che prenotate) ma sarebbe bello avere a bordo con noi abbastanza persone per completare sereni il progetto.

Dall'esperienza accumulata in altri viaggi stimiamo che le due tappe africane costeranno 16000 euro (solo dogane, permessi, diesel).

Riceverai sicuramente quello che prenoti

Per venire incontro alle esigenze di tutti offriamo pacchetti con diverse cifre. Ci teniamo a sottolineare che anche se non raggiungiamo i 16000 euro comunque il viaggio verrà completato e comunque riceverai quello che hai prenotato che sia una cartolina dall'Africa o il cofanetto completo.

Condividi il viaggio

“I viaggi sono i viaggiatori” (Fernando Pessoa)

Più viaggiatori siamo, anche solo virtuali,  più punti diversi possiamo cogliere. Ci piacerebbe quindi ci seguiste sui nostri social (facebook ed instagram) per poter interagire con noi    

www.7milamiglialontano.com

E anche se non puoi aiutarci con il finanziamento ti saremo comunque grati se tu potessi condividere questa campagna. 

ENG

7milamiglialontano (7 thousand miles afar) is one journey, consisting of seven stages which differ in itinerary, duration and places, but are united in one single intent, one objective: to portray humanity.


The inspiration for this project came to Giuliano Radici, a photographer who has been organizing challenging undertakings worldwide, to provide tangible and original help to associations who support social campaigns.


This tour will, in fact, support 7 different associations, one for each stage: Emergency, Cesvi, Centro aiuti per l'Etiopia, Amici della Zizzi, Fondazione Ant, Casa delle donne, Coopi

50 professionals (photographers, journalists, video-makers), believe in this project and have devoted passion, time and efforts to make it a reality.

The objective is to present a unique and original map of humanity, focusing in particular on the eating habits of various nations. At the end of the journey, we will prepare a casket containing a book and a DVD where, through images and texts, one can see the whole world.

“The thousand-mile journey always begins with the first step” Lao Tze

The journey started last June and the first two stages have been successfully completed.

 

Italy – Kazakhstan (under-25 team)

Kazakhstan - China

Alaska - Panama

 

Our vehicles have now arrived in Alaska and the third team is travelling along the third stage.

You can follow the trip from Facebook 7mml

South Africa-Ethiopia and Ethiopia-Milan, two stages in need of support

“What you’ve never seen, is found where you’ve never been” (African saying)

Thanks to our sponsors’ commitment, and the help of several people, we’ve been able to plan most stages, but the last two trips need your help.

The journey will end in Milan anyway, in fact the campaign is Flexible Funding (you always get what you book) but it would be nice to have enough people on board to complete the project with ease.

Drawing from the experience gained in other journeys, we expect the two African travels to cost 16.000€ (just for customs, permits and fuel).

You will surely receive what you have booked  

To accommodate everyone’s needs, we offer packages at different prices. We want to point out that, whether we collect 16.000€ or not, the journey will be completed and you will receive what you have reserved, be it a postcard from Africa or a whole casket.

Share the travel

“Travels are the travelers” (Fernando Pessoa)

The more travelers we are, even only virtual ones, the more outlooks we can observe. Therefore we’d like you to follow us on our social networks (Facebook & Instagram), in order to interact with us.

www.7milamiglialontano.com

And even if you cannot help us financially, we would be grateful if you shared this campaign.

“I viaggi sono i viaggiatori” (Fernando Pessoa)
Più
viaggiatori siamo, anche solo virtuali,  più punti diversi possiamo
cogliere. Ci piacerebbe quindi ci seguiste sui nostri social (facebook ed
instagram) per poter interagire con noi    www.7milamiglialontano.com


E anche se non puoi aiutarci con il finanziamento ti saremo
comunque grati se tu potessi condividere questa campagna. 
ENG


7milamiglialontano (7 thousand miles
afar) is one journey, consisting of seven stages which differ in itinerary,
duration and places, but are united in one single intent, one objective: to
portray humanity.



The inspiration for this project
came to Giuliano Radici, a photographer who has been organizing challenging
undertakings worldwide, to provide tangible and original help to associations
who support social campaigns.

This tour will, in fact, support 7
different associations, one for each stage: Emergency, Cesvi,
Centro aiuti per l'Etiopia, Amici della Zizzi, Fondazione Ant, Casa delle
donne, Coopi 
50 professionals (photographers,
journalists, video-makers), believe in this project and have devoted passion,
time and efforts to make it a reality.
The objective is to present a unique
and original map of humanity, focusing in particular on the eating habits of
various nations. At the end of the journey, we will prepare a casket containing
a book and a DVD where, through images and texts, one can see the whole world.
“The thousand-mile journey always begins with the first step” Lao Tze
The journey started last June and
the first two stages have been successfully completed.
 
Italy –
Kazakhstan (under-25 team)
Kazakhstan - China
Alaska - Panama


 
Our vehicles
have now arrived in Alaska and the third team is travelling along the third
stage.
You can
follow the trip from Facebook 7mml
South Africa-Ethiopia and Ethiopia-Milan, two
stages in need of support
“What you’ve never seen, is found where you’ve
never been” (African saying)
Thanks to our sponsors’ commitment,
and the help of several people, we’ve been able to plan most stages, but the
last two trips need your help.
The journey will end in Milan
anyway, in fact the campaign is Flexible Funding (you always get what you book)
but it would be nice to have enough people on board to complete the project
with ease.
Drawing from the experience gained
in other journeys, we expect the two African travels to cost 16.000€ (just for
customs, permits and fuel).
You will surely receive what you have booked
 
To
accommodate everyone’s needs, we offer packages at different prices. We want to
point out that, whether we collect 16.000€ or not, the journey will be
completed and you will receive what you have reserved, be it a postcard from
Africa or a whole casket.
Share the travel
“Travels are the travelers” (Fernando Pessoa)
The more
travelers we are, even only virtual ones, the more outlooks we can observe.
Therefore we’d like you to follow us on our social networks (Facebook &
Instagram), in order to interact with us.

www.7milamiglialontano.com

And even if
you cannot help us financially, we would be grateful if you shared this
campaign.

story:
Look into the book here!

A photobook about the coincidental encounters and obliquities of everyday objects and collected fragments of aspects held by everyday life made by Maria L. Felixmüller and graphic designer Paul Bowler.

The Project:

I like to accomplish the photobook GLORY DAYS. I am Maria L. Felixmüller, a Leipzig based artist and photographer. GLORY DAYS got shortlisted for the Dummy Award of the Fotobookfestival Kassel 2013 and now, I want to make my project come true and publish it with your help.

The pictures: Never staged, always found!

The pictures express the coincidental encounters of everyday objects. They are more than they appear when they don’t function as they are supposed to. My observation exposes the objects' vulnerability and they seem comical and crazy. And because I get asked often: Nothing is staged, the objects just find me.

                                 

GLORY DAYS - a high gloss magazine picture book

Two years ago I startet concepting with graphic designer Paul Bowler. Editing followed just one rule: Every page should be a new confronting, confusing view. Out of every juxtaposition results an unexpected association, and we avoided repetition of motifs or even colour schemes. So it was clear to us that it should be a pure and simple book, much like a children's picture book. The only suspension are some black pages, where the index is hidden. We decided to show the pictures all over the pages, right from the first to the last. We wanted it to look like a magazine, so paper and cover have a high gloss shimmer. For the double page it is important to open the book easily, so it comes with American binding.

                


We need…

I hope to raise 4500€ by crowdfunding to cover 60% of the costs to produce GLORY DAYS. It'll cost 7300€ to realise the project, and to this point I already have 2000€. So preordering the book is one option, but honestly, anything will help to accomplish the goal of getting this project realised and will be hugely appreciated!!! And if you can't afford financial support, linking, liking or spreading is also a huge help.
If the goal won’t entirely be reached, the publication won’t happen and of course, you get your money back.

What for?

An edition of 300 books is planned. All raised money will be spent for color correction, printing and binding. Graphic designer Paul Bowler has been working for free to give the project a chance of getting realised and all the rewards will be paid for by myself.

The Rewards

All backers will be mentioned with GLORY DAYS!

Thank you postcards will be sent if the goal of 4000€ is reached by the end of January!

The book will be launched on 14th of March at the International Bookfair 2014 in Leipzig at mzin-Leipzig with a launch party and at the 19th of March at an exhibition of my work in Hamburg. Everybody is invited to celebrate with me!

Shortly after, towards the end of March, all books and book related rewards will be sent to you. We hate paying extra for shipping, so we included it for all rewards. Even for international shipping!

story:
¿Quiénes somos? / About us

Eduardo y Gabriela, Colombianos, de la ciudad de Bucaramanga. Soñadores insistidos, apasionados por la diversidad de culturas y naturaleza que hay en nuestro entorno, perseverantes y enamorados de la fotografía, así como mutuamente. Hace poco menos de dos años empezamos a hacer una serie de recorridos en nuestro país, a bordo de La Diabla, nuestra motocicleta, con la intención de conocer más profundamente y retratar las distintas idiosincrasias de nuestro país. En uno de estos viajes pensamos lo provechoso que sería para ampliar nuestros objetivos, dejar todo a un lado y conocer algunos rincones del continente. Desde ese momento la proyección de nuestro viaje se extendía cada vez más. Ya con un proyecto fotográfico en mente y pensando inicialmente en llegar hasta Perú, decidimos extender nuestro propósito y llegar a todos los rincones del continente. Comenzamos a trabajar, reducir gastos, vendimos accesorios, ropa y comida, buscamos cualquier ingreso para salir a nuestra aventura en la fecha propuesta: 18 de Noviembre de 2017; y así fue – aunque con un día de retraso. Ansiosos, llenos de expectativas y con una sonrisa que nada nos quitaba, empezamos con La Ruta de Fuego.

Eduardo Contreras (32): Motociclista, empírico apasionado por la fotografía y la naturaleza. Abogado de profesión. Deportista, soñador e insistido por cumplir sus metas. 

Gabriela González (22): Estudiante practicante de artes audiovisuales, apasionada por las expresiones artísticas con mensaje social, la fotografía y el dibujo. Soñadora, asombrada por la naturaleza. Sociable, alegre y emprendedora. 

We are Eduardo and Gabriela, two Colombians from the city of Bucaramanga. Passionate
dreamers and passionate about the difference and diversity of cultures and nature that
surround us, we love photography as much as we love each other. Less than 2 years ago we
started to travel around Colombia in our motorcycle, La Diabla), wanting to gain a deep
knowledge of the country’s idiosyncrasies. In one of those trips we thought that it will be
fruitful to amplify our objective, leave everything behind and travel around our continent.
Since that moment the idea of such journey got stuck in our minds. At first, we planned to
drive South and get to Peru, and then, we decided to make even bigger, it was to reach all
the corners of the continent. We started by getting jobs to save as much as we could, we
sold food, clothes and accessories. Tried everything we could to have everything we
needed to start our adventure in the planned date: november 18th of 2017; we did it- but on
the next day. Anxious, full of expectations and with a huge smile in our faces, we started
with 'La Ruta de Fuego' (The Route of Fire).


Eduardo Contreras (32): Rider, photographer by practice, passionate about capturing
images and about nature. Lawyer, Athlete, and crafter of his dreams.


Gabriela Gonzalez (22): Student of audiovisual arts on internship, mad about artistic
expressions with a social message, artist specialized on photography and drawing. A young
amazed by nature. Sociable, happy and enterprising.

NUESTRO PROYECTO / OUR PROJECT

LOS COLORES DEL SUR, en concreto, propone reunir fotografías de la belleza que nos encontramos en esta ruta, desarrollada a lo largo de todos los países Sur Americanos (exceptuando, lastimosamente, Venezuela por la situación actual del país) para mostrar con orgullo lo que somos, lo que nos diferencia y principalmente, lo que nos acerca, dejando a un lado cualquier debate social y político que se nos ha grabado de manera inconsciente. Y así, demostrar que las fronteras que nos dividen no son estructuras que separan, sino barreras mentales que nos distancian y debilitan.

El concepto de 'Los Colores del Sur' es un espacio en el que confluirá la representación de Sur América: su biodiversidad en paisajes, gente, agricultura y animales, de la mano con la armonía de los colores que cada espacio representa. De esta forma serán distribuidas las imágenes, por las paletas de colores y la sensación que genera cada espectro de color al verlo. 

-

The main purpose of 'Colors of the South', is to gather photographs of the beauty that
surrounds our route across South America on a Book (unfortunately omitting Venezuela
due its current situation) to show with pride what we are as South Americans, our
differences and especially, what unite us, leaving aside any social or political difference,
that might be unconsciously embedded in our minds. And in that way show that the borders
that divided us are not solid structures that can separate us, but just a mental just mental
construction.
The concept of 'The Colors of the South' is to have a space to show all that represents South
America: biodiversity in its landscapes, the people, agriculture and animals, and the
sensations that they cause on us. All distributed by a color harmony for each place.

Nuestra forma de solventar el viaje económicamente ha ido de la mano de la gente que nos permite entrar a su cotidianidad, abriéndonos las puertas para llevar a cabo nuestro trabajo de ventas (fotografías postales, comidas, entre otros) y los ahorros que reunimos antes de emprender el viaje. Ahora, después de 210 días de viaje, 13.000 km marcados por el tacómetro de nuestra moto y una serie de pérdidas inesperadas (pantalla del computador partida, un accidente en carretera, que no nos afectó a nosotros pero nos obligó sacar nuestro presupuesto para los arreglos de la motocicleta, y pequeños inconvenientes mecánicos) nos vemos en la necesidad de un apoyo que permita cumplir con la etapa de desarrollo de ‘LOS COLORES DEL SUR’.

-

We are living on the help that people is offering by opening their doors for us so we can do our
sales (post cards and food) and with the savings that we had before starting the trip. Now, after 210 days, with 13000 km on the odometer of our motorcycle, and some unexpected losses (as a broken pc screen, and an accident, that didn't affect our wellbeing, but it made us spend our emergency cash to fix the motorcycle, and work on some mechanical issues).
So we are on the need to ask for some support that will help us fullfill with 'The Colors of the South

¿POR QUÉ INDIEGOGO? / Why INDIEGOGO?

Seguros de que la cifra buscada en indiegogo no es para solventar el total de nuestros gastos, ya que continuaremos trabajando a lo largo de la ruta, acudimos a este medio por dos razones: la primera, queremos conseguir un lente gran angular (Lente Sigma 10-20mm F4-5.6) que tiene valor aproximado de $500 USD porque nos hemos encontrado en la necesidad de ampliar la vista a tantas cosas por capturar y a veces no es suficiente el equipo con el que contamos, y aunque es nuestra meta lograr la realización de ‘LOS COLORES DEL SUR’ con equipo promedio, adquirir este lente nos permitiría aumentar la calidad de nuestras imágenes, aprovechando así el impactante espacio que nos rodea; y la segunda, a lo largo de nuestro viaje por Bolivia tuvimos una serie de problemas mecánicos y el accidente mencionado anteriormente, que implicaron un gasto acelerado del ahorro de que teníamos. Ahora, entrando a los países con la gasolina más costosa (Brasil, Argentina, Uruguay y Chile) buscamos tener un respaldo.

De acuerdo a nuestra experiencia durante estos 7 meses y teniendo claro la forma en la que gastamos el dinero, concluimos que el mayor, y casi único gasto económico presentado es la gasolina, su precio en los diferentes países de Latinoamérica es muy irregular. Por galón (4 litros) desde $1,50 USD en Ecuador, hasta $6 USD en Brasil. Calculamos para la finalización de nuestro viaje, de acuerdo a que los precios se mantienen en línea aproximadamente, ($6 USD x galón) en los países restantes, un total aproximado de 20.000 km gastaría 73 tanques llenos, y da un total de $1.200 USD.

En ese órden de ideas, la forma en la que distribuiremos el dinero será entre adquirir el lente como prioridad y lo restante será nuestra reserva de gasolina. 

We are sure that the money we get in indiegogo isn’t for solving all our needs, and we’ll
continue working along the route. We came to this page for two reasons: first, we want to
get a wide aperture lens a Sigma 10-20mm F4-5.6 that has a value of approximately.
$500 USD. We feel in the need of making our view bigger, there’s so much things to show
and sometimes our kit is not good enough to make it, although we want to make ‘The
Colors of the South’ with basic equipment, getting this lens will make our quality higher.
The second reason is because while we were in Bolivia we got some mechanical issues and
the accident we already mentioned, which forced us to spend our money. And now, we will
be riding into countries where the gas is the most expensive (Brazil, Argentina, Uruguay
and Chile) we look for a support.


Based in our experience along this 7 months and knowing the way we spend money, we are
sure that our higher cost is the gas, it’s value in South America is very irregular. One
gallon (4 liters) can go from $1,50 USD in Ecuador, to $6 USD in Brazil. We calculate for
our travel’s financing, considering that the value keeps almost the same that in Brazil: with
a approximate of 20.000 km for73 gallons. It will have a cost of $1.200 USD total.


Therefore, the way we use your donations will be, first, to buy the lens, and the rest for gas
money.

 

INCENTIVOS / REWARDS

Como reconocimiento a las donaciones recibidas, serán entregadas fotografías digitales o impresas, camisetas del projecto, mención en los agradecimientos del libro o la copia de 'Los Colores del Sur'

Las recompensas que son enviadas tardarán algunos meses en ser recibidas ya que estando en la ruta no tenemos la facilidad para hacer envíos e impresiones. Y la publicación del libro, para quienes lo reciban, será en Junio de 2019.

-

The way we reward for your help will be with digital or printed pictures that you select, t-
shirts of the project, your name mention on the credits of the book, or even the book itself.


The physical rewards will take some time because being in the route is very difficult for us
to send deliveries and make good prints. And the publishing of the book will be on June of
2019.

NUESTROS RETOS / OUR CHALLENGES

En la medida que avanzábamos más y más fuera de nuestra zona de confort encontramos todo tipo de cambios, el primero y más notorio las carreteras que hemos recorrido hasta el momento las cuales han representaron un gran reto, al enfrentarnos a todo tipo de terrenos, desde las amplias vías ecuatorianas, pasando por el inclemente desierto peruano hasta alcanzar mayores alturas rodeadas de nevados sometidos a granizo o lluvia, a pistas destapadas de un solo carril poniendo a prueba nuestra pericia para no dejar nada al azar, aprendiendo así a conocer la resistencia y alcances de nuestra fortaleza mental y física, recibiendo como mayor recompensa estar rodeados de los mejores paisajes, los mismos que hacen impensable la idea de dar marcha a atrás y así continuar capturando y acumulando en nuestro archivo las gamas de colores q se nos presentan

Aún más significativo ha sido para nosotros el reto de aprender a desenvolvernos entre las diferentes culturas, ya que si bien con la mayoría de pueblos compartimos el mismo lenguaje, en otros casos no, como el caso del altiplano peruano y boliviano donde muchos hablan quechua, hasta nuestra actual ubicación en Brasil donde se habla el portugués, y como no solamente nos interesa el simple acto de transitar por un lugar, si no de compartir de manera ávida un contexto social diferente que nos permita retratar adecuadamente las maneras en que una persona o una comunidad se desenvuelve, nos sobran las ganas de aprender el idioma para comunicarnos debidamente, como adecuar nuestra forma para relacionarnos de mejor manera, permitiéndonos entablar una estrecha relación que nos permite plasmar de manera más cercana la realidad de lo que nuestros sentidos perciben.

Consideramos como un desafío para la ejecución de nuestro proyecto la clase de equipos con los que contamos, ya que hay momentos en los que se hace necesario un lente de mayor amplitud y luminosidad que permita aprovechar de mejor manera entornos de poca luz y de poco espacio focal.

Equipos con los que contamos:

Cámara canon EOS T3, Lente 50 mm F 1.8, Lente zoom EFS 55 – 250 mm 1:4 – 5.6, Lente zoom EFS 18 – 55 mm 1:3.5 – 5.6, Cámara Gopro Hero 4

At the time that we go far away from our comfort zone, find all kind of changes, the first
and notorious are the roads that we go that have represent a big challenge. Starting with
the huge Ecuadorian highways, then the ruthless desert in Peru that guided us to the top of
snowy peaks, riding on hailstorms and hard rain. We also got into one-way unpaved roads,
all this make us prove our physic and mental resistance, getting the reward of enjoying the
best landscapes, the ones that made us think of the impossibility of going quitting. This way
we will attain all the color spectrum that passes in front of us.


The most meaningful thing for us has been the challenge of learning to delve into the
different cultures. On mostly of which our language is spoken, but in other places in Peru,
Bolivia they speak Quechua, the traditional Inca language, and Portuguese in Brazil. We
do not want just to get in and out of the places that we visit, but to explore in to the context
so we can truly capture the things that we get to discover.

Our photography kit: Camera CANON EOS T3, 50mm F1.8 Lens, 55 – 250mm 1:4 – 5.6 Zoom Lens EFS, 18-55mm 1:3.5 – 5.6 Zoom EFS Lens, Camera Gopro Hero 4.

GRACIAS / THANK YOU

Si no tienes la oportunidad de apoyar económicamente esta idea, puedes hacerlo compartiendo esta campaña a todos aquellos que conozcas y tengan interés en fomentar el desarrollo de este proyecto pensado con mucho cariño, en el que pesar de los retos que se nos presentan, contamos con el ímpetu para sacar adelante y exponer abiertamente las cualidades que conforman la biodiversidad en estas tierras del sur.

-

If you don’t have the opportunity to help on this Project with money, you can share the
campaign with everybody you know who may be interested. We think the on this Project
with a lot of love and we are very happy of being in this point of it. We are sure that our
strength will make us go through any challenge and finally show to you all the diverse
beauty of South America’s countries.

-
